					</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Cloud Computing For Beginners?]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/cloud-computing-for-beginners/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 06 Apr 2022 21:00:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=488</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cloud computing is the provision of computing services (including servers, storage, databases, networking, software, analytics, and intelligence) - providing rapid innovation, elastic resources, and economies of scale over the Internet (the cloud). With cloud services, you typically only pay for what you use, helping to reduce operating costs, make your infrastructure run more efficiently, and be able to adjust your business.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>The biggest advantage of cloud computing</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cloud computing is a major shift for enterprises to abandon the traditional thinking of IT resources. Here are 7 common reasons organizations turn to cloud computing services:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Cost</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cloud computing frees you from the capital investment required to buy hardware and software and to set up and run an on-site data center, including server racks, 24/7 power for efficiency and cooling, and IT specialists to manage the infrastructure. It also increases speed.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Speed</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cloud computing services are provided as on-demand self-service, so massive computing resources can often be provisioned in minutes with just a few mouse clicks, giving businesses great flexibility and taking the stress out of capacity planning.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Global zoom</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The advantages of cloud computing services include elastic scalability. For the cloud, this means being able to provide the right amount of IT resources, such as more or less computing power, storage space, bandwidth, from the right geographic location when needed.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>work efficiency</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>On-site data centers often require a lot of "racks and stacks" - hardware setup, software patches, and other time-consuming IT management chores. Cloud computing avoids most of these tasks, freeing IT teams to spend their time achieving more important business goals.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Performance</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Largest cloud services run on a global network of secure data centers that are regularly upgraded to the latest fast and efficient computing hardware. Compared to a single enterprise data center, it provides several benefits, including reduced network latency for applications and improved economics of scaling.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Reliability</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cloud computing simplifies data backup, disaster recovery, and business continuity at a lower cost because data can be mirrored at multiple redundant sites in the cloud provider's network</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Safety</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Many cloud providers offer a wide range of policies, techniques, and controls for improving the overall security posture, which help protect data, applications, and infrastructure from potential threats.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Types of cloud computing</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Not all clouds are the same, and no one cloud is right for everyone. To help provide the right solution to meet customer needs, a number of different models, types and services have been developed.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>First, you need to determine the type of cloud development, or cloud computing infrastructure, based on which cloud services will be implemented. There are three different approaches to deploying cloud computing resources: public cloud, private cloud, and hybrid cloud.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong><strong>Public Cloud</strong></strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Public clouds are owned and operated by third-party cloud service providers who provide their computing resources (such as servers and storage space) over the Internet. In the public cloud, all hardware, software, and other supporting infrastructure are owned and managed by the cloud provider. Use the web browser to access these services and manage your account. .</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>Private Cloud</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A private cloud refers to cloud computing resources dedicated to the use of a business or organization. A private cloud can actually sit on top of a company's on-site data center. there are Some companies also pay third-party service providers to host their private clouds. In the private cloud, services and infrastructure are maintained on a private network.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>Hybrid Cloud</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Hybrid clouds combine public and private clouds, tying them together through technologies that allow data and applications to be shared between them. Hybrid clouds allow data and applications to move between private and public clouds, giving you more flexibility in your business and more deployment options, helping you optimize your existing infrastructure, security, and compliance.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Types of cloud services: SaaS, IaaS, PaaS, and serverless</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Four broad categories of Most cloud computing services : Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), Serverless, and Software as a Service (SaaS). They are sometimes called cloud computing "stacks" because they build upon each other. Understanding these services and the differences between them can make it easier for you to achieve your business goals.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Software as a Service (SaaS)</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Software as a Service (SaaS) is a method of delivering software applications over the Internet, usually on-demand on a subscription basis. With SaaS, the cloud provider hosts and manages the software applications and infrastructure, and is responsible for maintenance such as software upgrades and security patches. Users (usually using a phone, tablet, or web browser on a PC) connect to the application over the Internet.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Common SaaS Scenarios</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you use a web-based email service (such as Outlook, Hotmail, or Yahoo! Mail), you're already using a form of SaaS. Using these services, you can log in to your account over the Internet (usually from a web browser). Email software resides on the service provider's network, and your mail is stored there. You can access your email and saved messages from a web browser on any Internet-connected computer or mobile device.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For organizational use, productivity applications such as email, collaboration, and calendaring, as well as advanced business applications such as customer relationship management (CRM), enterprise resource planning (ERP), and document management, can be rented. You can pay for use of these apps on a subscription basis or based on usage level.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Advantages of SaaS</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Advanced applications are available. You don't need to buy, install, update, or maintain any hardware, middleware, or software to deliver SaaS applications to users. SaaS enables businesses that lack the resources to purchase, deploy, and manage the necessary infrastructure and software on their own to use highly advanced enterprise applications such as ERP and CRM.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Pay only for what you use. And because the SaaS service will automatically scale up and down based on usage levels, you'll also save money.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Free client software. Users can run most SaaS applications directly from their web browsers without downloading and installing any software (some applications require plug-ins). This means that you don't need to buy and install special software for your users.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Easily enhance employee mobility. SaaS allows you to easily enhance employee "mobility" because users can access SaaS applications and data from any Internet-connected computer or mobile device. There's no need to think about developing your app to run on different types of computers and devices, because the service provider has already done that. In addition, there is no need to learn specialized knowledge to deal with the security concerns of mobile computing. A carefully chosen service provider will keep your data safe, regardless of the type of device that uses your data.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Access app data from anywhere. Once data is stored in the cloud, users can access their information from any Internet-connected computer or mobile device. And by storing app data in the cloud, no data is lost in the event of a user's computer or mobile device failure.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The most basic category of cloud computing services. With IaaS, you rent IT infrastructure, such as servers and virtual machines (VMs), storage, networking, and operating systems, from a service provider on a pay-as-you-go basis.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>Platform as a Service (PaaS)</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Platform as a Service (PaaS) refers to cloud computing services that provide the environment needed to develop, test, deliver, and manage software applications on demand. PaaS is designed to make it easier for developers to quickly create web or mobile applications without having to worry about setting up or managing the server, storage, network, and database infrastructure necessary for development.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>Serverless computing</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Overlapped using PaaS, serverless computing focuses on building application functionality without spending time continuing to manage the servers and infrastructure required to manage it. The cloud supplier handles setup, space planning, and managing the server for you. Serverless architectures are highly scalable and event-driven, and resources are only used when certain functions or events occur.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Use cloud computing</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:cover {"url":"https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Cloud-Computing-3-1024x536.webp","id":492,"dimRatio":50,"isDark":false,"style":{"color":{}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-cover is-light"><span aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-cover__gradient-background has-background-dim"></span><img class="wp-block-cover__image-background wp-image-492" alt="cloud computing is behind the scenes that makes it all possible." src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Cloud-Computing-3-1024x536.webp" data-object-fit="cover"/><div class="wp-block-cover__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"base-3","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-base-3-color has-text-color has-large-font-size">Cloud computing is behind the scenes that makes it all possible.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:cover -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><a href="https://techodu.com/what-to-see-when-buying-gaming-phones/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Chances are you're using cloud computing right now, even if you don't realize it.</a> When you use online services to send emails, edit documents, watch movies or TV, listen to music, play games, or store pictures and other files, it's likely that cloud computing is behind the scenes that makes it all possible. Although cloud computing services have been around for less than 10 years, organizations ranging from small startups to global corporations, government agencies, non-profits are actively adopting the technology for a variety of reasons.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Here are a few examples of what is possible using cloud services provided by cloud providers:</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Create cloud-native applications</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Faster build, deploy and scale applications (web, mobile, and API). Leverage cloud-native technologies and methodologies such as containers, Kubernetes, microservices architecture, API-driven communication, and DevOps.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Build and test the application</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5>Reduce application development costs and save time with a cloud infrastructure that can easily scale up or down.</h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Store, backup and restore data</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5>Transferring data over the Internet to an <a href="https://www.techtarget.com/searchstorage/definition/cloud-storage" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">offline cloud storage system</a> accessible from any location and any device reduces the cost of protecting data (when massively scaled).</h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>analyze data</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Unify data across teams, departments, and locations in the cloud. Then use cloud services such as machine learning and artificial intelligence to uncover insights and make smarter decisions.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Stream audio and video</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Connect with your audience anytime, anywhere, from any device, with globally distributed high-definition video and audio.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Embedded intelligence</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Using intelligent models can help engage customers and uncover valuable insights from captured data.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>software on demand</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>On-demand software, also known as software as a service (SaaS), provides customers with the latest software versions and updates anytime, anywhere.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Best SSD Solid State Drive for gaming (Laptop-Mac-ps5-ps4)]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/the-best-ssd-solid-state-drive-recommendation/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 10 Apr 2022 09:01:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=506</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you want the best gaming PC or laptop, or just want a fast-producing machine, it's important to find the best SSD (Solid State Drive) for your needs. A slow storage drive creates a big bottleneck, forcing your CPU processor to sit there shuffling its clock cycles, waiting for data. For faster reads and writes, you need a fast SSD. That's why we test dozens of drives every year and highlight the best SSDs here.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Choose the best SSD for you</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Since drives like Adata's recent Falcon M.2, Intel 660p, and its successor, the Intel 665p, undercut mainstream drives on older, slower SATA interfaces, this could be the beginning of the end for our old friend Serial ATA. But companies are still doing new things with SATA, like Team Group's massive 15.3 TB drives. The price of existing SATA drives must also continue to drop in order to compete at least on price, as they do not want to match the performance-wise of NVMe drives.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You've probably heard of the lightning-fast next-generation PCIe 4.0 M.2 SSDs from companies like Gigabyte, Corsair, Patriot, and more. These drives do increase sequential speeds significantly (due to doubling the PCIe bus bandwidth), making them the best SSD Solid State choice for those who need the fastest speeds. For example, the Samsung 980 PRO has read and write speeds of 7,000 and 5,000 MBps, respectively, while Phison's upcoming second-gen controller promises 7,400/7000 MBps. However, to take advantage of today's super-fast speeds, you'll need an X570 motherboard or one of the newer B550 motherboards to run one of the drives at top speed.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Many new Intel Z490 motherboards also technically support PCIe 4.0. But to take advantage of the feature, you'll have to wait for Intel to deliver its next-generation Rocket Lake CPUs for increased PCIe 4.0 speeds.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>When choosing an SSD solid state drive, keep the following in mind:</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Choose a compatible interface (M.2 PCIe, SATA, add-in cards): Check your user manual or a database like Crucial Memory Finder to determine what type of SSD your computer supports.<br>256GB to 512GB: Don't worry about getting an SSD solid state drive smaller than 256GB. For most users, 512GB offers a good balance between price and capacity. But 1TB drives are getting cheaper, and 2TB drives are now affordable.<br>SATA is slowest: SATA isn't as fast as M.2 PCIe or PCIe add-in cards, but most desktops and many laptops can use 2.5" SATA drives, and many users doing typical mainstream tasks won't notice anyhow, these days The difference between the SATA drives and the faster PCIe models.<br>Best SSD Recommendations:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>1. Samsung 980 Pro</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":524,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/SSD-Samsung-980-PRO-techodu-1-1024x632.webp" alt="" class="wp-image-524"/><figcaption>Best Overall/Best M.2 SSD</figcaption></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Capacity: 250GB, 500GB, 1TB, 2TB | Form factor: M.2 2280 single-sided | Transport interface/protocol: PCIe 4.0 x4 / NVMe 1.3c | Sequential read/write: 7,000 MBps / 5,000 MBps | Warranty/Endurance : Five years / up to 1,200 TBW</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Unmatched PCIe Gen4 Performance</li><li>AES 256-bit encryption</li><li>Black PCB</li><li>5-year warranty</li><li>average endurance rating</li><li>expensive</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For those looking for the best option, the Samsung 980 PRO has it all. Samsung paired its in-house Elpis 8nm PCIe 4.0 x4 NVMe SSD controller with the company's fastest V-NAND to unleash incredible performance.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The Samsung 980 Pro delivers up to 7/5 GBps of throughput and can sustain 1 million random read/write IOPS, making it the most responsive SSD solid state drive we've tested. This drive has all the features a high-end NVMe SSD might need, making it the ideal drive for those who want the best.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>2. Kingston KC3000</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":523,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/SSD-Kingston-KC3000-techodu-1-1024x615.webp" alt="" class="wp-image-523"/><figcaption>Fastest Solid State Drive</figcaption></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Specification</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Capacity: 512GB, 1TB, 2TB, 4TB</li><li>Form Factor: M.2 2280 Double-Sided</li><li>Transmission interface/protocol: PCIe 4.0 x4 / NVMe 1.4</li><li>Sequential read/write: 7,000 MBps / 7,000 MBps</li><li>Warranty/Durability: Five years/up to 3,200 TBW</li><li>Reason for purchase</li><li>Fast PCIe 4.0 performance and cool operation</li><li>attractive design</li><li>5 year warranty and high durability rating</li><li>reasons to avoid</li><li>expensive</li><li>high power usage</li><li>Lack of AES hardware encryption</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you're looking for the fastest SSD on the market, Kingston's KC3000 fits the bill, especially now that Intel has stopped making Optane products. The KC3000 is a high-performance PCIe 4.0 x4 NVMe SSD solid state drive that delivers up to 7 GBps read and write throughput and leading-edge speeds of up to 1 million IOPS.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Similar to the Seagate FireCuda 530 and Corsair MP600 Pro XT, the Kingston KC3000 is powered by a Phison PS5018-E18 paired with Micron's 176-layer TLC flash memory. However, the KC3000's flash speed of 1,600 MTps is faster than the MP600's 1,200 MTps, giving it a tactical advantage.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The 2TB Kingston KC3000 outperforms the Samsung 980 Pro in durability and performance, but at the cost of efficiency. This means less battery life for laptop applications. The KC3000 is also not equipped with OPAL-compliant AES <a href="https://sourcedaddy.com/aplus/hardware-based-encryption-devices.html" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">hardware encryption</a> but instead comes in a double-sided form factor for higher capacity. That means the KC3000 might not be the best choice for your mobile device, but it's a great  SSD solid state drive for those building a high-end gaming desktop or workstation for productivity.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>3. Western Digital Black Drive WD_Black SN850</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":520,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/SSD-wd-black-techodu-1-1024x536.webp" alt="Best-SSD-for-Gaming" class="wp-image-520"/><figcaption>                                                              Best M.2 SSD Alternatives</figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Capacity: 250GB, 500GB, 1TB, 2TB | Form Factor: M.2 2280 single-sided | Transport Interface/Protocol: PCIe 4.0 x4 / NVMe 1.4 | Sequential Read/Write: 7,000 MBps / 5,300 MBps | Warranty/Endurance: 5 years / up to 1,200 TBW</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Competitive performance</li><li>Large dynamic SLC cache</li><li>black PCB</li><li>5 year warranty</li><li>High idle power consumption on benchtop test bench</li><li>AES 256-bit encryption is not supported</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The Samsung 980 PRO wins the top pick for next-gen PCIe 4.0 x4 NVMe with its ultra-fast random performance, more consistent write profile, and higher efficiency, while WD's Black SN850 is the top runner-up. Depending on the price, you can't go wrong with a high-end gaming or workstation version. Western Digital's Black SN850, combined with the company's new 16nm WD Black G2 PCIe 4.0 x4 NVMe 1.4 SSD controller, marks a substantial improvement in the company's SSD solid state drive architecture. Western Digital Black SN850 has the ability to maintain speeds up to 7/5.3 GBps and deliver very responsive random performance, making the SSD our top pick. Although, this comes at the cost of high idle power consumption on our benchtop test bench. Western Digital Black SN850 lacks AES 256-bit encryption.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>M.2 PCIe NVMe drives</strong><br>These little rectangular drives look like RAM, only smaller. They are usually 80mm long x 22mm wide and are described as size 2280, but some sizes may be shorter or longer, so make sure you get one that matches the slot. You can get SATA-capable M.2 drives, but most modern desktops and laptops with M.2 slots support the faster PCIe NVMe standard.<br>Best Value PCIe 4.0 M.2 SSD: Adata XPG Gammix S50 Lite</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>4. ADATA XPG Gammix S50 Lite</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":525,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/techodu.com-3-1024x683.webp" alt="" class="wp-image-525"/><figcaption>                                                              Great Value PCIe 4.0 M.2 SSD</figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><br>Capacity: 1TB, 2TB | Form Factor: M.2 2280 Duplex | Transport Interface/Protocol: PCIe 4.0 x4 / NVMe 1.4 | Sequential Read/Write: 3,900 MBps/3,200 MBps | Warranty/Endurance: 5 Years/Up to 1,480TBW</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>show competition</li><li>beautiful design</li><li>affordable price</li><li>Large dynamic write cache</li><li>AES 256-bit full disk encryption</li><li>5 year warranty</li><li>Out-of-cache writes are slow</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Adata's XPG SX8200 Pro has been the best value SSD in its class for quite some time, but Adata's XPG Gammix S50 Lite has undoubtedly become one of the best value SSDs on the market. It's not quite as fast as some of its PCIe Gen4 rivals, but it does beat many of the best PCIe Gen3 SSDs available, and it's packed with features. Plus, it stays cool with stylish brushed aluminum heatsinks and has a higher durability rating than the Samsung 980 PRO.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Visit: <a href="https://techodu.com/what-to-see-when-buying-gaming-phones/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Gaming Phone Specs</a></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>5. SK Hynix Gold P31</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Best M.2 SSDs for Laptops<br>Capacity: 500GB, 1TB | Form Factor: M.2 2280 single-sided | Transport Interface/Protocol: PCIe 3.0 x4 / NVMe 1.3 | Sequential Read/Write: 3,500 MBps/3,200 MBps | Warranty/Endurance: 5 Years/Up to 750TBW</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>top performance</li><li>unprecedented efficiency</li><li>AES 256-bit encryption</li><li>Capacity up to 1TB</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>SK hynix's Gold P31 took the lead in becoming the market leader, becoming the first retail SSD product released with 128L NAND flash memory. As SK hynix's latest NAND achieves amazing bit density, Gold P31 hits the market at an extremely low price. Listed at $75 and $135 for 500GB and 1TB models, respectively, the Gold P31's great value will make you think twice, costing $25 to $50 more on the Samsung 970 EVO Plus.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The Gold P31 from SK Hynix is ideal for those looking to increase the storage capacity of their laptop, not only to increase the capacity but also to extend the battery life. While Adata's SX8200 Pro performs well against the Gold P31 in benchmarks, the SK Hynix is more power-efficient, which will result in longer charging times. But while the Adata is the best choice for desktops and the SK Hynix is the best choice for notebooks, the Gold P31's strong write performance and super efficiency make it the best choice for many other users.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Laptop users who don't need more than 1TB of storage and prioritize battery life should definitely put the new SK Hynix Gold P31 on their list of priorities.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>6. Samsung 970 EVO Plus</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":526,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Samsung-970-EVO-Plus-1024x536.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-526"/><figcaption>                                                          Best Performance PCIe 3.0 M.2 SSD</figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Capacity: 250GB, 500GB, 1TB, 2TB | Form Factor: M.2 2280 single-sided | Transport Interface/Protocol: PCIe 3.0 x4 / NVMe 1.3 | Sequential Read/Write: 3,500 MBps / 3,200 MBps | Warranty/Endurance: 5 years / up to 1,200 TBW</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Overall solid performance</li><li>black PCB</li><li>excellent package</li><li>Further efficiency optimizations can be used</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We were impressed with the Samsung 970 EVO Plus. Like the Western Digital Black SN750, Samsung's drive comes with the same controller as its predecessor. But instead of using the same flash, Samsung decided to make some changes with its new 9x-tier flash. Just as flash memory stacks to new heights, so does performance. The resulting drive lives up to its name: the Large Plus.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As the first retail SSD to market with Samsung's latest 9x-tier flash memory, the Samsung 970 E<br>The VO Plus offers the same performance as the 970 EVO, plus more. The drive has consistently proven to have the strongest write performance on the market and can handle tough workloads. In some tests, it even beat Samsung's own 970 PRO, which is quite a feat considering the PRO Plus is Samsung's workhorse for workstation-class apps.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>7. Team Group T-Force Cardea Zero Z340</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Best Value M.2 SSD Alternatives<br>Capacity: 256GB, 512GB, 1TB Form factor: M.2 2280 single-sided | Transport interface/protocol: PCIe 3.0 x4 / NVMe 1.3 | Sequential read/write: 3,400 MBps / 3,000 MBps | Warranty/Endurance: 5 years/ Up to 1,665 TBW</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Competitive price, performance and efficiency</li><li>5-Year Warranty and Best-in-Class Durability Ratings</li><li>The head spreader is very flexible</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Team Group's T-Force Cardea Zero Z340 SSD solid state drive isn't more expensive than most entry-level M.2 SSDs. Still, thanks to the latest mainstream hardware, it's a solid option for gamers looking to spend some money on their budget for a more consistent, reliable option.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The drive offers a solid option, and it's a good option for those planning on their next PC. It's a responsive solid-state drive that doesn't just deliver multi-gigabyte performance; it has killer endurance ratings under its five-year warranty. Plus, it features smooth graphene and copper tabs that can handle heavy lifting without overheating, even when there is no airflow in the test system. If you want to use a heatsink on the M.2, the tabs won't stop it like the heatsinks on some SSDs like Patriot's Viper series.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In our examination, we found that the combination of the Phison E12S controller and Micron 96L flash performed fairly well. Notably, this drive offers faster performance than the older hardware powering the Seagate FireCuda 510, and it's also more efficient. But it's not the best.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>8. Patriot Viper VPR100</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The best RGB M.2 SSD<br>Capacity: 256GB, 512GB, 1TB, 2TB Form factor: M.2 2280 double-sided with heatsink | Transport Interface/Protocol: PCIe 3.0 x4 / NVMe 1.3 | Sequential Read/Write: 3,300 MBps / 2,900 MBps | Warranty/Endurance Sex: 5 years / 1600 TBW</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Stable performance and top-notch endurance</li><li>Attractive RGB lighting and heatsink</li><li>Capacity up to 2TB</li><li>lowercase cache</li><li>Certain lighting settings may affect performance</li><li>No SSD toolbox or cloning software</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>When we first learned about the Viper VPR100, we were a little concerned about its performance. Not only is it less rated than most Phison E12-based SSDs, but the company says it will run slower at various RGB settings.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>However, the drive showed no such issues on our ASRock X570 Taichi test bench when we ran it at various lighting settings. In fact, with default lighting enabled, it sometimes even outperformed the MyDigitalSSD BPX Pro by exceeding its rated specs.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The integrated heat shield not only greatly adds to the Viper VPR100's aesthetics, but it also keeps the SSD solid state drive cool under any workload. The LEDs also didn't add any noticeable heat output.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>So no matter what your style is, you don't have to worry about your choice. If you're building a full RGB rig or just want to add some color to a new gaming system, the Viper VPR100 will definitely light up everything.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>9.</strong> <strong>Sabrent Rocket Q</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Best Large Capacity M.2 SSD<br>Capacity: 500GB, 1TB, 2TB, 4TB, 8TB | Form Factor: M.2 2280 double-sided | Transport Interface/Protocol: PCIe 3.0 x4 / NVMe 1.3 | Sequential Read/Write: 3,300 MBps / 2,900 MBps | Warranty/Endurance Sex: 5 years (after registration) / up to 1800 TBW</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Highest capacity M.2 SSD</li><li>Competitive Performance and Efficiency</li><li>software support</li><li>Up to five years warranty</li><li>expensive</li><li>Slow write speed after write cache fills up</li><li>Low persistence per GB compared to TLC</li><li>Possibly throttling without cooling</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Sabrent's 8TB Rocket Q slot is the industry's highest capacity M.2 NVMe SSD. This diminutive monster is obviously best for on-the-go data hoarders, but at $1,500, it will set you back to a decent gaming laptop. Not only does this drive increase the capacity of an ultra-thin M.2 SSD solid state drive to some of the highest we've ever seen; it also delivers outstanding performance and efficiency, thanks to the all-new Phison E12S controller and 96-layer QLC flash.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>QLC flash does have its drawbacks such as lower endurance and slower write performance after the SLC write cache fills up during large file transfers, but the Phison E12S controller helps push the Rocket Q to what we see from QLC drives the fastest performance.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>10. WD Blue SN570</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The best DRAM-less M.2 SSD</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Specification</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Capacity: 250GB, 500GB, 1TB</li><li>Dimensions: M.2 2280 single-sided</li><li>Transmission interface/protocol: PCIe 3.1 x4 / NVMe 1.3</li><li>Sequential read/write: 3,500 MBps / 3,000 MBps</li><li>Warranty/Durability: 5 years / up to 1,200 TBW</li><li>Reason for purchase</li><li>Competitive price and performance</li><li>Single-sided PCBs in various capacities</li><li>software support</li><li>5 years warranty</li><li>reasons to avoid</li><li>Small SLC cache and weak sustained write speed</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>WD's Blue SN570 is a solid choice for mainstream builders putting together new systems and even gamers on a budget. Thanks to its BiCS5 TLC flash memory and improved NVMe SSD solid state drive controller design, the Blue SN570 delivers excellent performance in most consumer jobs.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This pairing resulted in a 40% improvement in sequential performance and solid gains in 4KB random read workloads, putting it on par with Samsung's 980. However, at a lower price than the Samsung 980, and also offering a solid warranty, support software, and a decent endurance rating, the WD Blue SN570 is a better value.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>SATA hard drive<br>You can use M.2 form factor SATA drives, but most SATA drives are 2.5-inch models so they fit into the same bays as laptop hard drives. SATA drives are the cheapest, but still the most popular.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>11. Samsung 870 EVO</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Best Consumer SATA SSD</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Specification</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Capacity: 250GB, 500GB, 1TB, 2TB, 4TB</li><li>Dimensions: 2.5" 7mm</li><li>Transmission interface/protocol: SATA 6Gbps / AHCI</li><li>Sequential read/write: up to 560 MBps / 530 MBps</li><li>Warranty/Durability: 5 years / up to 2,400 TBW</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Reason for purchase</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Reliable and Responsive Architecture</li><li>attractive aesthetics</li><li>AES 256-bit encryption</li><li>Capacity up to 4TB</li><li>5 years warranty</li><li>software suite</li><li>reasons to avoid</li><li>Premium</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Samsung Regularly shows us that it has the best SATA SSDs on the market. Following in the footsteps of its predecessors, the 870 EVO dominates with best-in-class performance, great power efficiency, and all the features you'd expect from a SATA SSD.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>While not as durable as the PRO models, the 870 EVO offers enough durability for most users. Whether you're a gamer or a prosumer, there's up to 4TB of usable capacity to meet almost any need. You don't need to look for a better SATA SSD - it's your best choice.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>12. Micron MX500</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Best Consumer SATA SSD Alternatives<br>Capacity: 250GB, 500GB, 1TB, 2TB | Form Factor: 2.5" 7mm | Transport Interface/Protocol: SATA 3/AHCI | Sequential Read/Write: Up to 560 MBps/510 MBps | Warranty/Endurance: 5 Years/ Up to 700 TBW</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>mainstream performance</li><li>competitive price</li><li>Comes with SSD toolbox and cloning software</li><li>Host power failure protection • Hardware AES-256 encryption</li><li>TCG Opal 2.0 SED support</li><li>The smaller capacity is slightly slower than the larger capacity</li><li>Design can use a makeover</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you don't want to shell out the big bucks for an NVMe-style product, but still want beefy SATA performance, the MX500 is a solid choice. A replacement for the Samsung 860 EVO, it offers similar performance and has a long history of reliability. Usually priced to sell, the MX500 is the best value for any capacity you need.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Named MX500, this M.2 SSD solid state hard drive is not far from 2.5-inch products. In addition to reading and writing speeds exceeding 500MB/s, it also has excellent durability and security, including integrated power-off protection. and other functions, even if there is a sudden power failure or a slight collision, the data will not be damaged. In addition, its extremely small size is also convenient for installation, which is a simple and convenient entry-level model for users who have not tried M.2 SSD.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>However, because the SATA3.0 line is used, the file reading and writing speed is much slower than the PCIe Gen3 model, and not all motherboards support it. Therefore, It is recommended to confirm the plug-in of the home computer before purchasing. slot specifications to avoid incompatibilities.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>13. Samsung 860 PRO</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":528,"sizeSlug":"full","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Samsung-860-PRO-techodu.jpg" alt="SSD-solid-state-drive" class="wp-image-528"/><figcaption>                                                                Best Prosumer SATA SSD</figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Capacity: 256GB, 512GB, 1TB, 2TB, 4TB | Form Factor: 2.5" 7mm | Transport Interface/Protocol: SATA 3/AHCI | Sequential Read/Write: 560 MBps/530 MBps | Warranty/Endurance: 5 Years /Up to 4,800 TBW</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Highest SATA performance for sustained workloads</li><li>high endurance</li><li>consistent performance</li><li>SSD toolbox and cloning software including TCG Opal, eDrive encryption support</li><li>very expensive</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Bound by the SATA interface, but still need the absolute maximum durability and performance? As the pinnacle of SATA performance, Samsung's 860 PRO is an SSD worth buying.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Like the Samsung 970 PRO, the 860 PRO uses Samsung's 64L MLC V-NAND, which helped propel it to the top of the charts in our benchmarks and delivered some incredible endurance figures. So you can get up to 4TB of capacity, while battery life can go up to 4,800 TBW. But the 860 PRO is three times the price of a typical mainstream SATA SSD, so it's primarily aimed at businesses with deep pockets.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Best Printer Specs for Home and Office Use]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/best-printer-specs/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Apr 2022 13:08:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=532</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading {"level":1} -->
<h1><strong>Best Printer Specs</strong></h1>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You must see the Printer Specs. Whether it is working from home or a general family, you often need to prepare some documents, not to mention the office where you often need to print written materials and proposals to clients. In addition, if you have children at home, you sometimes need to do electronic homework. The picture book and other materials are printed out. Now, as long as a printer is prepared, the pictures, tables, and texts on the computer and other devices can be printed out in real-time, which is very fast and convenient.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you go to a consumer electronics store, you will find printers from various manufacturers, such as Epson, Canon, Lenovo, HP, Brother, etc. all have different features and price points, some not only have continuous ink supply, Wi-Fi There are so many types of connections, even faxing and scanning, that you often don't know how to choose.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This time, we will explain the tips for buying printers from different aspects such as types and inks  and select 5 products with their own characteristics to recommend to you. I hope everyone can find the most suitable printer for their own use.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>Best</strong> <strong>Printer selection points</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>HP DeskJet 3755</li><li>HP LaserJet Pro M15w</li><li>Brother HL-L2395DW</li><li>HP LaserJet Pro M17w Mini Laser Printer</li><li>Canon Color imageClass LBP622Cdw</li><li>Canon CP1300 wireless color photo printing artifact</li><li>HP HP Officejet7110 A3+ Color Inkjet High-Speed ​​Printer</li><li>Epson Expression Photo XP-970</li><li>Brother MFC-J895</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Printer selection points</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Since everyone's needs for printers are not the same, please be sure to purchase a suitable model according to the purpose. Whether it is work that requires a lot of printing, or is it placed at home to facilitate family work and study, etc.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Next, we will explain some points that need to be paid attention to when choosing printer specs. You can refer to these points to find the style that best meets your requirements.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Choose the right printing method</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Printers used by consumers are roughly divided into "inkjet printers" and "laser printers". What are the differences between these two types and what kind of users are they suitable for? Let's keep reading!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>"Inkjet Printer" for Printing Illustrations and Photos</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:cover {"url":"https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Inkjet-Printer-specs-techodu-1024x576.jpg","id":541,"dimRatio":50,"style":{"color":{}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-cover"><span aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-cover__gradient-background has-background-dim"></span><img class="wp-block-cover__image-background wp-image-541" alt="Best printer specs" src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Inkjet-Printer-specs-techodu-1024x576.jpg" data-object-fit="cover"/><div class="wp-block-cover__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-large-font-size"><strong><strong>Inkjet Printer" for Printing Illustrations and Photos</strong></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:cover -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For the average consumer, the most common contact should be the inkjet printer specs. Since the technology of this type of product is very mature, many types of additional functions have been derived for consumers to choose from. The biggest feature is the use of black and the other three primary color inks to print color patterns. , the color will be very accurate and detailed, and the entry-level products are very cheap, which is the most popular model for ordinary families.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>However, although the price of the printer itself is very affordable, the ink, which is a consumable item, will wear out quickly during continuous large-scale printing. If it is not used for a long time, it will dry up the agglomeration, causing the nozzle to be blocked, and it needs to be cleaned frequently, so before buying Be sure to factor in the cost of ink.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>So when printing a lot, it may be more expensive if you compare the total cost of the host and ink cartridges.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you want to cut costs, be sure to compare the prices of the ink cartridges and the main unit when you buy</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>"Laser printer" suitable for printing a large number of documents</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The principle of a laser printer is to use light scanning and a power-on to allow the toner to adhere to a specific area of ​​the photocopying paper, presenting patterns and text that have been pre-processed on a computer or other device. , but in recent years, laser printers can also be seen in the consumer market after miniaturization.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Although the price of laser printers is usually higher than that of inkjet printers, the printed products are not as easy to smudge when exposed to water as inkjet printers, and in terms of cost, the number of finished products that can be printed by a toner cartridge Far more than ink cartridges, if it is often necessary to photocopy a large number of materials, the cost will be lower in the long run.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>However, because the detail of the finished product is not comparable to that of an inkjet printer specs, and the color toner models are very expensive, most of them are used for photocopying black and white forms and texts and are not suitable for outputting a large number of pictures.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Choose the right product according to the purpose</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For the consideration of various customer groups, printers have also been developed into many types, such as multi-function printers specs, models dedicated to outputting photos, and so on. Next, we will explain the types of printers, please choose the suitable products according to your own use.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>A "printer" for printing only, no other additional functions</strong> </h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Although there are no other special features of printers with only one function of "printing", they are loved by most families because of their simple functions, easy operation, lightweight, and very cheap price. Even if it only has the printing function, it is no problem to handle some basic forms, web pages, pictures, and simple printed matter, and it will not be disturbed by other functions. time, users who print the finished product directly at home.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>"Photo printer" that can print photos directly</strong> </h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:cover {"url":"https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Photo-printer-techodu-1024x536.webp","id":545,"dimRatio":50,"isDark":false,"style":{"color":{}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-cover is-light"><span aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-cover__gradient-background has-background-dim"></span><img class="wp-block-cover__image-background wp-image-545" alt="Best printer specs" src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Photo-printer-techodu-1024x536.webp" data-object-fit="cover"/><div class="wp-block-cover__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","textColor":"base-3","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center has-base-3-color has-text-color has-large-font-size"><strong>Photo printer</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:cover -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Photo printers are mainly used to output photos. If you take a bunch of photos every time you travel, and you don’t want to spend money and time to take them to a developing shop, you can directly use this type of printer to output photos after buying photo paper, which is convenient and fast. In addition, there are many portable photo printers on the market. As long as you use Wi-Fi, you can directly output photos from your smartphone or camera, and share them with friends and family instantly, adding travel memories.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>However, as the name suggests, photo printers can only be used to print photos, and even the paper used is limited to more expensive photo paper. It cannot photocopy A4 or other sized text, forms, and other information like ordinary printers. , you can only choose other types of printers.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>"Multifunction machine" that combines printing, scanning, and faxing</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>At present, most MFPs on the market have at least three functions "printing", "faxing" and "scanning". If there is a family or company line number with such requirements, only one machine can complete most of the functions. For work, there is no need to buy another fax machine and scanner to place them in space, and there are many models that can not only receive data from a computer, as long as they have Wi-Fi function, no matter the camera or smartphone can be directly transmitted. Data to the printer, direct output printing, very convenient.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you will frequently use fax and scanning functions in addition to printing, the MFP is definitely a good partner for your work, especially the scanning function can set whether the file transferred to the computer is a picture file or a PDF file. It will be more convenient for post-processing and saving.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Understand the type of ink, choose according to the model and needs</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The price of the printer body has continued to drop in recent years. If you simply buy models with basic functions, you can easily get started without spending too much budget. However, for printers specs, ink or toner needs to be consumed to print, so please choose Be sure to factor in the cost of such consumables to be beneficial.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Next, I will briefly introduce several ink cartridges or toner cartridges circulating on the market. Please refer to the future to choose the most suitable type for you.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Easy to replace, "one-piece ink cartridge" suitable for a small amount of printing</strong> <strong>[printer specs]</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The most common ink cartridges should be this type of combination of 3 to 5 color inks called "color ink cartridges", with independent black ink cartridges. Generally, cheap pure printers use this combination. Due to the small number of ink cartridges, it is very easy to replace, and the most commonly used black ink is isolated, so it is very suitable for users who do not want to replace the ink cartridge frequently or print black and white documents frequently.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>However, due to the difference in the number of color inks, if one of the colors is used up, only the entire set of ink cartridges can be replaced, and the other colors that have not been used up will be wasted, which will relatively increase the printing cost, so it is not suitable for printing in large quantities. Users of documents other than black and white. In addition, the ink also has the problem of the service life. As long as the ink in the cartridge is completely dried, there is no way to print at all. This part is also one of the consumption costs and needs special attention.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>A low-cost "separate ink cartridge" that replaces one color at a time</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Separate ink cartridges are made of each color into a separate ink cartridge. They are often sold in a set or separate colors when purchased, and there are slight price differences.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Since each color can be purchased separately, even if one of the colors is used up, you only need to replace it with that color. Even if you haven’t changed it, you can still print with other colors. It is more flexible and suitable for frequent printing or large quantities. Users who print the same document or the same color.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>The most economical for mass printing is "Toner Cartridge" for laser printers</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:cover {"url":"https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/best-printer-specs-1-1024x651.jpg","id":542,"dimRatio":50,"isDark":false,"style":{"color":{}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-cover is-light"><span aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-cover__gradient-background has-background-dim"></span><img class="wp-block-cover__image-background wp-image-542" alt="" src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/best-printer-specs-1-1024x651.jpg" data-object-fit="cover"/><div class="wp-block-cover__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","textColor":"base-3","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center has-base-3-color has-text-color has-large-font-size"><strong>Toner Cartridge</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:cover -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In terms of price, the toner cartridges used in laser printers are very expensive compared to other types of ink cartridges. However, due to the larger capacity of a toner cartridge, it can print more finished products than ink, and it does not cost much. It will dry up like ink, and there is no issue with the expiration date. The cost of printing one sheet is calculated to be much lower than that of the ink-based model, so it is very suitable for users who need a lot of printing.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In addition to the toner cartridge, there are other consumable laser printer specs that need to be paid attention to, which is the "photosensitive drum" that transfers the preset pattern to the paper. Since toner often accumulates on the photosensitive drum, in addition to regular cleaning, it must be replaced regularly to maintain print quality. When choosing a laser printer specs and a toner cartridge, please remember to include the cost of these consumables together. , so as not to exceed the planned budget.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Ink selection based on print content</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>According to different components, inks are also divided into two types: "dye ink" and "pigment ink", and there are also mixed inks that are mixed in different proportions. Different models will use different types of special inks, so it is recommended to pay attention to the ink composition when choosing a printer! The characteristics of these inks are described below.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>"Dye Ink" for vivid hair color, suitable for designs such as pictures</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Dye ink is easier to penetrate the fiber layer of the paper during printing, which can achieve the effect with less capacity, and the color of the printed result is very bright. It is recommended to output photos and pictures and other data documents that need to emphasize color. You can definitely print a satisfactory finished product.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Since this type of ink is soluble in water, the printed pictures are very easy to smudge as long as they are dripped with water, and the drying time is relatively long. Remember not to stack the data after output, to avoid mutual contamination with ink and paste. one slice.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Clear text and water resistance, "pigment ink" suitable for document forms</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:cover {"url":"https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/pigment-ink-techodu.jpg","id":543,"dimRatio":30,"isDark":false,"style":{"color":{}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-cover is-light"><span aria-hidden="true" class="has-background-dim-30 wp-block-cover__gradient-background has-background-dim"></span><img class="wp-block-cover__image-background wp-image-543" alt="" src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/pigment-ink-techodu.jpg" data-object-fit="cover"/><div class="wp-block-cover__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","textColor":"base-3","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center has-base-3-color has-text-color has-large-font-size"><strong>Pigment ink</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:cover -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The pigment ink will feel thicker, and it will not easily penetrate the fiber layer when it is attached to the paper, but will firmly grasp the surface of the paper, and it will not smudge when it encounters water. Even if it is painted with a highlighter, the color will not fall off, and you don't have to worry about destroying the entire document due to external factors when you use it to make some text or tables that need to be preserved.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>However, pigment inks are not ideal in terms of color performance, and the color of the printed product will be dull, which is not suitable for printing pictures and photos. A Special look should be paid to this point.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>I<strong>f you need to print documents and pictures, please use a "composite ink" printer with dyes + pigments</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Although the properties of dye ink and pigment ink are not the same, there are also suitable printer models, but there are also printer specs that can use both types of ink at the same time. If you often want to make graphic documents or reports, it is recommended to buy this type For goods, dye ink is used for the color part, and pigment ink is used for the black part, which can print bright and bright patterns, and the text and table parts are not easy to faint, and the finished product is very clear, especially suitable for printing New Year cards, graphics and texts. Create or image documents that contain text.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you want to print at any time without being bound by your device, you can choose a model that supports Wi-Fi</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In addition to connecting a computer with a USB cable to use the printer, in recent years, products connected through Wi-Fi have also been sold on the market. As long as the printer is connected to the wireless network, whether it is a computer, a smartphone, or a camera, you can directly It is very convenient to export photos or documents. However, since Wi-Fi will affect the signal strength according to the room configuration, if you want to be able to print anytime, anywhere, the placement of the printer will be a big problem.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Of course, some printers support two connection methods at the same time. You can use a transmission cable to connect to the computer for printing. If you don’t want to transfer documents or photos from other devices to the computer, you can also connect to Wi-Fi, saving you the trouble of transferring data to each other.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>See  if it supports "double-sided printing" and other functions</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:cover {"url":"https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/best-printer-specs-.jpg","id":540,"dimRatio":50,"isDark":false,"align":"center","style":{"color":{}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-cover aligncenter is-light"><span aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-cover__gradient-background has-background-dim"></span><img class="wp-block-cover__image-background wp-image-540" alt="photo printer" src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/best-printer-specs-.jpg" data-object-fit="cover"/><div class="wp-block-cover__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"left","textColor":"base-3","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-left has-base-3-color has-text-color has-large-font-size"><strong><strong>Double-sided printing</strong></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:cover -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In addition to the basic printing function, it is also necessary to confirm that some additional functions and specifications will be better, such as whether it supports automatic double-sided printing, can directly read the data in the memory card or CD for printing, link smart The mobile phone confirms the printing details and scans the document to make a large number of copies, etc., which will increase the convenience of use.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If only manual double-sided printing is supported, you must pay attention to the operation steps, such as the direction of returning the paper cassette after printing the odd pages, the front and back sides, etc. These will vary according to different models. In addition, most general printer specs only support printing A4-size documents. If you have A3 or even larger printing needs, you must choose a printer that can support it, so as not to be unable to use it after buying it.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Select exclusive features from different brands according to your needs</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The main functions of each printer manufacturer are not the same. Next, we will introduce the printer specs of several well-known manufacturers, including ink supply system, printing quality, etc., according to your own needs, you can choose the manufacturer first and then filter the suitable products.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>EPSON: mature and stable continuous ink supply system</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>EPSON, which has a very high market share, has been working in the field of printer specs for many years and has very stable growth and progress in both technology and systems. Especially, the original continuous ink supply system was launched very early for consumers to choose. Over time, not only is the price of the printer specs itself getting lower and lower, but the ink usage efficiency of the system is also getting higher and higher. On the whole, it is not only cheap, and stable, but also very ink-saving. If you want to print a lot at home and want to reduce costs, you can refer to it.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Canon: Multi-color ink prints with excellent quality</strong> <strong>[Printer specs]</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Canon, which is famous in the printer market for its "PIXMA" series, is also an established manufacturer of single-lens cameras and has put a lot of effort into improving the print quality. In addition to the commonly used CMYK, three primary colors plus a black pigment combination, we also specially developed separate inks using 5 to 6 colors, which are mixed to produce bright and realistic printing results, which are very suitable for pictures, Photos, and graphic creations are the main users of print items.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Brother</strong> </h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><a href="https://www.brother-usa.com/home" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Brother Commercial Co., Ltd.</a>, started in Japan in 1908, started with the production of sewing machines, and has been involved in the knitting machine/home appliance industry. Its current business areas include fax machines, printers, multifunction machines, label printer specs, scanners, and other products.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Printing and solutions business; household machinery business centered on household sewing machines and embroidery machines.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Brother is a major printer manufacturer outside of Canon and Epson. Brother printers also have a variety of models with the option to print in A3 size and more recently models available on fax machines. Also, it is popular due to the affordable price of the main body and ink as it can keep the cost low.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><a href="https://techodu.com/what-to-see-when-buying-gaming-phones/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Visit:  Gaming Phone Specs</a></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
