					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[What is the NIST Cybersecurity Framework?]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/what-is-the-nist-cybersecurity-framework/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 18 Apr 2022 02:07:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=548</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>NIST Cybersecurity Framework: NIST is an acronym for the National Institute of Standards and Technology, a government agency specializing in cybersecurity risk management.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Storing information online has become the norm. More organizations are pulling this segment to stay relevant in this connected age.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Leaving systems that store sensitive information insecure is a recipe for disaster, especially in the presence of cybercriminals.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Every bit of information kept online requires adequate network security, and employing a proven and tested framework is an effective way to keep attackers at arm’s length.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Many users use the NIST framework when seeking to improve online security. But what is it? Let's find out.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>What does NIST stand for in cybersecurity?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:embed {"url":"https://youtu.be/_CkNPShBGjM","type":"video","providerNameSlug":"youtube","responsive":true,"className":"wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio"><div class="wp-block-embed__wrapper">
https://youtu.be/_CkNPShBGjM
</div><figcaption>                                                                        <strong>NIST Cybersecurity</strong></figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:embed -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>NIST is an acronym for National Institute of Standards and Technology, a government agency specializing in cybersecurity risk management.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The lack of cybersecurity risk management standards in the past has created vulnerabilities in an organization's security systems, which cyber attackers can exploit to conduct attacks.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Despite recognizing the need for cybersecurity risk management, some organizations lack the expertise to implement it and thus fall victim to cyberattacks.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The NIST cybersecurity framework spans different domains. Organizations in different industries can strengthen their security systems by implementing the framework using intrusion detection systems and other practices.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The NIST framework consists of three components: the core, the implementation layer, and the configuration file. Each component assesses the impact of cybersecurity risk management on business operations and financial goals.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>NIST Framework Core</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The core of the NIST Framework embodies a set of activities and guidance that organizations can use to manage cybersecurity risk.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Practicality is the focus at the core of the framework. It outlines practical activities that organizations can implement to achieve specific results. Given its practical approach, the component cites real-world examples of organizations that have adopted the outlined practices to manage their cybersecurity risks.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>The framework core has five functions:</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>1. Identification</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>To effectively manage cybersecurity risk, so you need to understand your critical systems and assets.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>While all of your assets may be important to your organization, some assets are more valuable than others. The core framework enables you to prioritize risk management efforts. Faced with an attack, you prioritize your most valuable assets before others.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Identifying functions include business environment, asset management, risk management and governance.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>2. Protection</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This feature helps simplify your network security efforts by proactively preventing threats from entering your network.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Instead of rushing into a cybersecurity attack, you have defenses on the ground against possible attacks.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Protection features include awareness and training, access control, and data security.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>3. Detection</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Identifying your most valuable assets and defending against threats is a good start, but it's not enough to prevent attacks. This feature helps you develop a strategy to detect possible threats early, before they escalate.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Detection capabilities include continuous monitoring, anomalies and events, and detection processes.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>4. Respond</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>What do you do when you detect a cybersecurity threat? This feature will guide you in developing effective strategies to help you nip threats in the bud. Failure to respond effectively could result in serious damage.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Response functions include planning, communication, mitigation, and improvement.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>5. Recovery</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Even if you can manage cybersecurity risks effectively, your systems may not be exactly what they were before the threat or attack. You need to restore it to its original state through a series of activities and take steps to prevent it from happening again.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Recovery features include planning, communication, and improvement.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Framework implementation layer</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":554,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/NIST-CYBERSECURITY1-copy-1024x614.webp" alt="" class="wp-image-554"/><figcaption><strong>Framework implementation layer</strong></figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Larger organizations may be exposed to advanced security risks compared to smaller organizations. The framework is designed to give organizations the flexibility to implement cybersecurity risk management within their capabilities.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>From Layer 1 to Layer 4, the Implementation Layer framework allows you to move at your own pace and at your own pace to manage your assets and costs.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Layer 1: Parts</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As the name suggests, Layer 1 is part of the approach to cybersecurity risk management. Instead of formalizing the entire security framework and being proactive in advance, you react by taking action only when security risks arise.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cybersecurity awareness is limited at this level, and due to the lack of established processes, communication within your organization is not necessarily the best.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong><strong>Layer </strong>2: Risk Communication</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is where you start formalizing cybersecurity risk management. Your management team recognizes the need for a risk management framework and increases awareness of it across the organization. You equip your employees with the tools to perform cybersecurity activities, but don't have a structure for sharing information or collaborating with external sources.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Layer 3: Repeatable</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>At this level, your network security management is advanced. There is a formal framework for risk management and cybersecurity practices. You prioritize cybersecurity management and update it regularly based on your business environment and needs.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Your organization is highly cybersecurity aware and your employees are very knowledgeable about cybersecurity practices. Your organization also has a process for communicating and collaborating with external sources.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong><strong>Layer </strong>4: Adaptability</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is the peak of cybersecurity risk management. At this level, you have mastered the art of learning from past security incidents and using those lessons to strengthen your current security systems and make future predictions.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Your organization thrives in a healthy cybersecurity culture where employees are highly skilled in cybersecurity activities. It places great emphasis on sharing information with the outside world and has made positive progress in collaboration with external sources.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Framework configuration file</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Framework profiles help you strike a balance between business needs, resources, and the ability to manage cybersecurity risk.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>After profiling your organization, you will have a solid understanding of adopting the best cybersecurity risk management practices for your business.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>With a clear understanding of your business strengths and weaknesses, you can create processes to leverage your strengths and address your weaknesses.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>How to use the NIST Cybersecurity Framework?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":555,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Nist-1024x614.webp" alt="NIST Cybersecurity Framework" class="wp-image-555"/><figcaption><strong>NIST Cybersecurity Framework</strong></figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Are you considering abandoning your current cybersecurity framework for the NIST framework? Not so fast. The framework encourages organizations to consider their current cybersecurity posture before taking action.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>1. Review current cybersecurity practices</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A good start to using the NIST framework is to review your current cybersecurity practices.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>When you conduct a proper review, you will identify existing vulnerabilities in your risk management practices and implement the various activities recommended by the framework to remediate them.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>2. Develop or improve cybersecurity practices</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>After reviewing your current cybersecurity practices, so you can choose to improve them or develop new ones based on the results of the review.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Visit for: <a href="https://techodu.com/what-to-see-when-buying-gaming-phones/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Gaming Phone Specs</a></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You need to outline your business goals and create an effective cybersecurity environment to achieve your goals. If your existing practices are not aligned with your goals, you need to create new ones. you can work on improving them.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>3. Communicate cybersecurity expectations with stakeholders</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Sharing your cybersecurity information with stakeholders allows you to better protect your assets.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>By viewing the current state of <a href="https://digitalguardian.com/blog/what-cyber-security" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">cybersecurity</a>, you can better understand where you stand. Going forward, you can leverage the solutions provided by the NIST Cybersecurity Framework to forecast and communicate your expectations effectively with stakeholders and external agencies.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Better cybersecurity opportunities for your organization</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The NIST framework has different aspects that can seem complex to implement for many organizations.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>When implemented effectively, the framework helps you create an efficient cybersecurity framework for your business. You can identify your most important assets, measure your risk management capabilities, identify vulnerabilities and take necessary actions to enhance your cybersecurity. Ultimately, your cybersecurity risk management will get better.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[What is cyber security? Explains the concept of security, concrete examples, and the latest trends, including differences from information security]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/what-is-cyber-security-explains-the-concept-of-security-concrete/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 18 Apr 2022 19:26:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=562</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In today's world where all information is digitized, we must always be aware of the challenge of how to protect information. Cyber security is one of the threats to maintaining the reliability of the information. We will explain what cyber security is in the first place while checking the differences between information security and specific examples of cyber attacks, the latest trends in cyber security measures, and specific measures in an easy-to-understand manner.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>What is cyber security?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":574,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Cyber-Security-1024x614.webp" alt="" class="wp-image-574"/><figcaption>   <strong>Fingerprint Biometric Authentication.</strong></figcaption></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cyber security is a means of preventing the falsification and leakage of digitized information. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The information must always be reliable. However, digitized information is easy to carry, and in the present age when ICT has become widespread, it is possible to access information from remote locations. Digital information is convenient, but the accuracy and reliability of information are constantly under threat. Cybersecurity is responsible for addressing the causes of this threat.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>&nbsp;<strong>Information security and cyber security differences</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Security needs to be roughly divided into two. Cyber security &amp; Information security. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The relationship between the two can be easily understood by imagining the concept of cyber security in the big group of information security.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Let's see the difference between information security and cyber security.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Information security concept</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Information is improved in accuracy and reliability by maintaining the three elements of "confidentiality", "integrity", and "availability". These three elements are called "CIA". In information security, we will consider how to handle information in order to protect this "CIA" state.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For example, information security is a measure of how to handle the information to prevent information leakage and data corruption, and how to keep information available at all times. In addition, "CIA" is explained in detail in "Information security 3 elements and 7 elements, from the definition of CIA to 4 new elements", so please refer to it.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Cyber security concept</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cyber security is the idea of dealing with the "threatening causes" of the "CIA," which is the three elements of information security.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This includes security against analog threats, including human errors such as information being taken out from the inside, as well as threats executed from the outside over the network. In recent years, "Zero Trust Security" has been attracting attention because of the awareness that we must be vigilant about access to information without distinguishing between inside and outside the company.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>So what is the cause of threatening the "CIA", which are the three elements of information security?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>The following are typical threats that are familiar to us.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Computer virus</li><li>Unauthorized access from the outside</li><li>Unauthorized access from inside</li><li>Software vulnerabilities</li><li>Network security vulnerabilities</li><li>ID/password leak</li><li>Taking out information by employees, etc.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For each of these <a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-the-nist-cybersecurity-framework/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">cybersecurity threats</a>, it is necessary to consider countermeasures from the three perspectives of the "CIA."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Specific examples of cyber attacks</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:cover {"url":"https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Cyber-Security-2.jpg","id":570,"dimRatio":50,"align":"center","style":{"color":{}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-cover aligncenter"><span aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-cover__gradient-background has-background-dim"></span><img class="wp-block-cover__image-background wp-image-570" alt="Cyber-Security" src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Cyber-Security-2.jpg" data-object-fit="cover"/><div class="wp-block-cover__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center has-large-font-size"><strong>Cyber Attacks</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:cover -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>New methods are being created every day for cyberattacks that cyber security should prevent. The act of destroying the internal system mainly via the network and the act of falsifying data are performed by various methods.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Specifically, there are the following cyber attacks.</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Guidance to fake sites</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Phishing:</strong> A method of stealing information by directing you to a fake site and having you enter your credit card or account information.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Business email fraud:</strong> A method of stealing confidential information and money by pretending to be a business email from a customer of a business partner or the owner of the company.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Unauthorized access</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Brute force attack</strong>: A method of trying all combinations of ID/password.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Password spray attack:</strong> A method of trying to log in to multiple accounts with the same password at the same time. (This is a type of brute force attack, but it is a more difficult attack method to detect.)</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Attack on vulnerabilities</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>SQL injection attack:</strong> A method of falsifying data or stealing information by executing malicious SQL.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Buffer overflow attack:</strong> A method of sending malicious data that exceeds the processing capacity of the target computer and causes the computer to malfunction.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Ransom demand-type</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Ransomware:</strong> A method of arbitrarily encrypting and restricting data in a computer to make it inoperable and requesting a ransom to lift the restriction. A type of malware.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Eavesdropping</strong>: Man-in-the-middle attack: A method of illegally intercepting two-way communication via wireless LAN or a vulnerable application.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>The latest trends in cyber security</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As new threats are created every day, we should be aware of the latest cybersecurity trends. You can check the damage and methods of cyber attacks in <a href="https://www.zdnet.com/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">IT-related news</a>. In particular, information from IPA (Information-technology Promotion Agency) and NISC (Cabinet Cyber Security Center) under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Economy, Trade, and Industry will be able to collect highly reliable information.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For example, on the top page of <a href="https://www.publicpower.org/suppliers-guide/supplier/national-information-solutions-cooperative-nisc" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">NISC</a>, "Cyber attacks by ransomware [Caution]" dated November 26, 2020, and "Multiple vulnerabilities affecting many devices" dated June 24, 2020. "recommendation information about copulating " Ripple 20 "etc. are posted. In addition, reports from working groups on security are also posted, which is useful for checking the latest trends in cyber security.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Specific measures for cyber security</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Specific measures for cyber security include technical measures that are supported by software, human measures that thoroughly enforce rules such as data handling for employees, and physical measures that record access to information storage locations. There are various measures.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In other words, cyber security needs to be divided into three categories: "<strong>technical</strong>," "<strong>human</strong>," and "<strong>physical</strong>."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Technical measures</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As a technical measure, IT technology protects the devices and applications you are using from threats.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>Specifically, the following <strong>Technical</strong> measures </strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Unify the hardware and software used for business to avoid complicated management</li><li>Install security software on all devices (PCs, smartphones, etc.)</li><li>&nbsp;update the latest version</li><li>Thoroughly manage access rights to systems and data</li><li>Manage system access logs</li><li>Introduce IDS (Intrusion Detection System)</li><li>Introduce IPS (Intrusion Prevention System)</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Human measures</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":568,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/techodu-1-1024x614.webp" alt="" class="wp-image-568"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Human measures mean that everyone who uses or creates IT / ICT is aware of cyber security.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>Specifically, the following measures </strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Restricting the bringing in and taking out of information</li><li>Do not bring your own device</li><li>Educate employees about cyber attacks</li><li>Rule out change operations such as important data and systems</li><li>Share the rules for dealing with cyberattacks</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Physical measures</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Physical measures ensure thorough control of device theft, vandalism, and physical access to where information is stored.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>Specifically, the following measures</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Thorough office entry/exit management</li><li>Thorough office lock management</li><li>Install surveillance cameras and security cameras</li><li>Thorough fall prevention and earthquake resistance</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Visit: <a href="https://techodu.com/the-best-ssd-solid-state-drive-recommendation/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Best SSD Solid State Drive for gaming (Laptop-Mac-ps5-ps4)</a></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Summary</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cyber security is to deal with the causes that threaten the three elements of information security, including the CIA. There are various methods of attacks that pose a threat, and it is necessary to take measures into consideration of the latest trends. Since the methods of cyber attacks are evolving day by day, it is difficult to always take comprehensive measures. However, just checking basic cyber security has a security effect. If it is difficult or uneasy to deal with cyber security by yourself, you can use the security check service provided by the ICT company or information security that is generally required for system construction support companies with knowledge. One option is to incorporate the perspective of a third party, such as requesting settings that include countermeasures.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Information security 3 elements and 7 elements Explain from the definition of CIA to 4 new elements]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/information-security-elements-explain-from-definition-of-cia/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 19 Apr 2022 20:39:55 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=578</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In Today's world where all information is digitized, we must always be aware of how information assets are safe to handle. In particular, it is important that the information held by a company is prevented from being damaged or lost and can be used whenever necessary. We will explain in an easy-to-understand manner the definitions of the three elements of information security that should be conscious of when handling information, and the seven elements of information security that combine the newly added four elements, while also touching on the ISO standards certified by the International Organization for Standardization. To do.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>What are the three elements of information security?</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In digital data and IT systems, security needs to be divided into "information security" and "<a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-cyber-security-explains-the-concept-of-security-concrete/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">cyber security</a>". Information security is the idea of keeping the state of "information (data and infrastructure) safe", and cyber security is the idea of taking measures against threats that threaten "information security".</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cyber security is explained in an easy-to-understand manner in "<a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-cyber-security-explains-the-concept-of-security-concrete/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">What is security</a>? An easy-to-understand explanation of information security that IT should be aware of", s<a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-cyber-security-explains-the-concept-of-security-concrete/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">o please refer to it</a>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Here, we will look at the three elements that make up information security.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The three elements of information security are called "CIA", which is an acronym for the following three terms written in English.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list {"ordered":true,"type":"1"} -->
<ol type="1"><li><strong>Confidentiality</strong></li><li><strong>Integrity</strong></li><li><strong>Availability</strong></li></ol>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:embed {"url":"https://youtu.be/g1ziFipnJ04","type":"video","providerNameSlug":"youtube","responsive":true,"className":"wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio"><div class="wp-block-embed__wrapper">
https://youtu.be/g1ziFipnJ04
</div><figcaption><strong>                                                               CIA in Information Security.</strong></figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:embed -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>These three elements define the elements that you should be aware of in order to prevent the falsification, loss, and physical damage of important information and to handle the information safely.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Let's take a look one by one.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>What is confidentiality?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Confidentiality is the thorough protection and control of access to information.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>High confidentiality can be maintained by being aware that information is not shown or leaked to the outside. Conversely, if anyone has access to the information held within the enterprise, it is less confidential.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If the confidentiality of information is low, it may cause information leakage or information corruption. Techniques such as access control rule settings, password authentication, and encryption of the information itself are used to increase confidentiality.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Information that needs to be more confidential includes, for example:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Personal information of employees</li><li>Customer information</li><li>New product development information</li><li>Password to access the system</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>So what exactly should we do to increase confidentiality?</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Specific measures include the following.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Install HDDs that store information in access-controlled locations (data centers, etc.)</li><li>Do not set an easy password such as "123456"</li><li>Don't leave ID/password in memos</li><li>Do not take information out</li><li>Create a mechanism that allows only authorized persons to access information</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>What is integrity?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Integrity refers to the retention of accurate information that is not tampered with or overdone. When integrity is lost, the accuracy and reliability of the data are questioned, and data with questionable reliability loses its utility value.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For example, if a company's website is tampered with, it can lead to a loss of trust in a company.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The following measures can be considered as methods for maintaining integrity.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Digitally sign information</li><li>Keep access history to information</li><li>Keep a history of information changes</li><li>Determine rules for storing information such as backups</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If the information of a general company is not complete, it may cause great confusion and loss not only to the company itself but also to the business partners of the company.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In addition, if the integrity of information cannot be maintained in a society where IoT is widespread, there is a risk of life-threatening damage in medical treatment and smart cars.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>What is availability?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Availability is about keeping information available at all times. A system that has access to information when it is needed and that does not interrupt access or data processing until it serves its purpose is a highly available system.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For example, cloud services have access to data and systems 24 hours a day, 365 days a year (excluding maintenance hours). This allows you to access the data stored in the cloud storage at any time on your computer or smartphone, and edit the file at any time.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The following measures can be considered to maintain availability.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>System duplication (multiplexing)</li><li>HDD RAID configuration</li><li>UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply)</li><li>BCP (Business Continuity Measures)</li><li>Cloud-based system</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Availability can also be achieved on-premises. However, the active use of the cloud is increasing due to management and operation costs, man-hours for dealing with troubles, and DX (digital transformation) initiatives that are being promoted by many companies in recent years.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>4 new elements included in the 7 elements of information security</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":584,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/information-security-1024x614.webp" alt="information security" class="wp-image-584"/><figcaption>                                                                      <strong>Information security</strong></figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Information security has four new elements in addition to the three elements introduced above.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list {"ordered":true,"type":"1"} -->
<ol type="1"><li><strong>Authenticity</strong></li><li><strong>Reliability</strong></li><li><strong>Accountability</strong></li><li><strong>Non-repudiation</strong></li></ol>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>These are mainly information by making it possible to confirm "whose action" is the action on the information, ensuring that the system behaves as intended, and creating a situation where the information cannot be denied later. It ensures security.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Now let's take a look at the contents of the four new elements.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>What is Authenticity?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Authenticity ensures that the corporate organization, individual, or medium that accesses the information is an "authorized person." Restricting access to information is also an important factor in information security.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Specific measures to achieve authenticity include the following.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Digital signature</li><li>Two-step verification</li><li>Multi-factor authentication (including biometrics)</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>What is Reliability?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Reliability means that data and system-based operations produce the intended results.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Data and systems may not produce the expected results due to human error or program bugs (such as bugs). Information security requires measures to prevent such a situation.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Specific measures to achieve reliability include the following.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Design the system and software so that they do not malfunction</li><li>Build based on a defect-free design</li><li>Provide a mechanism to prevent data from being tampered with or lost even if a human error (operation error, etc.) occurs.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>What is Accountability?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Responsibility traceability is to track the movements of corporate organizations and individuals. This keeps track of what the threat to your data and systems is, or who is doing what.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Specific measures for tracking responsibility include the following.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list {"ordered":true,"type":"1"} -->
<ol type="1"><li>access log</li><li>System log</li><li>Digital signature</li><li>Operation history</li><li>login history</li></ol>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>What is non-repudiation?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Non-repudiation is to prove that the information is not denied later.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For example, if an organization or individual falsifies or uses information, measures such as keeping a log so that the person cannot deny it later are measures to prevent denial.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Non-repudiation can be achieved by taking responsibility for traceability measures, and digital signatures and various logs are mainly used.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>ISO and IEC emphasize the three-element CIA</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>CIA, which is the three elements of information security, is set as an international standard for information security by organizations such as ISO and IEC. Typical international standards include "ISO / IEC 27001", and information security standards are internationally unified.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The standards are set by ISO (International Organization for Standardization) and IEC (International Electrotechnical Commission), and there are the following differences between them.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>ISO (International Organization for Standardization): Establishes all international standards, including quality and environment</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>IEC (International Electrotechnical Commission):</strong> Establishes international standards for electrical and electronic technologies</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>ISO / IEC27001 (JIS Q 27001) summarizes the measures to be taken in information security, and the CIA, which is the three elements of information security, is emphasized. In addition, ISO / IEC27002 (JIS Q 27002) shows the practical norms of information security and shows the concrete implementation method.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Relationship between ISO standard and NIST standard</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In addition to the ISO standard, there are <a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-the-nist-cybersecurity-framework/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">NIST standards</a> as standards related to information security. NIST is the National Institute of Standards and Technology, which is run by a government agency in the United States.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There is a CSF in NIST, and it is written as "NIST CSF" as a standard, and NIST CSF formulates cyber security.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There are the following differences between "ISO / IEC 27001" and "NIST CSF".</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>ISO / IEC 27001: Information security standards</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>NIST CSF</strong>: A framework for improving cybersecurity</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In addition, NIST has standards such as "SP800 -53" and "SP800-171", both of which are guidelines set by the US federal government for security standards.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>&nbsp;<strong>The NIST [ SP800-53]:</strong> the Security and the Privacy Controls for the Federal Information Systems and the Organizations</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>NIST SP800-171:</strong> Guidelines that require companies that manufacture products and technologies procured by US government agencies to comply with standard security.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Regarding NIST SP800-53, NIST SP800-171 is beginning to be included in the procurement standards of the Ministry of Defense of Japan in the security management standards of cloud services introduced by the Government of Japan.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The ISO standard and the NIST standard set standards for security, although the organizations that set the standards are different.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Attention Zero Trust Security</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":587,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Attention-Zero-Trust-Security-1024x605.jpg" alt="Attention Zero Trust Security" class="wp-image-587"/><figcaption>                                                             <strong>Attention Zero Trust Security</strong></figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In recent years, information security measures called "zero trust security" have been attracting attention.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Zero trust security is a security concept that "does not trust any access" and is a security concept that is becoming widespread as information security and cyber security concept.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The background to this is the spread of ICT, remote access for telework, and the expansion of cloud usage. These technologies bring conveniences such as access to corporate information via networks, but at the same time, information connected to the Internet is also under threat. This makes it difficult to protect information with traditional perimeter security and defense in depth.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For example, it is necessary to take security measures for information access from within the company by visualizing (communication verification and logging) in the same way as access from outside the company. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Utilization of the cloud designed for information security</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Information security awareness can also be managed in an on-premises environment built in-house. However, it can be said that it is efficient to utilize cloud services in order to reduce the cost of managing the infrastructure in-house and to always keep up with the latest security.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Here, AWS, which is a typical cloud service</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Let's take a look at the main information security environments of AWS and Microsoft Azure.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>AWS Information Security</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>AWS information security monitors, for example, data and access on the network.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We place great importance on user data security and monitor it 24 hours a day. We are monitoring a team of world-class security experts. All data flowing through the network is automatically encrypted at the physical layer, and data in transit and at rest is also encrypted so that only authorized users can access the data.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Information security in Microsoft Azure</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Information security in <a href="https://www.googleadservices.com/pagead/aclk?sa=L&amp;ai=DChcSEwjL6eSFhJ_3AhVRBn0KHZO9AioYABAAGgJwdg&amp;ae=2&amp;ei=7xdeYtDrCaaXlwTY0qrwBw&amp;ohost=www.google.com&amp;cid=CAESauD2XhD7fYZYurhInTxWoPAzADNxWol6z1iU5otkILxFu5UAfhozpgYgI4rVHaNz_qWZ7fyBHvKen3wEI79ebrOoq70f3Y15VoW_WT3TYYlFC4VFqXfVcsilvjstWbDLB8h66zY0bOOMYt8&amp;sig=AOD64_3CDyVcFWm68B-h7T8sIXzrmVI_Dg&amp;q&amp;sqi=2&amp;adurl&amp;ved=2ahUKEwiQn9SFhJ_3AhWmy4UKHVipCn4Q0Qx6BAgDEAE" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Microsoft Azure</a> is for stored data, for example, when data is written to storage, the data is encrypted with an encryption key, and ID-based access control and audit policies are applied to the key. Security is also strong. In the security log, control log/management log, data plane log, processed event, etc. are prepared.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Summary</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Information security has three elements, "CIA", and seven elements with four elements added to it. Each element is something that you should always be aware of in order to maintain correct information without tampering or mistakes. It is essential for the safe use of information assets that are important to a company, so it must be understood by everyone who accesses information, not just those who manage it.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_oembed_c34071acdf93ff6cbeca255f5b770d59]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<iframe title="CIA in Information Security" width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/g1ziFipnJ04?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Cybersecurity Awareness Education Initiatives of U.S Overview]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/cybersecurity-awareness-education/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 22 Apr 2022 03:43:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=602</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>According to a set of data released by the US investment consulting agency Cybersecurity Ventures, by 2025, the economic losses caused by global cybercrime will reach 10.5 trillion US dollars. Behind a cybercrime market comparable to the world's third-largest economy, every Internet user can be a potential victim of cybercrime. Popularizing the education of cybersecurity awareness among the whole people and improving the awareness and ability of the whole people to deal with cybersecurity threats have become an important part of the cybersecurity strategies of many countries. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As the country of origin of Internet technology and the leading country in network security technology. The United States has long attached importance to the "people" factor in network security.  The US has introduced a series of national policies, laws, and standards from the top-level design. And established a set of national policies, laws, and standards established by the government, society, and universities. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The national network security awareness education system that enterprises and individuals participate in and cooperate efficiently. So, every citizen can become a "network security guard" to improve the overall level. And the efficiency of network security at the minimum social cost. These measures of the United States in the education of network security awareness. The US can provide a reference for our country to strengthen the education of network security awareness.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>1. Incorporate cybersecurity awareness education into national cybersecurity policies</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> The United States has successively issued a series of cybersecurity policies. And made overall arrangements for the education of cybersecurity awareness of the whole people. And in the form of national strategies, national action plans, and presidential executive orders. As early as 1999, the United States has clearly written information security awareness into the National Information Security Strategic Framework.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> In 2003, the United States released the National Strategy for Protecting Cyberspace Security, emphasizing. The need for a wide range of <a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-cyber-security-explains-the-concept-of-security-concrete/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">American people to take advantage of cybersecurity</a>. And establishing security awareness and training programs is one of the five priorities for national cybersecurity. In 2004, the United States launched the National Cyber ​​Security Awareness Month. Which sets a specific theme every year to call on the American public to strengthen their awareness of security protection. And to deal with various types of cybercrime activities.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4>Cyberspace Policy Review</h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> In 2009, the United States released the "Cyberspace Policy Review" report. And advocating the launch of a national cyberspace security public awareness. And education campaigns to make the public fully aware of the importance of cybersecurity issues. During2010 this, the United States launched the National Cyber ​​Security Education Program (NICE). Which aims to comprehensively improve information security in the United States.  Through systematic and standardized popularization of cyber security knowledge, formal academic education, vocational training, and certification. ability. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> During2014, the United States designated January 28 each year as National Data Privacy Day to raise. The public awareness of the importance of privacy and the protection of personal information. In 2016, the United States released the National Cybersecurity Action Plan and established the National Cybersecurity Promotion Committee. And formulated ten-year action recommendations including raising public cybersecurity awareness. The report "Enhancing National Cybersecurity—Promoting the Security and Development of the Digital Economy. That " issued by the Commission pointed out the American public's cybersecurity awareness. And capabilities should be continuously improved, and the public should be shaped as a major player in national cybersecurity assurance.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> In 2018, the United States released the National Cyber ​​Strategy, pointing out that from the perspective of objective needs. And long-term development, strengthening public cybersecurity awareness education is an important aspect of maintaining national cybersecurity. In 2021, the U.S. Cyberspace Sunbathing Committee released the "Cybersecurity Recommendations for the Biden Administration". That proposes to promote national education, digital literacy, and public awareness.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>2. Incorporate cybersecurity awareness education into laws, regulations, and standards</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":611,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/cybersecurity-awareness-education1-1024x683.jpg" alt="cybersecurity-awareness-education" class="wp-image-611"/><figcaption>                                                               Laws, Regulations, and Standards</figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>  The United States has also incorporated cybersecurity awareness education into the scope of legal protection. Through laws, regulations, standards, and other forms. The Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA) requires federal agencies to establish security awareness. And awareness training programs to conduct information security training for federal employees, contractors, etc., to enhance information security awareness. The Privacy and Security Rules of the Health Insurance Portability. And Accountability Act (HIPAA) requires a security awareness and training program for all employees, including new hires, management, partners, etc. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4>Financial Services Modernization Act (GLBA)</h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> The Financial Services Modernization Act (GLBA) requires training employees on how to recognize. And respond to fraud or identity theft and properly handle customer information. The Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) requires public companies to conduct security awareness training programs. And The Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act (FACTA) requires employees to be trained in identity theft prevention programs. The Massachusetts Data Protection Act requires ongoing security training for permanent and temporary contract employees. That focuses on the security, confidentiality, and/or integrity of any electronic, paper. And other records containing personal information. reasonably foreseeable internal and external risks.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> In addition to the security awareness training required by laws and regulations, and relevant industry norms. And standards in the United States also require security awareness training. The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS) requires a formal security awareness. And training program should be implemented at least annually to educate all personnel about the importance of cardholder data security. The National Institute of Standards and Technology. "NIST SP 800-53: Recommended Privacy and Security Controls for Federal Information Systems and Organizations. And "states that organizations should determine personnel security awareness training and Appropriate content for security awareness techniques. The North American Electric Reliability Council (NERC) requires personnel risk assessment, training, and safety awareness education. The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's (SEC) Cybersecurity Exam Initiative Guidelines require companies to educate their employees about information security and risks.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> However, most laws, regulations, and standards in the United States do not have clear regulations on the training topics. And training duration, training cycle, frequency, assessment, and measurement methods should be covered by security awareness education.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>3. Government, society, schools, and enterprises work together to promote cybersecurity awareness education</strong> </h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":608,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/techodu.com-1-1024x614.webp" alt=" promote cybersecurity awareness " class="wp-image-608"/><figcaption>                                                              U.S. Promote Cybersecurity Awareness</figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> U.S. government agencies are responsible for the overall planning, coordination, and guidance of security awareness education. For example, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security is the main functional department of cyberspace security awareness education, and through the Stop. Think. Connect project, various publicity activities are carried out to help the American public understand cyber behavior risks and countermeasures. The U.S. Department of Commerce undertakes the promotion and coordination of the National Cyberspace Security Education Program (NICE). Through the <a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-the-nist-cybersecurity-framework/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)</a> to popularize cybersecurity knowledge in schools and workplaces.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> Social institutions play the role of publicity, training, and certification of safety awareness. For example, the National Cyber ​​Security Alliance (NCSA) is one of the main sponsors. And organizers of the National Cyber ​​Security Awareness Month in the United States. Training organizations and certification agencies conduct professional training and certification.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The school shoulders the responsibility of network security professional courses and knowledge dissemination. The United States attaches great importance to the education of network security awareness. Through schools, and cultivates the public's awareness of network security from an early age. From the basic education stage of kindergarten to the 12th grade, students have been instilled in network security knowledge. Prepare to develop security-conscious, qualified digital citizens. Relying on university resources and characteristics, colleges and universities open cybersecurity majors and organize. They formulate cybersecurity training plans, scholarship programs, cybersecurity competitions, etc. And to increase the security knowledge and skills of college students, and encourage. And to guide college students to join the cybersecurity industry.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4>Education And Safety Skills Training</h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> The company conducts safety awareness education and safety skills training for internal employees. The cost of security awareness training is relatively low. And that compared to the record and high financial losses to businesses caused by data breaches. And in most cases, training costs are less than 1% of the cost of a breach. Businesses of all sizes are beginning to realize. That internal threats are just as important as external threats. That is especially as telecommuting becomes the new normal amid the <a href="https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">COVID-19 pandemic</a>. And employee security awareness education is more important than ever, and needs to be complemented.” Human Vulnerability". The more employees are educated on security awareness, the lower. The overall security risk of the enterprise, and the more cyber-resilient the enterprise becomes.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

			<wp:comment_id>140</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Steph B]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email><![CDATA[bryans.co@k12-us-online.org]]></wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url>https://biblewoke.com</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[43.225.189.117]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2022-12-25 06:15:47]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-12-25 01:15:47]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Whether you believe in God or not, this is a must-read message!!!

Throughout time, we can see how we have been slowly conditioned to come to this point where we are on the verge of a cashless society. Did you know that the Bible foretold of this event almost 2,000 years ago?

In Revelation 13:16-18, we read,

"He (the false prophet who decieves many by his miracles) causes all, both small and great, rich and poor, free and slave, to receive a mark on their right hand or on their foreheads, and that no one may buy or sell except one who has the mark or the name of the beast, or the number of his name.

Here is wisdom. Let him who has understanding calculate the number of the beast, for it is the number of a man: His number is 666."

Referring to the last generation, this could only be speaking of a cashless society. Why? Revelation 13:17 tells us that we cannot buy or sell unless we receive the mark of the beast. If physical money was still in use, we could buy or sell with one another without receiving the mark. This would contradict scripture that states we need the mark to buy or sell!

These verses could not be referring to something purely spiritual as scripture references two physical locations (our right hand or forehead) stating the mark will be on one "OR" the other. If this mark was purely spiritual, it would indicate only in one place.

This is where it really starts to come together. It is shocking how accurate the Bible is concerning the implatnable RFID microchip. These are notes from a man named Carl Sanders who worked with a team of engineers to help develop this RFID chip

"Carl Sanders sat in seventeen New World Order meetings with heads-of-state officials such as Henry Kissinger and Bob Gates of the C.I.A. to discuss plans on how to bring about this one-world system. The government commissioned Carl Sanders to design a microchip for identifying and controlling the peoples of the world—a microchip that could be inserted under the skin with a hypodermic needle (a quick, convenient method that would be gradually accepted by society).

Carl Sanders, with a team of engineers behind him, with U.S. grant monies supplied by tax dollars, took on this project and designed a microchip that is powered by a lithium battery, rechargeable through the temperature changes in our skin. Without the knowledge of the Bible (Brother Sanders was not a Christian at the time), these engineers spent one-and-a-half-million dollars doing research on the best and most convenient place to have the microchip inserted.

Guess what? These researchers found that the forehead and the back of the hand (the two places the Bible says the mark will go) are not just the most convenient places, but are also the only viable places for rapid, consistent temperature changes in the skin to recharge the lithium battery. The microchip is approximately seven millimeters in length, .75 millimeters in diameter, about the size of a grain of rice. It is capable of storing pages upon pages of information about you. All your general history, work history, crime record, health history, and financial data can be stored on this chip.

Brother Sanders believes that this microchip, which he regretfully helped design, is the “mark” spoken about in Revelation 13:16–18. The original Greek word for “mark” is “charagma,” which means a “scratch or etching.” It is also interesting to note that the number 666 is actually a word in the original Greek. The word is “chi xi stigma,” with the last part, “stigma,” also meaning “to stick or prick.” Carl believes this is referring to a hypodermic needle when they poke into the skin to inject the microchip."

Mr. Sanders asked a doctor what would happen if the lithium contained within the RFID microchip leaked into the body. The doctor replied by saying a terrible sore would appear in that location. This is what the book of Revelation says:

"And the first (angel) went, and poured out his vial on the earth; and there fell a noisome and grievous sore on the men which had the mark of the beast, and on them which worshipped his image" (Revelation 16:2).

You can read more about it here--and to also understand the mystery behind the number 666: https://2ruth.org/rfid-mark-of-the-beast-666-revealed/

The third angel's warning in Revelation 14:9-11 states,

"Then a third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, 'If anyone worships the beast and his image, and receives his mark on his forehead or on his hand, he himself shall also drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out full strength into the cup of His indignation. He shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels and in the presence of the Lamb. And the smoke of their torment ascends forever and ever; and they have no rest day or night, who worship the beast and his image, and whoever receives the mark of his name.'"

Who is Barack Obama, and why is he still in the public scene?

So what's in the name? The meaning of someone's name can say a lot about a person. God throughout history has given names to people that have a specific meaning tied to their lives. How about the name Barack Obama? Let us take a look at what may be hiding beneath the surface.

Jesus says in Luke 10:18, "...I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven."

The Hebrew Strongs word (H1299) for "lightning": "bârâq" (baw-rawk)

In Isaiah chapter 14, verse 14, we read about Lucifer (Satan) saying in his heart:

"I will ascend above the heights of the clouds, I will be like the Most High."

In the verses in Isaiah that refer directly to Lucifer, several times it mentions him falling from the heights or the heavens. The Hebrew word for the heights or heavens used here is Hebrew Strongs 1116: "bamah"--Pronounced (bam-maw')

In Hebrew, the letter "Waw" or "Vav" is often transliterated as a "U" or "O," and it is primarily used as a conjunction to join concepts together. So to join in Hebrew poetry the concept of lightning (Baraq) and a high place like heaven or the heights of heaven (Bam-Maw), the letter "U" or "O" would be used. So, Baraq "O" Bam-Maw or Baraq "U" Bam-Maw in Hebrew poetry similar to the style written in Isaiah, would translate literally to "Lightning from the heights." The word "Satan" in Hebrew is a direct translation, therefore "Satan."

So when Jesus told His disciples in Luke 10:18 that He beheld Satan fall like lightning from heaven, if this were to be spoken by a Jewish Rabbi today influenced by the poetry in the book of Isaiah, he would say these words in Hebrew--the words of Jesus in Luke 10:18 as, And I saw Satan as Baraq O Bam-Maw.

The names of both of Obama's daughters are Malia and Natasha. If we were to write those names backward (the devil does things in reverse) we would get "ailam ahsatan". Now if we remove the letters that spell "Alah" (Allah being the false god of Islam), we get "I am Satan". Coincidence? I don't think so.

Obama's campaign logo when he ran in 2008 was a sun over the horizon in the west, with the landscape as the flag of the United States. In Islam, they have their own messiah that they are waiting for called the 12th Imam, or the Mahdi (the Antichrist of the Bible), and one prophecy concerning this man's appearance is the sun rising in the west.

"Then I saw another angel flying in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach to those who dwell on the earth—to every nation, tribe, tongue, and people— saying with a loud voice, 'Fear God and give glory to Him, for the hour of His judgment has come; and worship Him who made heaven and earth, the sea and springs of water.'" (Revelation 14:6-7)

Why have the word's of Jesus in His Gospel accounts regarding His death, burial, and resurrection, been translated into over 3,000 languages, and nothing comes close? The same God who formed the heavens and earth that draws all people to Him through His creation, likewise has sent His Word to the ends of the earth so that we may come to personally know Him to be saved in spirit and in truth through His Son Jesus Christ.

Jesus stands alone among the other religions that say to rightly weigh the scales of good and evil and to make sure you have done more good than bad in this life. Is this how we conduct ourselves justly in a court of law? Bearing the image of God, is this how we project this image into reality?

Our good works cannot save us. If we step before a judge, being guilty of a crime, the judge will not judge us by the good that we have done, but rather by the crimes we have committed. If we as fallen humanity, created in God's image, pose this type of justice, how much more a perfect, righteous, and Holy God?

God has brought down His moral laws through the 10 commandments given to Moses at Mt. Siani. These laws were not given so we may be justified, but rather that we may see the need for a savior. They are the mirror of God's character of what He has put in each and every one of us, with our conscious bearing witness that we know that it is wrong to steal, lie, dishonor our parents, murder, and so forth.

We can try and follow the moral laws of the 10 commandments, but we will never catch up to them to be justified before a Holy God. That same word of the law given to Moses became flesh about 2,000 years ago in the body of Jesus Christ. He came to be our justification by fulfilling the law, living a sinless perfect life that only God could fulfill.

The gap between us and the law can never be reconciled by our own merit, but the arm of Jesus is stretched out by the grace and mercy of God. And if we are to grab on, through faith in Him, He will pull us up being the one to justify us. As in the court of law, if someone steps in and pays our fine, even though we are guilty, the judge can do what is legal and just and let us go free. That is what Jesus did almost 2,000 years ago on the cross. It was a legal transaction being fulfilled in the spiritual realm by the shedding of His blood.

For God takes no pleasure in the death of the wicked (Ezekiel 18:23). This is why in Isaiah chapter 53, where it speaks of the coming Messiah and His soul being a sacrifice for our sins, why it says it pleased God to crush His only begotten Son.

This is because the wrath that we deserve was justified by being poured out upon His Son. If that wrath was poured out on us, we would all perish to hell forever. God created a way of escape by pouring it out on His Son whose soul could not be left in Hades but was raised and seated at the right hand of God in power.

So now when we put on the Lord Jesus Christ (Romans 13:14), God no longer sees the person who deserves His wrath, but rather the glorious image of His perfect Son dwelling in us, justifying us as if we received the wrath we deserve, making a way of escape from the curse of death--now being conformed into the image of the heavenly man in a new nature, and no longer in the image of the fallen man Adam.

Now what we must do is repent and put our trust and faith in the savior, confessing and forsaking our sins, and to receive His Holy Spirit that we may be born again (for Jesus says we must be born again to enter the Kingdom of God--John chapter 3). This is not just head knowledge of believing in Jesus, but rather receiving His words, taking them to heart, so that we may truly be transformed into the image of God. Where we no longer live to practice sin, but rather turn from our sins and practice righteousness through faith in Him in obedience to His Word by reading the Bible.

Our works cannot save us, but they can condemn us; it is not that we earn our way into everlasting life, but that we obey our Lord Jesus Christ:

"And having been perfected, He became the author of eternal salvation to all who obey Him." (Hebrews 5:9)

"Now I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away. Also there was no more sea. Then I, John, saw the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband. And I heard a loud voice from heaven saying, 'Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them, and they shall be His people. God Himself will be with them and be their God. And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes; there shall be no more death, nor sorrow, nor crying. There shall be no more pain, for the former things have passed away.'

Then He who sat on the throne said, 'Behold, I make all things new.' And He said to me, 'Write, for these words are true and faithful.'

And He said to me, 'It is done! I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End. I will give of the fountain of the water of life freely to him who thirsts. He who overcomes shall inherit all things, and I will be his God and he shall be My son. But the cowardly, unbelieving, abominable, murderers, sexually immoral, sorcerers, idolaters, and all liars shall have their part in the lake which burns with fire and brimstone, which is the second death.'" (Revelation 21:1-8).]]></wp:comment_content>
