					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Pros and Cons of Private Cloud, Public Cloud, Hybrid Cloud Security.]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/pros-and-cons-of-private-cloud-public-cloud-hybrid-cloud-security/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 May 2022 16:53:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=719</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Whether an enterprise's infrastructure is running in a private cloud, public cloud, or hybrid cloud, <a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-cyber-security-explains-the-concept-of-security-concrete/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">cybersecurity</a> is a critical part (Pros and Cons cloud security). When it comes to<a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-cloud-security/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener"> cloud computing security,</a> there is no one-size-fits-all architecture. IT architects must measure the cybersecurity needs of all business applications and data sets. Once defined, technical services can be classified and designated for deployment in public or private clouds, while the various cloud platforms play their part and make sense from a cost and cybersecurity perspective.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>They need to understand the differences between private and public cloud security and hybrid cloud security Before enterprises decide to deploy <a href="https://techodu.com/cloud-computing-for-beginners/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">cloud computing</a>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Whether an enterprise's infrastructure is running in a private cloud, public cloud, or hybrid cloud, cybersecurity is a critical part. While some cloud computing architectures significantly simplify security tasks and tool integration, it often comes at the cost of a lack of flexibility.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The below outlines the security differences between public, hybrid and private clouds beyond 2021, along with their pros and cons(Pros and Cons cloud security).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Public cloud security</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Enterprises can partner with third-party cloud computing service providers (CSPs) to manage applications and data in their cloud computing infrastructure. Many cloud computing service providers (CSPs) also offer built-in security tools to help protect critical business data.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Security benefits of public cloud</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Enterprises are attracted to public clouds for a number of reasons, including lower capital expenditures, service scalability, and reduced administrative workload for internal IT staff. And the security advantage of public cloud infrastructure includes the below:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Lighten the load. Large cloud computing service providers (CSPs) typically invest heavily in high-end cybersecurity tools and have staff with extensive knowledge in their field. This makes it very attractive to move cybersecurity tools and tasks from on-premises to third-party cloud services.<br>Address the cybersecurity skills gap. The ability to comply with cloud computing service provider (CSP) security plans reduces the need to hire expensive and scarce information security talent.<br>Disadvantages of public cloud security</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Some businesses (especially large ones with large IT infrastructures) may find public cloud security a few drawbacks. Potential public cloud security challenges include:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cloud computing service provider (CSP) security is not up to par. In some cases, it may be determined that the cloud computing service provider's (CSP) cybersecurity tools, processes, and methods are insufficient to protect highly sensitive data.<br>Insufficient visibility. Large enterprises often require the ability to acquire and analyze logs, alerts, and other data down to the packet level. For many cloud computing service providers (CSPs), especially those dealing with SaaS, a lot of security information is not accessible to customers. This is because most underlying technology is abstracted to simplify management from the customer's perspective.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Private cloud security</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As the name suggests, a private cloud allows an enterprise private entry to the cloud platform's dedicated infrastructure resources. Like the public cloud, this infrastructure has advantages and disadvantages.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Advantages of Private Cloud Security</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Private clouds are attractive to businesses looking for more granular control over their infrastructure. This typically includes customer configuration access to the network, operating system, and server virtualization platform. From a security point of view, the benefits of a private cloud include:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>better control. Inside administrators have more flexibility in carrying out and accessing security tools.<br>fully visible. With a private cloud, businesses have complete control and visibility into their cybersecurity posture, which can be customized to meet their specific needs.<br>Disadvantages of Private Cloud Security</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>By now, the dissimilarity between public and private cloud security has become more apparent, mostly when it comes to controls. However, the flexibility of a private cloud comes at two costs: financial and administrative.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Financial costs. Operating a private cloud is often more expensive than a public cloud. Many businesses pay a premium for granular cloud computing control and visibility.<br>management costs. Designing and maintaining cybersecurity tools inside a private cloud significantly increases management responsibilities.<br>For these two reasons, it is critical that IT decision-makers carefully weigh the cybersecurity benefits of private clouds against the increased financial and administrative costs.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Hybrid cloud security</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Finally, there are many enterprises operating in a hybrid cloud environment. Some business applications and data reside in public clouds, others are managed incorporate private clouds or on-premises data centers.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>The benefits of hybrid cloud security</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>With a hybrid cloud, the whole can be greater than the sum of its parts. The security benefits of a hybrid cloud infrastructure include:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Combine strengths. A hybrid cloud enterprise architecture that combines the best features of public and private clouds can provide maximum security.<br>flexibility. The hybrid model enables IT, administrators, to decide where applications and data will reside, such as in a cloud platform or on-premises data center.<br>Disadvantages of Hybrid Cloud Security(Pros and Cons cloud security).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Like a private cloud, the flexibility of hybrid cloud infrastructure has its drawbacks. For example, decisions about where applications and data reside is an important responsibility that requires careful consideration. the company must consider the below potential disadvantages of the hybrid cloud model:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Policy implementation challenges. Cybersecurity policies can become difficult to replicate and scale to public and private clouds and on-premises data centers. In some cloud computing architectures, such as SaaS, it may not be possible to replicate security policies found in other parts of the enterprise infrastructure.<br>Security is inconsistent. Some applications and data may not be as secure as others due to policy enforcement issues.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>More skills are required. Enterprise security administrators must deal with different methods and tools to monitor for threats and take action based on where vulnerable resources are located.<br>Given these challenges, it's important to remember that infrastructure security tools are essentially virtualized. This means the same security tools and policy configurations deployed in on-premises data centers and across corporate LANs can be extended to private clouds for hybrid or multi-cloud security. For many security organizations, this significantly reduces security complexity from a consistency standpoint.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>All cloud computing options need to be explored before deciding on a deployment model.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>How to Determine the Best Cloud Security Options</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>When it comes to cloud computing security, there is no one-size-fits-all architecture. IT architects must measure the cybersecurity needs of all business applications and data sets. Once defined, technical services can be classified and designated for deployment in public or private clouds, while the various cloud platforms play their part and make sense from a cost and cybersecurity perspective.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Amazon registration strategy]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/amazon-registration-strategy/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 19 May 2022 16:02:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=725</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Amazon registration strategy: teach you in detail the precautions for registering an Amazon seller account!<br>As more and more e-commerce sellers focus on the global cross-border e-commerce field, more and more sellers want to realize the globalization of e-commerce through Amazon's global store opening.<br>So, how to successfully register an account for Amazon's global store and take the first step in the internationalization of e-commerce? Today's dry goods will introduce the details of the materials to be submitted to register an Amazon account, as well as the matters needing attention!<br>The entire registration process is divided into three parts, namely, before registration, during registration, and after registration (Amazon registration strategy).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>1. Before registration</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Registration Preface</strong><br>From account registration, all sellers on Amazon must comply with the Selling Policies and Seller Code of Conduct. We require sellers to act fairly and honestly on Amazon to ensure a safe buying and selling experience.<br>For violations of the Code of Conduct or any other Amazon policy, Amazon may take action against your account, such as canceling items, suspending or forfeiting payments, and revoking selling privileges.<br>Registration Notice<br>● All sellers must provide accurate information to Amazon and buyers and update the information as it changes. This includes:<br>➧ The business name you use must accurately identify your business;<br>➧ Provide the most accurate and up-to-date business address, email, and phone number so Amazon can contact you if necessary.<br>● Make sure you are using a valid international credit card and a valid billing address to charge.<br>● Amazon may suspend or terminate your account and selling privileges if we determine that your account has been used for deceptive, fraudulent, or illegal activity (eg, using a purchased account to sell).<br>Preparation of registration materials<br>Before registering a global store account, you need to prepare all the materials as required, including:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>2. Color scanned copy of the company's business license: must be issued by mainland China, Hong Kong, China Taiwan</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>➧ Mainland China Enterprises: Business License<br>➧ Hong Kong Enterprises: Certificate of Incorporation and Business Registration Ordinance<br>➧ Taiwanese enterprises: Limited company establishment registration form/joint-stock company establishment registration form/limited company change registration form/joint limited company change registration form.<br>Note: The business license in mainland China should be more than 45 days away from the expiration date, and the business registration regulations in Hong Kong should be more than 45 days away from the expiration date.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>3. Your legal ID card's color scanned Copy:</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>➧ The name on the ID card must be the same as the name of the legal representative on the business license<br>➧ The name on the ID should exactly match the name on the <a href="https://sellercentral.amazon.com/ap/signin?clientContext=134-8177327-4311468&amp;openid.return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fsellercentral.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fhomepage.html&amp;openid.identity=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0%2Fidentifier_select&amp;openid.assoc_handle=sc_na_amazon_v2&amp;openid.mode=checkid_setup&amp;openid.claimed_id=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0%2Fidentifier_select&amp;openid.ns=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0&amp;mons_redirect=sign_in&amp;ssoResponse=eyJ6aXAiOiJERUYiLCJlbmMiOiJBMjU2R0NNIiwiYWxnIjoiQTI1NktXIn0.Uh2t5uZWFhm0ZbxOCVatQhBeGTYnPY1s58mk1C4zHQYOnycPMKUaFQ.lJgfpKBIOwaZP-ba.Xo2GV_f9w1gHAV47aB02DtYDh1ib-Dmym1wfliu49V_mSqF61EhptYM8BFkIDTHPOmratyCOcEVV5SXs3_MqE85tbsI0W1BzAYczmCsCpTYCfAq16FT2jjmknBdIkJRhWy7H_Ccp87FISIap_fr9KgHVUaH3gmr5cjbxdM--MKFl2CSRdK7D5KTV8F5r15XXpT1jmW0yGnH6tPXGiAhwoIbSanWPdEuxb6X4Es7MdbZE3DtPDpeRuNnHpEFgLYNLGIX9.Q_L4H7NDhQbrYUDnDo5oBg" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">registered Amazon account</a><br>➧ Must be issued by Mainland China, Hong Kong, China Taiwan<br>➧ ID card must be within the validity period</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>4<strong>.</strong> Payment by credit card:</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>➧ Credit card for international payment (VISA or MasterCard, VISA preferred)<br>➧ Confirm that the payment function in the currency of the country of sale is enabled. If you open multiple malls at the same time, it is recommended to use a credit card that supports multi-currency payment<br>➧ Verify that your credit card has not expired and has a sufficient credit limit, and there are no restrictions on online or mail order payments</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>5. Contact:</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>➧ Contact's email address<br>➧ Phone number of the contact person (recommended to fill in the contact number of the legal person)<br>➧ Company address and contact number<br>Be sure to provide the correct phone number, and we'll use this contact to reach you with any important questions!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>6. Bank Account:</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>The bank account used to receive payments, there are three options below (choose one of the three)</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>➧ Domestic bank account<br>➧ US/Hong Kong bank account<br>➧ Third-party deposit accounts<br>Please ensure that the registration information and information are all required information. If the information is incomplete and untrue, the registration will not be successful.<br>Precautions<br>● Please prepare the above materials before registration (Amazon registration strategy), otherwise, you will be stuck in a certain step and cannot continue. The registration process is irreversible, but it can be interrupted, that is, you can leave for a period of time and then come back to log in with the correct registration email and set the password to continue the registration. If you are unable to log in, please make sure that the network environment is stable, you can try to clear the browser cookies and change the browser;<br>● Except for the special requirements in this document, please fill in all information in Pinyin or English;<br>● Ensure that the information filled in and submitted by Seller Central must be true and valid and consistent with the information in the submitted documents;<br>● Make sure your contact information is up to date (email address and phone number) so Amazon can contact you if necessary;<br>● The credit card used for payment and settlement submitted by the seller platform is recommended to use a corporate credit card, and the bank account information must be true and valid;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● Other notes:<br>➧ It is recommended to use a stable dedicated network environment, VPN/VPS/Super Browser is not recommended<br>➧ It is recommended that the seller keep the purchase invoice. Whether you encounter an audit or category application meantime the follow-up operation, you may be requested to provide the corresponding purchase invoice<br>➧ The operation must be compliant, please strictly follow Amazon's regulations, if you don't understand Amazon's regulations, it is recommended to check the seller platform or help-seller support<br>➧ For sellers in Hong Kong, China, please select "Hong Kong" in the country/region where the company is located (this information cannot be changed after submission, and the wrong selection may lead to verification failure)</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>2. Registering</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Seller Support</strong><br>If you have any questions during registration (Amazon registration strategy), you can click the "Get Support" button on the page to get corresponding support.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Verify email</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>During the registration process, sellers will receive an email from Amazon with a 6-digit verification code. If you don't receive the verification email, go to the spam box to see if it has been classified as spam by the mailbox. If it still doesn't, wait a moment and click the "Resend Verification" link on the screen.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Fill in company information</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:list {"ordered":true} -->
<ol><li><strong>Select the company address:</strong> in the "Company Address" drop-down list, please correctly select the country or region you are in (for mainland Chinese sellers, select "China");</li><li> <strong>Please keep the same as your office address when filling in the company address;</strong></li><li><strong>Fill in the company name</strong>: When the seller fills in the company's legal name, if it is prompted that the legal name is too long, it is recommended to use all lowercase pinyin without spaces; if the maximum input limit is exceeded, please try to fill in the main part of the company name;</li><li><strong>PIN code verification: </strong>The PIN receiving method means which method to use for verification, you can choose SMS or phone. When there is an error in the system verification, please try to use other; language verification or SMS verification, 3 times unsuccessful, you need to wait for 1 hour before re-verification;</li><li><strong>Main contact person: </strong>Please fill in the pinyin of the name of the legal person of the company. If the main contact person is not the legal representative, the authorization letter of the legal representative needs to be provided in the later review;</li><li><strong>Fill in the credit card information:</strong></li></ol>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>➧ If the billing address of the credit card you fill in is inconsistent with the billing address you filled in the bank, it may cause the account registration to fail.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Fill in the seller's personal information</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● If the residential address is different from the default corporate office address on the page, you can click the "Add another address" link to add a new address;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● The beneficiary of the company: the beneficiary must be the owner or manager of the company, that is, a person who directly or indirectly owns 25% or more of the company's shares, or has the right to decide business development, or exercise management rights over the company in other forms. company. Please fill in the number of beneficiaries according to the actual situation, and fill in the contact information of each beneficiary. Please fill in all the information in pinyin, and the information will be verified. If the beneficiary of the company has only one legal representative, "I have added all the beneficiaries of this company", select "Yes", if not, select "No". If you select No, you need to further enter other beneficiary information.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Fill in credit card information</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Check that the default address information is the same as the credit card billing address. If different, please click "Add New Address", and then fill in the new address information in English or Pinyin.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Submit Authentication</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● It may take a while to upload the photo. After the upload is successful, click the “Submit” button at the bottom, and then close this page after seeing the green identity verification information submitted;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● If you see the red information correction page when submitting, please check the email in your registered email stating the reason for not passing and resubmit as required. There will be a total of three opportunities to resubmit;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● Please check the company address here. It should be noted that the company address here is the office address filled in by default. If the office address is not the business address of the enterprise, you need to click "Add a different billing address" and enter the registered address on the business license of the enterprise in pinyin.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Please note: Please provide color photos or color scans for business licenses and legal person ID cards (paper scans are acceptable, electronic business licenses are not acceptable), missing corners and edges are not acceptable, black and white photocopies are not acceptable, and Screenshots. The files must be complete, clear, and readable. It is not allowed to use PS, Meitu Xiuxiu, and other Meitu tools to upload jigsaw puzzle files.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>3. After registration</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Complete account information<br>● After entering Seller Central, please confirm whether there are unfinished operations in the small red flag in the upper left corner and in all notification bars. kindly complete them in time, if not the product will not be made.<br>After completing the registration (Amazon registration strategy), if the account is deactivated<br>● After completing the account registration(amazon registration strategy), if you encounter account suspension, please click on the performance to view the "performance notice" and take corresponding actions; if your performance notice mentions that you need to submit the pipeline or natural gas, electricity, tap water or Internet service bills, sellers on North American/Japan sites, please submit utility bills as required; Note! Sellers on European sites only need to submit a business license;<br>● Prepare the bills required for the appeal as follows:<br>➧ Documents must be authentic and unmodified<br>➧ Issue Date: Provide utility bills within the last 90 days<br>➧ Bill Type: We only accept bills for plumbing or gas, electricity, water or internet services<br>➧ Billing header and address: The bill must show your full and current operating or residential address; Billing requirements for company sellers: The bill must show your company’s full legal name or full name of the legal representative, which also needs to be displayed on the on your business license<br>➧ Bill format: only color photos or color scans of bills in pdf, png, or gif format are accepted (screenshots are not accepted)<br>When you are in the appeal process, please be sure to avoid the following actions:<br>➧ Repeat the submission until Amazon has had enough time to review your appeal<br>➧ Submitted documents that are incomplete, illegible, doctored, marked or screenshotted<br>➧ Submit expired or invalid types of documents</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[History of the Internet]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/history-of-the-internet/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 May 2022 21:39:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=733</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>History of the Internet</strong>: Prior to the form of communication that led to the Internet, most computer networks were limited in nature and allowed communication only between stations on the local network. The method for creating communication between computers was based on a model of a central mainframe computer. A number of research projects have begun to examine and describe principles of communication between physically separated networks. The research efforts were conducted in parallel in a number of laboratories in the NPL (N) by Donald Davis, in the Rand Corporation by Paul Burn, at MIT by Leonard Kleinrock, and at UCLA. The studies have led to the development of a model of digital networks based on packet switching. In the late 1960s and 1970s, a number of packet-switched solutions were developed, including ARPANET and X.25 protocols.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>This Computer was used by Berners-Lee at CERN and became the world's first web server</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>At the same time, amateur computer networks began to gain popularity, including UUCP (copy of UNIX to UNIX) and FidoNet. These networks were still separate and disconnected networks that received services through limited gateways. Due to this limitation, a packet switching method has been implemented for the purpose of developing a protocol for network communication, in the framework of which several networks will be able to connect together into a unified super-network. By setting up a common and simple network system in the form of TCP / IP, the physical layer of the network could be separated from the layer of the protocol. The expanding spread of inter-network connectivity led to the development of a global network called the "Internet" and was based on standard protocols officially implemented in 1982. Connection to the global network was rapid in the Western world and later permeated the rest of the world. However, the growing gap between developed and third world countries has widened the digital divide.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Internet providers began to appear in the 1980s, and in the 1990s Internet use expanded among private consumers. The increasing use of the Internet has had a significant impact on culture and commerce. Among the implications of the Internet were instant communications provided by e-mail services, forums and the WWW. Investor speculation regarding Internet-related inventions later led to the inflating of the dot-com bubble, which eventually exploded. However, the Internet is constantly expanding.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>The pre-internet era</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In the 1950s and early 1960s, before the widespread connectivity that led to the Internet, most communication networks were limited in that they allowed communication between stations associated with the network itself. Some of the networks had bridges between them but these were limited. A common form of networking for computers was based on a central computer method connected via leased lines. The method was used in the 1950s by the Rand Corporation to support researchers such as Herbert Simon at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania who collaborated with researchers in Illinois on automated proof of law and artificial intelligence.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Telnet</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The Telnet protocol was developed in 1969 for users who want to connect using the command line between computers connected to the same computer network, the innovation in the protocol was the ability to chat with other computers using direct text commands, without software mediation.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>BBS</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Bulletin Board System - BBS is software that allows users to connect to the computer on which the software is installed. This connection was made in the past with the help of an analog telephone line, the purpose of the connection was to carry out various social and entertainment activities, with the help of appropriate software. Users can download and upload various files, play games, read news, and exchange messages with other users.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Three terminals and the vision of the global network</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>One of the pioneers in calling a global network was J.C.R. Licklider who published his ideas in his 1960 article on the subject of machine-symbiosis</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A network of such computers are interconnected in broadband communications and which will provide library functions along with functions related to expected advances in the field of information storage and retrieval.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>- J.C.R. Licklider, a human symbiosis known as 1960</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In October 1962, Liclider was appointed head of the United States Department of Defense's Advanced Research Division. The division was then part of the Department of Defense's data processing office but was later renamed DARPA. Liquidar has created a group that will expand research in computing. As part of the role of the data processing office, three network terminals were installed. One terminal for the systems development company in Santa Monica, another terminal for the Ginny project at the University of Berkeley and another terminal for the time-sharing system project at MIT.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For each of the three terminals I had three different sets of user commands. So if I was talking to someone at S.D.C and I wanted to talk to someone from an acquaintance at Berkeley or MIT I would have to leave the S.D.C terminal and connect to the other terminal to talk to them. [...] I said, it's clear what needs to be done (but I do not want to do it): if you have three terminals, there must be one terminal that goes wherever you want and where there are interactive computers. This idea is actually ARPAnet.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>- Robert Taylor Liclider's partner in writing the book "The Computer as a Communication Device" during an interview with the New York Times</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Packet switching</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The essence of the problem of interconnection is in connecting separate physical networks to one unified logical network. During the 1960s, Paul Bern of the Rand Corporation researched the creation of survivable networks for the United States military. In <a href="https://bernnetwork.org/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Bern's network</a>, the information transmitted is divided into packets of messages. Donald Davis from NPL proposed and created a similar network based on what he called packet branding. Leonard Kleinrock of MIT developed the mathematical theory behind the new technology. The packet switching method allows better utilization of bandwidth and improves response times compared to traditional circuit switching-based technology used in telephony. Especially when the inter-network connections have limited resources.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The packet switching method has a network design that allows for quick storage and sending. Messages are divided into arbitrary portions. Routing decisions are made on a package basis and not on a complete notice basis. Older networks used the method of switching messages which required rigid routing patterns which were sensitive to a single point of failure in the network.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Networks that led to the creation of the Internet</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>ARPANET</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A section of a pipe from the original Internet network, in 1969. Exhibited in the Internet archive.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Having previously been the head of the DARPA Information Processing Office, Robert Taylor intended to realize Liclider's vision of a networked network. Bringing in Lawrence Roberts from MIT he embarked on a project aimed at building such a network. The first ARPANET connection was established between the University of California, Los Angeles and Stanford University at 10:30 pm on October 29, 1969. By December 5, 1969, a 4-node network was connected by adding the University of Utah and the University of California, Santa Barbara. Based on ideas from the ALOHA protocol ARPANET evolved rapidly. By 1981, the number of servers had grown to 213. A new server was added about every 20 days. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>ARPANET has become the technical core of what will eventually become the Internet. ARPANET has also been a key tool in the development of Internet technologies. ARPANET's development revolved around the concept of the Request for Comments which is still in use for the distribution of Internet protocols and systems. RFC 1, was written by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_Crocker" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Steve Crocker of the University of California,</a> Los Angeles and published in April 1969.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>International cooperation on ARPANET has been rare. Due to various political reasons, European developers have focused on developing X.25 networks.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>X.25 and the concept of public access</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Based on ARPA research, the ITU (International Telecommunication Union) has developed standards for packet-switched networks. The devices were X.25 and its derivatives. When performing packet switching, the X.25 standard for virtual circuits allows emulation of traditional telephone links. In 1974, X.25 was the basis for the SERCnet network between the British Academy and research sites. Standard X.25 was approved in March 1976.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>UUCP</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In 1979, the two students, Tom Truscott and Jim Ellis of Duke University came up with the idea that simple scripts could be used to convey news and messages on a line.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Tori. Following the public distribution of the software, the network of UUCP servers that transmit messages over Usenet has expanded. The new network that later became UUCPnet also created gateways and links between it and FidoNet and BBS servers. UUCP networks are rapidly becoming popular due to their low cost and ability to use leased lines, X.25 links, and even ARPANET connections. In addition to these networks, no rigid regulations were attached compared to later networks such as CSNET and Bitnet. By 1981 the number of UUCP servers had grown to 550. That number nearly doubled to 940 in 1984. Sublink Network, which has been operating since 1987, based its connectivity on UCCP to distribute e-mail and messages in Italy.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>England National Laboratory of Physics</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In 1965, Robert Davis of the National Physics Laboratory of England proposed a nationwide data network based on packet switching. The proposal was not accepted at the national level but by 1970 Davis had managed to design and build a packet-based network to meet the multidisciplinary needs of the laboratory as well as to demonstrate the operational capability of the technology. [7] By 1976, 12 computers and 75 terminals were connected. Additional devices were gradually added until the network was replaced in 1986.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Union of Networks for Web Creation</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>TCP / IP</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Map of the TCP / IP-based test network in January 1982</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In view of the existence of such diverse methods of networking it was necessary to unify approaches. In order to solve the problem Robert E. recruited. Kahn risked DARPA the Winton Surf from Stanford University. Towards 1973, the two came to the conclusion that the gaps between network protocols could be bridged by hiding them through a common internetwork protocol ( History of the Internet ). Instead of the network being responsible for the reliability, as was the case with ARPANET, the servers accepted this responsibility. Surf notes the contribution of Hubert Zimmerman, Gerard Llan, and Louis Pousin (CYCLADES network designer) in working on the new standard.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The specification of the "RFC 675" protocol created by the working group of Winton Surf, Eugene Dellal, and Carl Sunshine in December 1974 contains the first use of the term "Internet" as an abbreviation for "Internetworking". Later specifications repeated the use of the term. At first it was used as an adjective and not as a noun as is customary.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Once the role of the network was reduced to the required minimum, it was possible to bind together almost all types of networks regardless of their unique characteristics. This is how Kahn's original problem was solved. DARPA agreed to fund the development of prototype software and after a number of years, a first demo was presented. The demonstration illustrated the mediation between the Packet Radio network in the San Francisco Bay Area and the ARPANET network. On November 22, 1977, [9] the demo was expanded to three networks ( History of the Internet ). The third network was the Atlantic packet satellite network. As a result of the first specifications of the TCP in 1974, the TCP / IP was born in the middle of 1978. Until 1981, the relevant standards were published and adopted in the form of RFC numbered 791, 792,793.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>DARPA encouraged and funded the implementation of TCP / IP for a variety of operating systems and then coordinated the transfer process of all servers in all of its packet networks for use in TCP / IP. On January 1, 1983, TCP / IP protocols became the only protocols approved on the ARPANET network to replace the NCP protocol.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Moving from ARPANET to a number of broadly covered federal networks: MILNET, NSI, and NSFNet</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>After ARPANET was established and worked for several years, ARPA began looking for another agency that would take responsibility for the network. ARPA's key role was to fund groundbreaking research and development rather than managing a communications site. Finally, in July 1975, the network passed into the hands of the American ICT Agency, which was part of the United States Department of Defense. In 1983, it was decided to separate the military part of the ARPANET network into an autonomous network called MILNET. MILNET later became an unclassified military network called NIPRNET ( History of the Internet ). In addition, there was a secretly classified network called SIPRNET and a network with a top-secret classification or higher called JWICS. NIPRNET has controlled gateways to the public Internet network.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The ARPANET-based networks were government-funded and therefore limited to non-commercial uses such as research. Commercial use was strictly prohibited. This meant that the networks were initially connected only to military sites and academic institutions ( History of the Internet ). During the 1980s more educational institutions and even commercial companies like HP were connected.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Visit: <a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-the-nist-cybersecurity-framework/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">What is the NIST Cybersecurity Framework?</a></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Both NASA NSF and the United States Department of Energy became involved in Internet research and began developing a successor to ARPANET. In the mid-1980s, these wings developed the first TCP / IP-based networks with an extensive coverage ( History of the Internet ). The NASA space agency developed the NASA science network, the NSF developed the CSNET and the energy division promoted the ESNet network.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Internet use and cultural implications</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>Email and Usenet</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>E-mail existed even before the Internet and served as an important means in its creation. E-mail was created in 1965 as a means for many central computer users to communicate with each other. It is possible that the first systems that had e-mail were SDC's Q32 and MIT's CTSS. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The ARPANET network has contributed greatly to the development of e-mail. There is one report [12] that talks about experimental mail transfers between systems shortly after ARPANET was established. In 1971, Ray Tomlinson created what would later become the standard e-mail address format using the @ bound sign to separate usernames and server names. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A number of protocols have been developed to allow mail to be sent between groups of shared computers on various systems such as UUCP and IBM's VNET system. This made it possible to transfer mail between several networks, including ARPANET, BITNET and NSFNet. In addition, mail could be transferred to servers connected directly to other sites using UUCP ( History of the Internet ).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>UUCP enabled text files that could be read by many others. The news software developed by Steve Daniel and Tom Trescott in 1979 was used to distribute news and bulletin board-style news. The software is tempting Ha quickly towards discussion groups on diverse topics ( History of the Internet ).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>Search engines</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Even before the WWW, there were search engines that tried to organize the Internet [History of the Internet]. The first was Archie (search engine) from McGill University in 1990, followed by WAIS and Gopher in 1991. All three of these systems preceded the invention of the WWW but all of them continued to index the network as well as the Internet for several years after the network appeared ( History of the Internet ).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As the web has expanded, search engines as well as web directories have been created to track web pages and allow people to find things. The first text-based search engine was WebCrawler in 1994. Before that, only the titles of web pages could be searched. Another early search engine was Lycos which was created in 1993 as a university project and was even the first to achieve commercial success. In the late 90 search engines and web directories became popular among users especially those of Yahoo and Altavista ( History of the Internet ).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>By August 2001, search engines had become more accepted than web directories mainly due to the rise of Google which has developed new approaches to retrieving information by relevance.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>Social Networks</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>An online social network is a platform for a group of people who communicate with each other. Already in ARPANET, the first to connect with it saw it as a means of collaboration between researchers. As a result of the advent of the internet, social networks have a new and strengthening role, with special features. Web applications take advantage of the existence of social networks and amplify their impact. Contributing to social networks in processes that are important to the individual, such as finding a job, a partner, a business partner or finding rare and necessary expertise.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Historiography</strong> <strong>( History of the Internet </strong>)</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Many concerns have been raised regarding the historiography dealing with the development of the Internet. In particular, the concern was raised that it is difficult to find documentation regarding the development of the Internet due to a variety of reasons, including the lack of centralized documentation of most of the early developments that eventually led to the Internet.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"The ARPANET period is documented relatively well because the responsible company - BBN - left documentation. During the transition to the NSFNET period, the documentation process lost its centrality. The documentation exists in people's warehouses and closets. [...] Most of what is done is done orally and on a basis Trust. "</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[What is the Internet?]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/what-is-the-internet/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 21 May 2022 11:40:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=739</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Before discussing what the Internet is, we must be clear about what a "network" is. A network is a group of computers that are connected to each other and able to send data to each other. A computer network is much like a social circle, a group of people who know each other, exchange information regularly, and coordinate activities together.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The Internet is a vast and continuous collection of interconnected networks. In fact, the term "Internet" can be said to have originated from this concept: an interconnected network.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Because computers within a network are connected to each other, and these networks are all connected to each other, over the Internet, one computer can communicate with another computer on a distant network. This makes it possible to quickly exchange information between computers around the world.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Visit:</strong> <a href="https://techodu.com/history-of-the-internet/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">History of the Internet?</a></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Computers are connected to each other and to the Internet through cables, radio waves, and other types of network infrastructure. All data sent over the Internet is converted into light or electrical pulses (also called "bits"), which are then interpreted by the receiving computer. Cables and radio waves conduct these bits at the speed of light. The more bits that can be crossed over these cables at a time, the faster the internet will run.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>What is a distributed network? Why is this concept important to the Internet?</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The Internet has no control center. Rather, it is a distributed network system; that is, it does not depend on any individual computer. Any computer or hardware that can send and receive data in the correct way (for example, using the correct network protocol) can be part of the Internet.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>The distributed nature of the Internet makes it resilient.</strong> Computers, servers, and other networking hardware can be connected to or disconnected from the Internet at any time without affecting the functionality of the Internet; computers, on the other hand, maybe completely inoperable without a component. The same is true at scale: if a server, an entire data center, or an entire region of data centers fails, the rest of the internet can still function (potentially slower).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>How does the Internet work?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The fundamentals of how the Internet works consist of two main concepts: <strong>packets and protocols.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Data pack</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In networking, a packet is a small part of a larger message. Each packet contains data and information about that data. Information about the contents of the packet is called a "header" and it is placed at the very front of the packet. So that the receiving machine knows what to do with the packet. To know the purpose of packet headers, consider how some consumer products come with assembly instructions.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>When data is sent over the Internet, it is first broken up into smaller packets and then converted into bits. Packets are routed to their destination through various network devices such as routers and switches. As the packets arrive at their destination, the receiving device reassembles the packets in sequence, and the data can then be used or displayed.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The process can be compared to the construction of the Statue of Liberty in the United States. The Statue of Liberty was originally designed and built in France. However, it was too large to fit on a ship, so it was shipped to the US in pieces, with instructions on where each piece belonged. Workers who received the blocks reassembled them into the statue that stands in New York today.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Shipping the Statue of Liberty took a long time. But sending digital messages over the internet in smaller pieces is very fast. For example, a photo of the Statue of Liberty stored on a web server can be sent one packet at a time, across the globe and loaded onto someone's computer, in a matter of milliseconds.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Packets are sent over the internet using a technique called packet switching. Intermediate routers and switches are able to process packets independently of each other, regardless of their source or destination. This is by design, and no single connection can dominate the network. Without packet switching, sending data between computers at a time, the connection between the two computers could take up several cables, and multiple router switches, in minutes. Basically, only two people can use the internet at a time, not as many as in reality.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Protocol</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Connecting two computers, which may use different hardware and run different software Was one of the main challenges that the creators of the Internet had to solve. This requires the use of communication technologies. That all connected computers can understand, just as two people who grew up in different parts of the world might need to talk in a common language to<br>know each other.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This problem can be solved by standardized protocols. In networking, a protocol is a standardized way to perform certain operations and format data so that two or more devices can communicate with and understand each other.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There are various protocols for sending packets between devices on the same network (Ethernet), sending packets between networks (IP), ensuring that those packets arrive successfully in order (TCP), and for websites and Application formatted data (HTTP), etc. In addition to these basic protocols, there are protocols for routing, testing, and encryption. There are also alternatives to the above protocols for different types of content. <strong>For example</strong>, streaming video typically uses UDP instead of TCP.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>All computers and other devices connected to the Internet can interpret and understand these protocols, so the Internet will work no matter what it is connected to.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>What is the physical infrastructure that enables the Internet to function?</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Many different kinds of hardware and infrastructure make the Internet accessible to all. Some of the most important types include:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Routers forward packets to other computer networks based on their destination. Routers are like traffic cops on the internet, making sure internet traffic goes to the right network.<br>A switch connects multiple devices that share a network. They use packet switching to forward packets to the correct device. They also receive outbound packets from these devices and deliver them to the correct destination.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Web servers are special high-performance computers that, in addition to hosting applications and databases, store content (web pages, images, videos, etc.) and serve them to users. Servers also respond to DNS queries and perform other important tasks that keep the Internet functioning properly. Most servers are housed in large data centers spread across the globe.<br>How do these concepts relate to the websites and applications that users access over the Internet?<br>Let's take this article as an example. In order for you to see this article, it is sent piece by piece over the internet in thousands of packets. These packets travel all the way from our web server to your computer or device through cables and radio waves through routers and switches. Your computer or smartphone receives these packets and passes them to the device's browser, which then interprets the data in those packets to display the text you're reading.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>The specific steps involved in this process are:</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>DNS Lookup:</strong> When your browser starts loading this page, it may first perform a DNS lookup to find the IP address of the Cloudflare website.<br><strong>TCP handshake</strong>: The browser opens a connection to this IP address.<br><strong>TLS handshake:</strong> The browser also sets up encryption between the Cloudflare web server and your device, making it impossible for attackers to read packets transmitted between these two endpoints.<br><strong>HTTP request:</strong> The browser requests the content displayed on this web page.<br><strong>HTTP Response:</strong> Cloudflare's servers deliver the content in the form of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript code, broken down into a series of packets. Once your device receives the packet and verifies that it has all been received. The browser interprets the HTML, CSS, and JavaScript code contained in the packet to render this article about how the internet works. The whole process only takes a second or two.<br>As you can see, loading a web page involves several different processes and protocols. You can learn more about these technologies in other sections of the Cloudflare Learning Center:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>DNS</strong></li><li><strong>TCP</strong></li><li><strong>TLS</strong></li><li><strong>HTTP</strong></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>What does "help build a better Internet" mean?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Creating the Internet was an incredible achievement that involved the combined efforts of thousands of individuals and organizations. Today, the fact that the Internet operates at a scale far beyond its creators' expectations is a testament to the value of the work they do.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>However, the internet doesn't always work. Network issues and malicious activity can slow down internet access or block it entirely. Third parties may monitor user activity, leading to abuse and, in some cases, government repression. Internet protocols and processes were not designed with security and privacy in mind. Because those who originally designed and built the Internet were more concerned with making it work than making it flawless.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Cloudflare's mission is to help build a better Internet. Cloudflare aims to achieve this in a number of ways, including:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Committed to developing newer, faster, and more secure protocols for the Internet Privacy first, build it into all products, and provide free services to enforce user privacy (e.g. 1.1.1.1 and DNS over HTTPS) Extend Cloudflare services to audiences around the world through an expanding network of international data centers Offers a variety of products to improve the security, performance, and reliability of web properties and network infrastructure. (many of which are freely available to everyone via a website or API) Helps developers build faster, more efficient serverless applications that better serve users Help users master how internet technologies work with the Learning Center and Cloudflare Blog To learn more about Cloudflare's ongoing efforts to improve the internet, <a href="https://techodu.com/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">visit our homepage</a> or follow our blog.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Cisco Education]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/cisco-education/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 21 May 2022 20:33:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=745</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Double the Impact: Education</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Expand access and improve the quality of education globally so students of all ages have the skills they need to succeed skills(Cisco Education).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We invest in educational programs designed to help students apply what they have learned. Our programs focus on preparing students to engage in ICT (ICT) occupations, while also emphasizing the importance of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) education, especially in under-educated communities. Through our own programs, numerous educational partners, and employee volunteering, we reach out to students at all levels and create an environment that exudes a passion for learning and gives students hope for a brighter future.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Cisco Networking Academy® Program</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Research conducted by IDC for Cisco shows that the innovation revolution driven by the power of the network has made society more sensitive to trained ICT professionals.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-cyber-security-explains-the-concept-of-security-concrete/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Demand for professionals is rising, but limited availability of ICT skills education results in a persistent and growing cyber skills gap</a>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Market segments around the world are experiencing shortages of network technology talent.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The Cisco Networking Academy program will teach students how to design, build, and manage computer networks, and how to ensure network security Complete. The program currently has 10,000 colleges in 165 countries and enrolls 1 million students annually Reserving talent for short-sighted positions within the scope, while helping to meet the educational needs of the local community. Cyber ​​Academy&#x2122; Program There are numerous trainees in key regions of Europe, Latin America, Asia, Africa, and the Middle East, and a considerable proportion is women's pregnancy. Some organizations specialize in offering Cyber ​​Academy courses to under-educated, poor, or disabled students, hoping to Open a career path for them to achieve their financial independence. For example, in India, "Network Technology Academy Without Borders" (NWB) plans to offer web-based technical college courses in Braille to the visually impaired. In Kenya, a similar program Networking Academy courses for the hearing impaired; in addition, Ukraine has a Networking Academy for orphans mechanism.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":5} -->
<h5><strong>Courses are blended learning, combining classroom instruction with online courses; Cisco NetSpace&#x2122; Learning Platform Support</strong></h5>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Students develop valuable career skills such as problem-solving, communication, and collaboration. Networking Academy program is Cisco's longest-running corporate social responsibility (CSR) program through partnerships with educational institutions, non-profit organizations, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), and government agencies Public-private partnerships forged by institutions and community centers have gained global support.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":746,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/cisco-courses-1024x614.jpg" alt="Cisco Courses" class="wp-image-746"/><figcaption>Cisco Vision</figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2> <strong>Cisco Education Plan</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>To expand opportunities for young people and equip people with valuable career skills, Cisco sponsors Educational programs, many of which are web technical college programs.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li> In Brazil, Cisco has established long-term partnerships with many governmental and non-governmental organizations, benefiting from the number of students in the program has exceeded 107,000. We have also launched special work to help places where education levels are weak and low Young people in the district, as well as students in technical schools or professionals in public institutions.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>In 2008, China experienced the largest earthquake in its history. Cisco assisted Sichuan Province in post-disaster reconstruction and also Help improve the quality of local education and health services. The Sishu Aid Sichuan Program has changed the educational model of local schools, Digitized and launched 25 Cisco Networking Academy.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>In 2009, parts of southern India were hit by floods. After learning of the disaster, Cisco launched the Samudaya project, which rebuilt 2,223 houses, two schools, and a primary health program education solution that enables 850 local children to communicate with teachers in urban areas via the Internet. Exist Elsewhere in India, the Network Institute's courses are geared towards serving veterans, widows whose husbands died in the war, and Military families, providing them with the opportunity to acquire new skills.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>The Institute of Network Technology has been rooted in Mexico for more than 15 years, with more than 300 institutions across the country enrolling more than 47,000 students, and has become part of a transformation program to help young people develop professional skills. In addition, Cisco has partnered with Mexico Brother's various teamwork to improve education through basic educational technology.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Since 2000, more than 33,000 students in Turkey have participated in the <a href="https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/about/csr/impact/education/networking-academy/emear-impact/turkey-infographic.html" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Cyber ​​Academy program</a>. Now, in Turkey, Eight of the top 10 universities offer Cyber ​​Academy programs, and the Cyber ​​Academy program will soon be part of a skills training program associated with various government programs. The Turkish military also provides Army, Air Force, and Navy personnel Networking Academy courses and has produced over 300 Networking Academy graduates since 2003.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Cisco Education Partner</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>To help train our 'workers of the future for jobs in STEM fields, we work with international cooperation with a number of non-profit organizations and social enterprises within the organization, including:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>MIND Research Institute,</strong> a company developing ST Math, a Mathematical Proficiency Software Program for Students), a US non-profit organization that has partnered with Cisco to release a web version of the program Ben, is currently piloting in London, Johannesburg, and Qatar.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Teach for All,</strong> is an independent society dedicated to providing more people with access to education in 23 countries Group of businesses. Cisco is helping the organization lay the groundwork for a global telecommunications platform that will facilitate Resource sharing and collaboration.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Teachers Without Borders (TWB),</strong> aims to bridge the global education divide. Cisco and Think the Science Foundation has awarded $2.8 million to support TWB's programs and has helped launch several TWB initiatives, including the Certificate of Competency (CTM) program, TWB toolset, community assessment tool, and online community GETIdeas.org.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Work for the Future</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>To meet the global demand for long-term growth, we must provide more people with educational opportunities, train "workers of the future", And build educated communities.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Cisco Corporate Social Responsibility</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We believe business has a responsibility to operate in a way that respects and ultimately benefits the public, communities, and the planet we live in;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>Social Responsibility (CSR)”.</strong> Our CSR core philosophy is that as long as problems are solved by combining human and technological networks, their impact is multiplied.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>So, we practice CSR in the same way that we run our business</strong>, by applying our technology, applying the expertise of our people, and working with our partners.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li><strong>We focus on four main goals:</strong> to enhance the well-being of people and societies around the world, to help our clients achieve the same while reducing our own environmental impact, to Operate with morality, and create favorable conditions for the growth of employees.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->]]></content:encoded>
