					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Machine Learning(Definition, Development Path, 4 Stages)]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/machine-learning-definition/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 28 May 2022 12:47:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=813</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Machine learning is a multi-domain interdisciplinary subject involving statistics, probability theory, algorithm complexity theory, approximation theory, convex analysis, and other disciplines. It specializes in how computers simulate or realize human learning behaviors to acquire new skills or knowledge, and reorganize existing knowledge structures to continuously improve their performance.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Definition</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Machine learning </strong>is a multidisciplinary interdisciplinary major, covering knowledge of complex algorithms, statistics, approximate theory, and probability theory. It uses computers as tools and is carried out to simulate real-time human learning techniques, and transforms existing content into knowledge structures. Division to effectively increase learning efficiency.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Machine learning has the following definitions:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list {"ordered":true} -->
<ol><li>Machine learning is the use of data or past experience to optimize the performance criteria of computer programs.</li><li>ML(<strong>Machine learning</strong>)<strong> </strong>is a science of artificial intelligence. The main research object in this field is artificial intelligence, especially how to better the performance of specific algorithms in observed learning.</li><li>Machine learning is the study of computer algorithms that can be automatically better through experience.</li></ol>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Development Path</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Machine learning</strong> has actually been around for decades or, arguably, centuries. Dating back to the 17th century, Bayesian and Laplace's derivation of least squares and Markov chains formed the tools and foundations of widely used machine learning. From 1950 (Alan Turing proposed to build a learning machine) to early 2000 (with practical applications of <a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-deep-learning/" target="_blank" aria-label="deep learning (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">deep learning</a> and more recent advances, such as AlexNet in 2012), machine learning has made great progress.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Since the study of machine learning in the 1950s, the research approaches and goals in different periods are different and can be divided into four stages.</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>First Stage </h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>The first stage</strong> was from the mid-1950s to the mid-1960s, and this period mainly studied "learning with or without knowledge". This kind of method mainly studies the execution ability of the system. During this period, the data fed back by the system is mainly detected by changing the environment of the machine and its corresponding performance parameters. It is like giving the system a program. By changing their free space function, the system will be affected by the program and change its own Organization, and finally, this system will choose an optimal environment to survive. The most representative study in this period is Samuel's chess program. But this machine-learning approach is far from meeting human needs.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Second Stage</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>The second stage</strong> is from the mid-1960s to the mid-1970s. This period mainly studies the implantation of knowledge in various fields into the system. The purpose of this stage is to simulate the process of human learning through machines. At the same time, the knowledge of graph structure and its logical structure is used for systematic description. In this research stage, various symbols are mainly used to represent machine language. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">When conducting experiments, researchers realize that learning is a long-term process. In this system environment, it is impossible to learn more in-depth knowledge, so researchers add the knowledge of various experts and scholars into the system, and practice has proved that this method has achieved certain results. The representative work in this stage is Hayes-Roth and Winson's systematic approach to structure learning.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Third Stage</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>The third <strong>stage</strong>,</strong> from the mid-1970s to the mid-1980s, is called the <a href="https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/revival" target="_blank" aria-label="revival period (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">revival period</a>. During this period, people have expanded from learning a single concept to learning multiple concepts, exploring different learning strategies and learning methods, and have begun to combine learning systems with various applications at this stage with great success. At the same time, the demand for knowledge acquisition by expert systems has greatly stimulated the research and development of <strong>machine learning</strong>. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">After the emergence of the first expert learning system, the example inductive learning system has become the mainstream of research, and automatic knowledge acquisition has become the research goal of  ML applications. In 1980, the first International Symposium on <strong>Machine Learning</strong> was held at Carnegie Mellon (CMU) in the United States, marking the rise of ML research around the world. Since then, ML has been widely used. In 1984, more than 20 artificial intelligence experts including Simon published the second volume of the <strong>Machine Learning</strong> collection, and the international magazine ML was founded, which further showed the rapid development trend of ML. The representative work of this stage includes Mostow's guided learning, Lenat's mathematical concept discovery program, Langley's BACON program, and its improvement program.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Fourth Stage</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>The fourth stage</strong>, the mid-1980s, is the latest stage of machine learning. ML in this period has the following characteristics:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list {"ordered":true} -->
<ol><li>Machine learning has become a new discipline, which comprehensively applies psychology, biology, neurophysiology, mathematics, automation, and computer science to form the theoretical basis of ML.</li><li>A unified view of various basic issues of <strong>machine learning</strong> and artificial intelligence is taking shape.</li><li>A variety of learning methods are integrated, and research on integrated learning systems in various forms is emerging.</li><li>The application scope of various learning methods has been continuously expanded, and some applied research results have been transformed into products.</li><li>Academic activities related to <strong>machine learning</strong> are unprecedentedly active.</li></ol>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Research Status </strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Machine learning</strong> is a day-to-day research hotspot in the field of <a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-artificial-intelligence/" target="_blank" aria-label="artificial intelligence (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">artificial intelligence</a> and pattern recognition, and its theories and procedure have been widely used to solve complex problems in engineering applications and science. The winner of the Turing Award in 2010 was Professor Leslie Valiant of Harvard University. One of his award-winning works was the establishment of the Probably Approximate Correct (PAC) learning theory; the winner of the Turing Award in 2011 was the University of California, Los Angeles. Professor Judea Pearl, whose main contribution is the establishment of artificial intelligence methods based on probability and statistics. These research results have contributed to the development and prosperity of machine learning.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Machine learning</strong> is a science that learning how to use computers to simulate or gain human learning activities. It is one of the most intelligent and cutting-edge research fields in AI(artificial intelligence). Since the 1980s, <strong>machine learning</strong>, as a way to realize artificial intelligence, has aroused widespread interest in the field of artificial intelligence. Mostly in the past 10 years, the research work in the area of ML has developed rapidly, and it has become the main part of artificial intelligence. one of the subjects.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Machine learning</strong> is used not only in knowledge-based systems but also in many fields such as natural language understanding, non-monotonic reasoning, machine vision, pattern recognition, etc. Whether a system has the ability to learn has become a sign of "intelligence". The research of ML is mainly divided into two research directions: the first is the research of traditional ML, which mainly studies the learning mechanism, focusing on the exploration of the learning mechanism of simulated humans; the second is the research of machine learning in the environment of big data. Research, this type of research mainly studies how to effectively use information, focusing on obtaining hidden, effective, and understandable knowledge from huge amounts of data. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">After 70 years of tortuous development, machine learning, represented by deep learning, draws on the multi-layered structure of the human brain, the layer-by-layer analysis, and processing mechanism of neuron connection and interaction information, and the powerful parallel information processing capability of self-adaptation and self-learning. There have been breakthroughs in the field of image recognition, the most representative of which is the field of image recognition.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[What is quantum computing?]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/quantum-computing/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 29 May 2022 07:59:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=826</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Quantum computing is a rapidly emerging technology that uses the laws of quantum mechanics to solve problems too complex for classical computers.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Today, IBM Quantum makes true quantum hardware for use by thousands of developers, a tool that scientists only started to imagine 30 years ago. Our engineers regularly deliver more powerful superconducting quantum processors that enable the quantum computing speed and power needed to change the world.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">These machines are very dissimilar from the traditional computers that have been around for more than half a century. This is a manual on this undisciplined technology.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Why do we need quantum computers?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">For some problems, supercomputers aren't that great.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">When scientists and engineers run into problems, they turn to supercomputers. These are very big traditional computers, often with thousands of traditional CPU and GPU cores. However, even with supercomputers, some problems are very difficult to solve.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">If supercomputers are powerless, it's probably because this large classical machine is being asked to solve highly complex problems. What makes traditional computers powerless is usually complexity</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">A complex problem is one in which many variables interact in complex ways. Modeling the behavior of individual atoms in a molecule is a complex problem because all the different electrons interact. Picking the ideal route for hundreds of tankers in a global shipping network is also a complex task.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Why quantum computers are faster</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Let's take a look at an example of how a <strong>quantum computing</strong> can successfully deal with a situation where a classical computer can't do anything:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Supercomputers may be good at tackling such daunting tasks as classifying large databases of protein sequences. But it's hard to see the subtle patterns in the data that determine the behavior of these proteins.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>How complexity beats supercomputers</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Proteins are made up of long strings of amino acids that, when folded into complex shapes, become useful biological machines. Figuring out how proteins fold is a problem of great importance to both biology and medicine.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong><a href="https://techodu.com/cloud-computing-for-beginners/" target="_blank" aria-label="Read Also: What is Cloud Computing? (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">Read Also: What is Cloud Computing?</a></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">A classical supercomputer might try to brute force the folding of a protein, using numerous processors to examine every possible way chemical chains could bend, and then come up with an answer. But as protein sequences get longer and more complex, supercomputers stop functioning. A chain of 100 amino acids could theoretically be folded in any of trillions of ways. No computer has enough working memory to handle all possible combinations of a single fold except <mark>quantum computing</mark>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Quantum computers are built for complexity</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Quantum algorithms take a new approach to solving these complex problems by creating multidimensional spaces in which patterns emerge that link individual data points. Classical computers cannot create these computational spaces, so they cannot find these patterns. And for proteins, there are early quantum algorithms that can find folding patterns in new and more efficient ways without the laborious checking routines of classical computers. As quantum hardware scales and these algorithms advance, they can solve protein folding problems too complex for any supercomputer.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>How does a quantum computer work?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Quantum computers are elegant machines that are smaller and require less energy than supercomputers. The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBM_Quantum_Experience" target="_blank" aria-label="IBM Quantum (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">IBM Quantum</a> processor is a single chip, not much larger than the chip in a laptop. The quantum hardware system is about the size of a car and consists primarily of cooling systems designed to keep superconducting processors at ultra-low operating temperatures.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Classical processors use bits to perform operations. Quantum computers, on the other hand, use quantum bits (CUE bits) to run multidimensional quantum algorithms.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Superfluid</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Your desktop computer may use a fan to cool it to a suitable operating temperature. And our quantum processors require very low temperatures - about a hundredth of a degree above absolute zero. To achieve this, we use ultracold superfluids to create superconductors.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Superconductor</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">At these ultra-low temperatures, some of the materials in our processors exhibit another important quantum mechanical effect: electrons can pass through these materials without resistance. This makes them "superconductors". When electrons pass through a superconductor, they pair up, forming "Cooper pairs." These pairs can carry charge across a potential barrier or insulator through a process called "quantum tunneling." 2 superconductors are placed on either side of an insulator to form a Josephson junction.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Control</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Our quantum computer uses Josephson junctions as superconducting qubits. By firing microwave photons at these qubits, we can control their behavior and have them save, change and read out individual units of quantum information.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Overlay</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Qubits are not very useful by themselves. But it can perform an important trick: put the quantum information it holds into a superposition state, which represents a combination of all possible configurations of qubits. Superimposed groups of qubits can create complex multi-dimensional computational spaces. In these spaces, complex problems can be represented in new ways.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Entanglement</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Entanglement is a quantum mechanical effect that correlates the behavior of two separate things. When two qubits are entangled, changes in one of the qubits directly affect the other. Quantum algorithms exploit these relationships to find solutions to complex problems.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Traditional machine learning]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/traditional-machine-learning/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 29 May 2022 19:45:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=832</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">The research way of traditional machine learning mostly includes research on Bayesian learning, artificial neural networks, random forests, and decision trees.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Decision trees are a common method of machine learning. At the end of the 20th century, machine learning researcher J. Ross Quinlan found Shannon's information theory in the decision tree algorithm and proposed the ID3 algorithm. In 1984, I. Kononenko, I.Bratko, and E.Roskar proposed the AS-SISTANTAlgorithm based on the ID3 algorithm, which allows the intersection of the values ?? of the categories. In the same year, A.Hart proposed the<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chi-squared_test" target="_blank" aria-label=" Chi-Squared statistical algorithm (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link"> Chi-Squared statistical algorithm</a>, which utilizes a statistic based on the degree of association between categories and attributes (Traditional machine learning). In 1984, L.Breiman, C.Ttone, R.Olshen, and J.Freidman proposed the concept of decision tree pruning, which greatly improved the performance of decision trees.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">In 1993, Quinlan proposed an improved algorithm based on the ID3 algorithm, namely the C4.5 algorithm. The C4.5 algorithm controls the problem of attribute bias of the ID3 algorithm and improves the processing of ongoing attributes. Through pruning, the phenomenon of "overfitting" is avoided to a certain extent. However, when the algorithm discretizes a continuous attribute, it needs to traverse all the values ?? of the attribute, which reduces the efficiency and requires the training sample set to reside in memory, which is not suitable for processing large-scale data sets.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">In 2010, Xie submit a CART algorithm, which is a flexible procedure to express the conditional distribution variable Y of a given prediction vector X and has been put in many areas. The CART algorithm can deal with disordered data and uses the Gini coefficient as the selection criterion for the test attributes. The decision tree generated by the CART algorithm has high accuracy, but when the complexity of the decision tree generated by the CART algorithm exceeds a certain level, the classification accuracy will decrease with the increase of the complexity of Traditional machine learning, so the decision tree established by the algorithm should not be too complicated.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">In 2007, Fang Xiangfei described an algorithm called SLIQ (decision tree classification). The classification accuracy of this algorithm is comparable to other decision tree algorithms, but its execution speed is faster than other decision tree algorithms. There is no limit to the number of samples and the number of attributes.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>SLIQ Algorithm</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">The SLIQ algorithm can handle large-scale training sample sets, has good scalability, fast execution speed, and can generate smaller binary decision trees. The SLIQ algorithm enables parallelism by allowing multiple processors to process attribute tables simultaneously. anyway, the SLIQ algorithm is still unable to get rid of the limitation of main memory space.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">In 2000, RajeevRaSto and others proposed the PUBLIC algorithm, which prunes the decision tree that has not been fully generated, thus improving the efficiency. Fuzzy decision trees have also flourished in recent years. Considering the correlation between attributes, the researchers proposed a hierarchical regression algorithm, a constrained hierarchical induction algorithm, and a functional tree algorithm.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">These three algorithms are all decision tree algorithms based on the combination of multiple classifiers. Some experiments and studies have been carried out on the property, but these studies have not generally explained how the correlation between attributes affects the performance of decision trees. In addition, there are many other algorithms, such as an optimization algorithm based on rough sets proposed by Zhang.J in 2014, and an algorithm model based on extreme learning trees proposed by Wang.R in 2015.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Random Forest (RF)</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">As one of the important algorithms in machine learning, random forest (RF) is a method that utilizes multiple tree classifiers for classification and prediction. In these years, the development of the random forest algorithm research has been very fast, and applied research has been carried out in many fields such as genetics, medicine, ecology, bioinformatics, and remote sensing geography.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Artificial Neural Networks (ANN)</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><a aria-label="Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) (opens in a new tab)" href="https://techodu.com/artificial-neural-network/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">Artificial Neural Networks (ANN)</a> is an algorithm with nonlinear adaptive information processing ability, which can overcome the shortcomings of traditional artificial intelligence methods for intuition, such as pattern, speech recognition, and unstructured information processing. Artificial neural networks have received attention as early as the 1940s and have developed rapidly since then.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>Bayesian Learning</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Bayesian learning is an earlier research direction of machine learning, and its method originated from the British mathematician Thomas, a special case of Bayes' theorem proved by Bayes in 1763. Through the joint efforts of many statisticians, Bayesian statistics was gradually established after the 1950s and became an important part of statistics.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[What is Omnichannel Marketing? (Practical Example)]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/omnichannel-marketing/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 May 2022 19:39:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=838</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Omnichannel marketing is a fully integrated approach that delivers a unified, personalized experience to customers across multiple touchpoints. This may include brick-and-mortar stores, Instagram, Facebook, email, text messages, and any other marketing or sales channels.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">But create no mistake, personalized omnichannel marketing is not like multichannel marketing. Instead, it’s highly personalized, consistent, and regularly updated marketing, based on the needs of the shopper, not the needs of the channel. It is customer-centric, providing them with a seamless experience across all sales channels they use, with the right information at the right time.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Deniz Ibrahim</strong>, vice president of product marketing at Bluecore, an <strong><a href="https://techodu.com/what-is-artificial-intelligence/" target="_blank" aria-label="artificial intelligence  (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">artificial intelligence </a></strong>(AI)-powered retail marketing platform, said: "Having a personalized omnichannel marketing strategy ensures that you are communicating with consumers anytime, anywhere, at the point where they are most likely to buy. At the exact moment, with curated content, offers, and recommendations based on their preferences.”</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3><strong>"This strategy keeps brands in sync with shoppers at every stage of the buying process."</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Unlike segmented marketing, which involves advertising directly to customers based on others who are similar to them, personalized omnichannel marketing provides customers with communications and experiences designed specifically for them. Essentially, omnichannel marketing is a completely unique shopping journey tailored to a specific customer.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>The advantage of Using a Personalized Omnichannel Marketing Strategy</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Omnichannel marketing has been proven to drive sales, increase revenue, and increase engagement. Today's retailers have the best marketing tools ever. The rise of omnichannel marketing helps e-commerce merchants and retailers reach consumers anytime, anywhere.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">The result is increased engagement (some studies have shown that omnichannel campaigns have nearly 19% engagement compared to 5.4% for single-channel campaigns) and sales.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">For example, a 2017 study by Harvard Business Review found that omnichannel shoppers spent 4% more in brick-and-mortar stores and 10% more online. The more channels consumers use, the higher the sales. Research shows that consumers who use more than 4 channels spend, on average, 9% more than those who use only 1 channel.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Omni-channel marketing meets the real needs of customers</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Why is personalized omnichannel marketing so effective?</strong> This is because consumers want personalization. Gavin Flood, senior director of marketing platform AdRoll, said: "Customers are eager to engage. We increasingly want and expect the brands we support to know about us." “People do not think back to brands that do not appeal to them. With an omnichannel strategy, you are where [the customer] is, resulting in increased engagement and a good reputation for your brand.”</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">According to Epsilon's survey of 18- to 64-year-old online shoppers, 80% said they were more likely to do business with a company if it offered a personalized experience, while 90% said they felt personalized Very attractive. People are looking for products and services to improve their own lives, not the lives of people like them. That's why receiving segment-based ads sometimes misses targets. (Don't believe us? Ask any single woman in her 30s to 40s if she likes seeing ads targeted at dating apps based solely on her marital status, age, and gender, and you're likely to get some pretty divisive answers! )</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Google’s 2019 global retail study of more than 14,000 global shoppers also confirms that people are looking for personalized ideas: 49% of respondents said they would like brands to send them promotions or campaigns specific to their shopping history.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Yes, while shoppers may be wary of companies collecting data on their preferences and habits, they also appreciate the time it saves them. Google research found that 32% of shoppers want retailers to remember historical sizes and items they've purchased, while 33% are keen to get recommendations based on their purchase history. Omnichannel marketing enables you to create consistent messaging across channels while increasing brand awareness and loyalty "<em>Omnichannel marketing can help e-commerce merchants build loyalty</em>," says Flood, noting that retaining customers is five times less expensive than acquiring new ones.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Ibrahim agrees. He points out that this is one of the biggest advantages of omnichannel marketing, and says that it usually takes just two days to convert shoppers through a well-curated website experience. But he said the real value was the second purchase in this case. According to Ibrahim, second-time buyers are worth 130 percent more than first-time buyers.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">"It shows a big opportunity for brands to improve the likelihood that shoppers will continue to buy," he said. “Along with an omnichannel personalization strategy, brands can leverage shopper preferences and predictions to get shoppers to make 2nd, 3rd, and 4th put money on any channel they prefer. Converting shopper offers discounts because that’s the channel she engages with the most, or texts recommendations based on how much different shopper likes certain styles because it’s his preferred channel.”</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>How to Develop an Omnichannel Marketing Strategy</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Leverage customer data to personalize in-store and online experiences. Big beauty store Sephora has a long history of building up by offering incentives for every purchase online or in-store, as well as gifts for members on their birthdays (you'll see many Sephora shoppers heading to the store to pick up gifts on their birthdays). customer loyalty.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Take Sephora's beauty studios, in-store makeovers, and product testing. Its online membership program replicates the personalized customer service you get as a regular customer, which gives the brand a huge return on investment, as its 10 million members spend on its website often from those who don’t nurture relationships 15 times. Sephora is also a pioneer in digital gift cards, with Bridget Dolan, vice president of innovation labs saying in 2015: "51% of our digital gift cards are redeemed within a month, compared to our plastic gift cards that are only 33% is redeemed.”</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Build a marketing team that embodies the power of omnichannel personalization</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">According to Ibrahim, one of the biggest mistakes e-commerce merchants make is organizing their marketing teams or budgets around channels rather than audiences. This can lead to a disconnect in customer experience and competing channel performance goals, he said.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">"mostly, the brand group is looking at the stores, and e-commerce has been more of an assist function," he said. “The big shift to digital acquire a new step of a partnership between brand leaders and e-commerce, and for a few firms, this has even specified rise to new roles such as 'Chief Customer Officers'. These people will be data-driven leadership, which will inform store and e-commerce strategy, and work better with brand leaders on marketing and creative.”</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Confirm your messaging is continuous across platforms</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">One of the benefits of omnichannel marketing is that it ensures that your marketing is not disconnected across different platforms, which can also benefit your store in the long run. Flood points to a study by Yes Lifecycle Marketing that found that two-thirds of brands find it challenging to coordinate campaigns across different channels due to limited time and resources, and the proliferation of new channels has only compounded the problem.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">"By shifting the focus from the channel to the customer experience, knowing the buyer personas, and segmenting buyers, you will know to deliver the right message to the right user through the right channel," Flood said.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Connect with customers in the in-store shopping experience</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">A more advanced tool for omnichannel marketing is mobile location data combined with first- and third-party audience data. With technology, specific consumers can be locked in at a “moment of truth,” as if they had just stepped into your brick-and-mortar store.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">But be cautious and strategic when using geofencing marketing or mobile GPS. You need to make sure the shopper has agreed so they pass the whole awkward phase of the experience and jump right to the part where they are happy with the discounts on the baby blankets stacked high on the display case in front of them. Typically, you can get consent when providing store WiFi or when a user downloads an app. Then, in the mind of the customer, it makes sense for you to offer an offer or suggestion because they are active participants.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Reach customers through social media and text messages</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">You have to reach customers where they are, which is on social media. According to Gladly's 2019 Customer Expectations Report, live chat and social messaging with retailers have grown substantially since 2017, up 14% and 6%, respectively, while email has dropped 18%. Customers want real-time responses. The Harvard study mentioned above found that “careful pre-searching leads customers to buy more in-store.” Nordstrom’s social media integration has been praised for the simplicity of the way they link shoppers to Instagram or Pinterest The posted photo leads to a product page on Nordstrom's website, which then lets them know if the product is available at a store near them.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Text messaging is increasingly proving to be a powerful component of an omnichannel marketing strategy. There's a common misconception that SMS marketing can eat into your email marketing channel performance, says Allison Kelly, Director of Attending Partnerships, who specializes in SMS personalization campaigns.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>"The 2 marketing channels shouldn't be viewed as either one or the other," she said.</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>“Both channels have their own aspect and naturally complement each other. While email is more suitable for long-form content that is not time-sensitive, the fact that text messages are often opened faster than email makes it an excellent choice for concise messages designed to drive immediate action. Ideal."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Make sure: Omnichannel marketing is about personalization, not segmentation</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">"There is still more confusion between personalization and segmentation," says Ibrahim. “Segmentation is typically a list-based informed, approach by demographics and previous behavior, that can provide a perspective on what has worked in the past but can't know the future. Personalization acquire to be based on content, product or recommendation, and prioritization of communication and timing to create a new experience for individual customers.”</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Choosing the Right Technology Stack for Omnichannel Marketing</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Data collection, including traffic, on-site interactions, personal data, purchases, and searches, is critical to driving e-commerce personalization. This goes for identifying your success with the proper metrics.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">"While marketers measure the overall effectiveness of campaigns, they don't measure KPIs at each stage of the buyer's journey, which prevents them from gaining meaningful insights," Flood said.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">But figuring out what data to use and how to track it only gets more complicated. The experts we interviewed for this article predict that in the future, we will see accelerated growth in video marketing content, as well as more digital and cashless payment options. As Chrome is phasing out third-party cookies, first-party data collection will become increasingly important to merchants.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">"<em>Many brands trust that centralizing all customer data is the key point to personalizing digital communications, but that does not solve the data accessibility and activation issues, that is the real bottleneck to personalization at the speed of the shopper,</em>" said Ibrahim. "Without centralization and activation in one point, systems can not talk to each other, and opportunities at various touchpoints are missed."Given the complex metrics involved, it's no surprise to know that AI solutions, like those offered by Bluecore, are leading the way in doing some of the heavy liftings and helping to scale automation.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>For example,</strong> some brands, including Shopify Plus merchant Pura Vida bracelet, are now seeing up to 60% digital revenue growth through AI-driven personalization powered by Bluecore, combining Shopify catalog data with shopper data. Event production time has also been reduced by 85% thanks to the ability to create and execute personalized campaigns in minutes.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Omnichannel Marketing Example</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Focused on consistent messaging, omnichannel personalization offers merchants the opportunity to build and reinforce their brand identity and value. One such example is Shopify Plus merchant Lounge Underwear, a UK-based home apparel merchant.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Kiran Bains, head of paid media at Lounge Underwear, wrote: “A year ago, we were just starting to gain a foothold in the US market. As a young UK startup, especially as an e-commerce brand, it was difficult to break into the US market. To be successful, we need message coherence across every element of our marketing campaign."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><em>"From the time someone discovers us on social, to when they sign up for an email and receive a targeted ad, we have to determine: How do we keep talking to a customer throughout their journey?"</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Lounge Underwear found the answer by using the services of the marketing platform AdRoll. With the help of AdRoll, Lounge Underwear's 2.3 million Instagram followers and 230,000 Facebook followers can now see high-quality photos and click through to the brand's store. There, they get resources on style and fit, as well as purchase incentives and the opportunity to opt-in to the company's email list.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">They then target through social channels, website pages, and devices. This is a key element in creating a connected experience and a focus on strengthening the value of the Lounge brand. Contacts established through email collection can also be combined with data from AdRoll to identify lookalike audiences to expand future customer bases and drive brand engagement.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>What is the result?</strong> Income has grown exponentially. Lounge Underwear increased revenue on social platforms by 388% while successfully reducing new user acquisition costs by 78%.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Big Blanket Co</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Shopify Plus merchant Big Blanket Co, which sells "the biggest and best blankets in the world," wants to use a mobile-first marketing strategy to deliver customer service at every touchpoint. Providing a personalized and timely response is also important to the brand.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">The brand support Attentive to launch it as a piece of an omnichannel marketing campaign. In addition to rollout triggers to send SMS to subscribers In addition to campaigns to personalize the experience, Big Blanket Co. uses historical customer purchase data stored in Shopify to create additional SMS segments, such as abandoned purchases, and subscribers who visited a website or purchased a specific product or category.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">What is the result? Text messages sent through Attention accounted for 18% of Big Blanket Co's total revenue in just four months of launching its SMS marketing program. Want more examples of omnichannel marketing? Read our article on 10 omnichannel branding examples and what you can learn from them.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Closing Words on Omnichannel Personalization Strategies</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Key Information? The customer is at the cornerstone of omnichannel marketing." A true omnichannel marketing and personalization strategy requires transforming processes, technology, and people to put the customer at the center," says Ibrahim. “This means putting customer data and audiences at the centre of your marketing strategy, giving importance to the technologies optimized for the fast and flexible activation and execution of data including multiple channels, and executing in a way that access leaders and groups to run on technology and channels Responsible approach group Flood agrees. "</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Omnichannel marketing and personalization strategies put the customer at the cornerstone of everything you do. It's a journey, not a destination, as customer tastes, preferences and priorities change all the time. "He said. "Take every opportunity to communicate with customers. The lines between online and offline are blurring, so consistently connecting with consumers through key channels is key to staying on track. "</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Classification of Machine Learning]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/classification-of-machine-learning/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 31 May 2022 18:06:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=848</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Classification of Machine Learning:</strong> Over the decades, research has published a wide variety of machine learning methods, which can be classified in various ways depending on the emphasis.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Classification based on learning strategies</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>1. Machine learning that simulates the human brain</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Symbolic learning</strong>: Simulating the macroscopic psychological level learning process of the human brain, based on the principles of cognitive psychology, using symbolic data as input, using symbolic operation as a method, and using reasoning process to search in a graph or state space, the learning goal is concepts or rules, etc. The typical methods of symbolic learning include memory learning, example learning, deductive learning, analogical learning, interpretation learning, and so on.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Neural network learning (or connection learning):</strong> Simulates the micro-physiological learning process of the human brain, is based on the principles of brain and neuroscience, uses an <a href="https://techodu.com/artificial-neural-network/" target="_blank" aria-label="artificial neural network (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link"><strong>artificial neural network</strong></a> as a functional structural model, uses numerical data as input, and uses numerical operation as a method. The iterative process searches in the coefficient vector space, and the learning objective is a function. Typical connection learning includes weighted value correction learning and topology learning.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>2. Machine Learning Directly Using Mathematical Methods</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Mainly statistical machine learning.</strong><br>Statistical machine learning is based on the preliminary understanding of the data and the analysis of the learning purpose, selecting the appropriate mathematical model, formulation hyperparameters, and input sample data, according to a certain strategy, using the appropriate learning algorithm to train the model, and finally use the trained model. model to examine and predict the data.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":4} -->
<h4><strong>There are three elements of statistical machine learning:</strong></h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Model:</strong> Before the model is educated, its possible parameters are many or even infinite, so the achievable models are also multiple or even infinite. The team of this model is the hypothesis space.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Strategy: </strong>The criterion for selecting the model with the best parameters from the hypothesis space. The little the error (loss function) between the prediction or classification of the model and the actual circumstances, the better the model. Then the procedure is to reduce the error.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Algorithm: </strong>The method of picking a model from the hypothesis space (equivalent to finding the best model parameters). The parameter solution of machine learning is usually transformed into an optimization problem, so the learning algorithm is usually an optimization algorithm, such as the fastest gradient descent method, Newton method, and <strong><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quasi-Newton_method" target="_blank" aria-label="quasi-Newton method (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">quasi-Newton method</a></strong>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Classification based on learning methods</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>1. Inductive learning</strong><br><strong>Symbolic induction learning:</strong> Typical symbolic induction learning includes decision tree learning and example learning.<br><strong>Function induction learning (discovery learning):</strong> Typical function induction learning includes neural network learning, example learning, discovery learning, and statistical learning.   The learner's brain transforms external knowledge into an internal ability so that when encountering problems, he can handle it in different ways. This process is considered to be inductive and interpretation of the repeated role in cognitive research. The interpretation method and the previous experience reflection method have a relationship.                                           </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> <strong>2. Deductive learning</strong>: Learning inductive interpretation method<br><strong>3. Analogy learning:</strong> Typical analogy learning includes case (example) learning.<br><strong>4. Analysis learning: </strong>Typical analysis learning includes interpretive learning and macro operation learning.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Classification based on learning style</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>1. Supervised learning (learning with a tutor):</strong> There is a tutor signal in the input data, and the probability function, algebraic function, or<a aria-label=" artificial neural network (opens in a new tab)" href="https://techodu.com/artificial-neural-network/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link"> <strong>artificial neural network</strong></a> is used as the basis function model, and the iterative calculation method is used, and the learning result is a function.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>2. Unsupervised learning (unsupervised learning):</strong> There is no mentor signal in the input data, the clustering method is used, and the learning result is a category. Typical unsupervised learning includes discovery learning, clustering, and competitive learning. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>3. Reinforcement learning (reinforcement learning): </strong>A learning method guided by statistics and dynamic programming techniques with environmental feedback (reward/penalty signals) as input.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Classification based on data from</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>1. Structured learning: </strong>It takes structured data as input and uses numerical calculation or symbolic deduction as the method. Typically structured learning includes neural network learning, statistical learning, decision tree learning, and rule learning.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>2 Unstructured learning: </strong>Taking unstructured data as input, typical unstructured learning includes analogical learning case learning, explanation learning, text mining, image mining, Web mining, etc.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Classification based on learning objectives</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>1. Concept learning: </strong>The goal and result of learning are concepts, or learning to acquire concepts. Typical concept learning mainly contains example learning.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>2. Rule learning:</strong> The goal and result of learning are rules, or learning to obtain rules. Normally rule learning mostly includes decision tree learning.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>3. Function learning:</strong> The goal and result of learning are functions, or learning to obtain functions. Typical function learning mainly includes neural network learning.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>4. Category learning: </strong>The goal and result of learning object categories, or learning to obtain categories. The typical category of learning mainly includes cluster analysis.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>5 Bayesian network learning: </strong>The goal and result of learning is a Bayesian network or a kind of learning to obtain a Bayesian network. It can be further divided into structural learning and majority learning.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Network Architectures (Families, Recurrent, Autoencoder, Generative)]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/network-architectures/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 01 Jun 2022 20:20:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=855</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Notable <strong>network architectures</strong> include the following "families": Network structure refers to the structure of a computer network. A computer network is composed of computer systems, communication links, and network nodes. It is a field in which computer technology and communication technology are closely combined and undertake two types of work: data communication and data processing. From the perspective of logical functions, the network can be divided into resource subnets and communication subnets. The resource subnet provides the ability to access the network and process data, and it consists of the main computer system, terminal controllers, and terminals. The communication subnet provides network communication functions, and it consists of network nodes, communication links, and signal conversion equipment. The structure of the communication subnet in the network directly affects the network structure. Communication subnets can be divided into point-to-point communication channels and broadcast communication channels according to the technology used to transmit data. Commonly used structures in LAN are the star, ring, bus, and tree.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Typical CNN architecture</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>The long short-term memory unit</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify">Convolution Network - These networks are suitable for learning information that is invariant (n) in time or space and are suitable for image processing.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Recurrent neural network</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Recurrent neural network</strong> - These <a aria-label="networks (opens in a new tab)" href="https://techodu.com/explain-network-concept-classification-characteristics-history/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link"><strong>networks</strong></a> are designed to "decipher" serial information - that is, to take into account the "order of appearance" of the phenomenon being treated. These networks include an element of memory - so that the network "knows how to" consider history. These networks are especially suitable for reading a script - when it is very important to arrange the appearance of the letters, to turn "audio" into text, and the like (<strong>network architectures</strong>). A specific genre of these networks is<strong><a aria-label=" Bidirectional recurrent neural networks (opens in a new tab)" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bidirectional_recurrent_neural_networks" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link"> Bidirectional recurrent neural networks</a></strong>. Because the network receives a decoding segment that is of a given length - it can also take into account the "normal" order of appearance, that is, take into account the past regarding "what is expected" to be the next letter and at the same time, it can "look" at the data in the opposite direction (e.g. From the complete of the word to its start). In addition, these networks make it possible to take into account times (or proximity relations) of varying length, that is, for example, in the context of writing a script, to take into account both the letter closest to the letter you are trying to decipher and letters or parts of words farther away.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Autoencoder</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Autoencoder</strong> - These networks are built in such an architecture that the size of the hidden layers decreases and then, it grows back, usually, to the original size, that is, a network in the architecture that includes a "bottleneck". In this situation, the part of the network from the data entry layer to the bottleneck is an "encoder" of the information while the layer from the bottleneck to the data output layer is a "decoder". Such networks have many uses, for example, the network can be trained on many Van Gogh images, which will make the "encoder" "understand" what is drawn in the image while the "decoder" will learn how to take encoded information that expresses. "what is drawn in the image" and turn it For a painting "in the style of Van Gogh". Such a network, once fostered, can receive a painting or other photograph, "understand" what is in the painting, and then "reopen" the encoded information (<strong>network architectures</strong>). so that at the end of the process the original painting/photograph is obtained - but in the style of "Van Gogh". This method makes it possible to convert day photographs into images that seem to have been taken at night and the like.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Generative adversarial network</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"justify"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-justify"><strong>Generative adversarial network</strong> - Networks that include two separate architectures. One network is a "generator". This network knows how to produce its own entity that we are interested in - say, for example, a picture of a flower. A second network is a "judge" and it tries to compare the products of the "generator" with real images of flowers. If the judge manages to understand which image is created by the generator and which image is "real" - improve the "generator" if the judge fails to distinguish between the real images and the images the generator produces - improve the "judge" and so on. Such networks can "produce for themselves" diverse entities, remarkably similar to reality itself. As of 2019, capabilities have already been demonstrated to produce portraits of non-existent people, birds, flowers, sounds, and so on. This architecture was first developed and published by <strong><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ian_Goodfellow" target="_blank" aria-label="Ian Goodfellow, in 2014 (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">Ian Goodfellow, in 2014</a></strong>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Qbit global account, what is a Qbit global account? Easily manage your global funds without leaving your home!]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/qbit-global-account/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Jun 2022 20:55:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=869</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For most people who are just starting to do overseas e-commerce, opening a foreign account seems to mean waiting quietly.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>After the account is successfully activated, the business process is gradually promoted. How to save costs in account collection and payment service fees and monthly fees, and how to ensure the efficient and stable operation of assets will replace the complicated procedures and raw materials when applying for registered accounts, and become a new difficulty that will make you sleepless.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If something goes wrong with your account during this time, you may go through one more gradual step, and it will be a less happy experience in the end. Thus, the "global account" came out.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>(Image source: Qbit)</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>What is a global account?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Global Account provides a one-stop global fund distribution service project for small and medium-sized overseas companies. It is suitable for pure online opening of foreign accounts, rapid cross-border e-commerce collection, payment, etc., to reduce asset operation costs and boost the company's international business. It allows you to easily manage your global assets without leaving your home.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>What can a global account do?<br>▼ Online Banking Account Opening</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Pure online banking account opening, suitable for companies in mainland China, Hong Kong, the United Kingdom, and other companies to apply for registration, can give the company's real foreign account with the same name, and it can be activated in China and Japan faster.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Efficient collection and payment</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Applicable to multi-currency cross-border e-commerce and local receipts and payments, applicable to related popular e-commerce platforms for receipts and payments, and to issue RMB foreign exchange purchases under compliance management.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Expense management</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Seamlessly connect the "Quantum Technology" virtual credit card, provide a customized cost management intelligent system solution for the company, and meet the global collection and payment requirements in one stop.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Why choose Qbit Global Account?</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>High efficiency and convenience</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● Pure online banking account opening, no need to go through complicated offline promotion steps</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● Local payment Internet, one-stop fast payment</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● Applicable to global popular currencies</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Cost-saving</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● Limited to 0 yuan bank account opening</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● Limited 0 monthly fee</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● Limited time 0 payment interest rate</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● Local payment rate saves 90% compared to traditional financial institutions</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● No minimum savings requirement</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>The interest rate is fully transparent</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● It is applicable to convert European and US dollars into popular currencies in the world;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>● Real-time exchange rate, all costs and fees are transparent;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>How do I get a global account?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Just three steps to get your Qbit global account</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>(Image source: Qbit)</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you want to know more about the operation secrets of well-known brands going overseas, add Qbit overseas running stations, and go from 0 to 1 with a large number of like-minded friends, and immediately run independent stations with well-known brands going overseas.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>What is a Qbit overseas operation station?<br>The Qbit Overseas Launch Station is an overseas communication and exchange community marketing conducted by Qbit towards the 0-1 link of the independent station of well-known brands overseas. Here you can meet overseas partners who run from 0.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>➣ Exchange experience with like-minded overseas partners and grasp the current dynamics</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>➣ Get exclusive agent travel tips shared by big names in the field</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>➣ Enjoy the one-stop consulting service project of DTC's well-known brand overseas independent station, covering key stages such as registration of foreign actors, account opening of foreign financial institutions, the connection of special tools for acquiring business, independent station operation, and marketing strategy.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>How to add a Qbit overseas operation station?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>First step:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The QR code below the scanner, plus Little Mars mobile WeChat: Qbit0830.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Second step:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Push your personal business card or tell your name, company, and position, so that Little Mars can check your information.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Third step:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>After Little Mars determines the content of the information, it informs the rules of joining the group and invites you to join the group.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
