			<wp:comment_id>181</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Grace B]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email><![CDATA[brown.ca@us-k12.org]]></wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url>https://biblewoke.com</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[92.119.16.35]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2023-01-05 19:20:52]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2023-01-05 14:20:52]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Whether you believe in God or not, this is a must-read message!!!

Throughout time, we can see how we have been slowly conditioned to come to this point where we are on the verge of a cashless society. Did you know that the Bible foretold of this event almost 2,000 years ago?

In Revelation 13:16-18, we read,

"He (the false prophet who decieves many by his miracles) causes all, both small and great, rich and poor, free and slave, to receive a mark on their right hand or on their foreheads, and that no one may buy or sell except one who has the mark or the name of the beast, or the number of his name.

Here is wisdom. Let him who has understanding calculate the number of the beast, for it is the number of a man: His number is 666."

Referring to the last generation, this could only be speaking of a cashless society. Why? Revelation 13:17 tells us that we cannot buy or sell unless we receive the mark of the beast. If physical money was still in use, we could buy or sell with one another without receiving the mark. This would contradict scripture that states we need the mark to buy or sell!

These verses could not be referring to something purely spiritual as scripture references two physical locations (our right hand or forehead) stating the mark will be on one "OR" the other. If this mark was purely spiritual, it would indicate only in one place.

This is where it really starts to come together. It is shocking how accurate the Bible is concerning the implatnable RFID microchip. These are notes from a man named Carl Sanders who worked with a team of engineers to help develop this RFID chip

"Carl Sanders sat in seventeen New World Order meetings with heads-of-state officials such as Henry Kissinger and Bob Gates of the C.I.A. to discuss plans on how to bring about this one-world system. The government commissioned Carl Sanders to design a microchip for identifying and controlling the peoples of the world—a microchip that could be inserted under the skin with a hypodermic needle (a quick, convenient method that would be gradually accepted by society).

Carl Sanders, with a team of engineers behind him, with U.S. grant monies supplied by tax dollars, took on this project and designed a microchip that is powered by a lithium battery, rechargeable through the temperature changes in our skin. Without the knowledge of the Bible (Brother Sanders was not a Christian at the time), these engineers spent one-and-a-half-million dollars doing research on the best and most convenient place to have the microchip inserted.

Guess what? These researchers found that the forehead and the back of the hand (the two places the Bible says the mark will go) are not just the most convenient places, but are also the only viable places for rapid, consistent temperature changes in the skin to recharge the lithium battery. The microchip is approximately seven millimeters in length, .75 millimeters in diameter, about the size of a grain of rice. It is capable of storing pages upon pages of information about you. All your general history, work history, crime record, health history, and financial data can be stored on this chip.

Brother Sanders believes that this microchip, which he regretfully helped design, is the “mark” spoken about in Revelation 13:16–18. The original Greek word for “mark” is “charagma,” which means a “scratch or etching.” It is also interesting to note that the number 666 is actually a word in the original Greek. The word is “chi xi stigma,” with the last part, “stigma,” also meaning “to stick or prick.” Carl believes this is referring to a hypodermic needle when they poke into the skin to inject the microchip."

Mr. Sanders asked a doctor what would happen if the lithium contained within the RFID microchip leaked into the body. The doctor replied by saying a terrible sore would appear in that location. This is what the book of Revelation says:

"And the first (angel) went, and poured out his vial on the earth; and there fell a noisome and grievous sore on the men which had the mark of the beast, and on them which worshipped his image" (Revelation 16:2).

You can read more about it here--and to also understand the mystery behind the number 666: https://2ruth.org/rfid-mark-of-the-beast-666-revealed/

The third angel's warning in Revelation 14:9-11 states,

"Then a third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, 'If anyone worships the beast and his image, and receives his mark on his forehead or on his hand, he himself shall also drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out full strength into the cup of His indignation. He shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels and in the presence of the Lamb. And the smoke of their torment ascends forever and ever; and they have no rest day or night, who worship the beast and his image, and whoever receives the mark of his name.'"

Who is Barack Obama, and why is he still in the public scene?

So what's in the name? The meaning of someone's name can say a lot about a person. God throughout history has given names to people that have a specific meaning tied to their lives. How about the name Barack Obama? Let us take a look at what may be hiding beneath the surface.

Jesus says in Luke 10:18, "...I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven."

The Hebrew Strongs word (H1299) for "lightning": "bârâq" (baw-rawk)

In Isaiah chapter 14, verse 14, we read about Lucifer (Satan) saying in his heart:

"I will ascend above the heights of the clouds, I will be like the Most High."

In the verses in Isaiah that refer directly to Lucifer, several times it mentions him falling from the heights or the heavens. The Hebrew word for the heights or heavens used here is Hebrew Strongs 1116: "bamah"--Pronounced (bam-maw')

In Hebrew, the letter "Waw" or "Vav" is often transliterated as a "U" or "O," and it is primarily used as a conjunction to join concepts together. So to join in Hebrew poetry the concept of lightning (Baraq) and a high place like heaven or the heights of heaven (Bam-Maw), the letter "U" or "O" would be used. So, Baraq "O" Bam-Maw or Baraq "U" Bam-Maw in Hebrew poetry similar to the style written in Isaiah, would translate literally to "Lightning from the heights." The word "Satan" in Hebrew is a direct translation, therefore "Satan."

So when Jesus told His disciples in Luke 10:18 that He beheld Satan fall like lightning from heaven, if this were to be spoken by a Jewish Rabbi today influenced by the poetry in the book of Isaiah, he would say these words in Hebrew--the words of Jesus in Luke 10:18 as, And I saw Satan as Baraq O Bam-Maw.

The names of both of Obama's daughters are Malia and Natasha. If we were to write those names backward (the devil does things in reverse) we would get "ailam ahsatan". Now if we remove the letters that spell "Alah" (Allah being the false god of Islam), we get "I am Satan". Coincidence? I don't think so.

Obama's campaign logo when he ran in 2008 was a sun over the horizon in the west, with the landscape as the flag of the United States. In Islam, they have their own messiah that they are waiting for called the 12th Imam, or the Mahdi (the Antichrist of the Bible), and one prophecy concerning this man's appearance is the sun rising in the west.

"Then I saw another angel flying in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach to those who dwell on the earth—to every nation, tribe, tongue, and people— saying with a loud voice, 'Fear God and give glory to Him, for the hour of His judgment has come; and worship Him who made heaven and earth, the sea and springs of water.'" (Revelation 14:6-7)

Why have the word's of Jesus in His Gospel accounts regarding His death, burial, and resurrection, been translated into over 3,000 languages, and nothing comes close? The same God who formed the heavens and earth that draws all people to Him through His creation, likewise has sent His Word to the ends of the earth so that we may come to personally know Him to be saved in spirit and in truth through His Son Jesus Christ.

Jesus stands alone among the other religions that say to rightly weigh the scales of good and evil and to make sure you have done more good than bad in this life. Is this how we conduct ourselves justly in a court of law? Bearing the image of God, is this how we project this image into reality?

Our good works cannot save us. If we step before a judge, being guilty of a crime, the judge will not judge us by the good that we have done, but rather by the crimes we have committed. If we as fallen humanity, created in God's image, pose this type of justice, how much more a perfect, righteous, and Holy God?

God has brought down His moral laws through the 10 commandments given to Moses at Mt. Siani. These laws were not given so we may be justified, but rather that we may see the need for a savior. They are the mirror of God's character of what He has put in each and every one of us, with our conscious bearing witness that we know that it is wrong to steal, lie, dishonor our parents, murder, and so forth.

We can try and follow the moral laws of the 10 commandments, but we will never catch up to them to be justified before a Holy God. That same word of the law given to Moses became flesh about 2,000 years ago in the body of Jesus Christ. He came to be our justification by fulfilling the law, living a sinless perfect life that only God could fulfill.

The gap between us and the law can never be reconciled by our own merit, but the arm of Jesus is stretched out by the grace and mercy of God. And if we are to grab on, through faith in Him, He will pull us up being the one to justify us. As in the court of law, if someone steps in and pays our fine, even though we are guilty, the judge can do what is legal and just and let us go free. That is what Jesus did almost 2,000 years ago on the cross. It was a legal transaction being fulfilled in the spiritual realm by the shedding of His blood.

For God takes no pleasure in the death of the wicked (Ezekiel 18:23). This is why in Isaiah chapter 53, where it speaks of the coming Messiah and His soul being a sacrifice for our sins, why it says it pleased God to crush His only begotten Son.

This is because the wrath that we deserve was justified by being poured out upon His Son. If that wrath was poured out on us, we would all perish to hell forever. God created a way of escape by pouring it out on His Son whose soul could not be left in Hades but was raised and seated at the right hand of God in power.

So now when we put on the Lord Jesus Christ (Romans 13:14), God no longer sees the person who deserves His wrath, but rather the glorious image of His perfect Son dwelling in us, justifying us as if we received the wrath we deserve, making a way of escape from the curse of death--now being conformed into the image of the heavenly man in a new nature, and no longer in the image of the fallen man Adam.

Now what we must do is repent and put our trust and faith in the savior, confessing and forsaking our sins, and to receive His Holy Spirit that we may be born again (for Jesus says we must be born again to enter the Kingdom of God--John chapter 3). This is not just head knowledge of believing in Jesus, but rather receiving His words, taking them to heart, so that we may truly be transformed into the image of God. Where we no longer live to practice sin, but rather turn from our sins and practice righteousness through faith in Him in obedience to His Word by reading the Bible.

Our works cannot save us, but they can condemn us; it is not that we earn our way into everlasting life, but that we obey our Lord Jesus Christ:

"And having been perfected, He became the author of eternal salvation to all who obey Him." (Hebrews 5:9)

"Now I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away. Also there was no more sea. Then I, John, saw the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband. And I heard a loud voice from heaven saying, 'Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them, and they shall be His people. God Himself will be with them and be their God. And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes; there shall be no more death, nor sorrow, nor crying. There shall be no more pain, for the former things have passed away.'

Then He who sat on the throne said, 'Behold, I make all things new.' And He said to me, 'Write, for these words are true and faithful.'

And He said to me, 'It is done! I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End. I will give of the fountain of the water of life freely to him who thirsts. He who overcomes shall inherit all things, and I will be his God and he shall be My son. But the cowardly, unbelieving, abominable, murderers, sexually immoral, sorcerers, idolaters, and all liars shall have their part in the lake which burns with fire and brimstone, which is the second death.'" (Revelation 21:1-8).]]></wp:comment_content>

			<wp:comment_id>211</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Mindy B]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email><![CDATA[brown.ca@k12-online.us]]></wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url>https://biblewoke.com</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[37.19.200.109]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2023-02-04 01:05:28]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2023-02-03 20:05:28]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Whether or not you believe in God, this is a "must-read" message!

All throughout time, we can see how we have been slowly conditioned to come to this point where we are on the verge of a cashless society. Did you know that the Bible foretold of this event almost 2,000 years ago?

In Revelation 13:16-18, we read,

"He (the false prophet who deceives many by his miracles--Revelation 19:20) causes all, both small and great, rich and poor, free and slave, to receive a mark on their right hand or on their foreheads, and that no one may buy or sell except one who has the mark or the name of the beast, or the number of his name.

Here is wisdom. Let him who has understanding calculate the number of the beast, for it is the number of a man: His number is 666."

Speaking to the last generation, this could only be speaking of a cashless society. Why? Revelation 13:17 tells us that we cannot buy or sell unless we receive the mark of the beast. If physical money was still in use, we could buy or sell with one another without receiving the mark. This would contradict scripture that states we need the mark to buy or sell!

These verses could not be referring to something purely spiritual as scripture references two physical locations (our right hand or forehead) stating the mark will be on one "OR" the other. If this mark was purely spiritual, it would indicate both places, not one OR the other.

This is where it comes together. It is shocking how accurate the Bible is concerning the implantable RFID microchip. These are notes from a man named Carl Sanders who worked with a team of engineers to help develop this RFID chip

"Carl Sanders sat in seventeen New World Order meetings with heads-of-state officials such as Henry Kissinger and Bob Gates of the C.I.A. to discuss plans on how to bring about this one-world system. The government commissioned Carl Sanders to design a microchip for identifying and controlling the peoples of the world—a microchip that could be inserted under the skin with a hypodermic needle (a quick, convenient method that would be gradually accepted by society).

Carl Sanders, with a team of engineers behind him, with U.S. grant monies supplied by tax dollars, took on this project and designed a microchip that is powered by a lithium battery, rechargeable through the temperature changes in our skin. Without the knowledge of the Bible (Brother Sanders was not a Christian at the time), these engineers spent one-and-a-half-million dollars doing research on the best and most convenient place to have the microchip inserted.

Guess what? These researchers found that the forehead and the back of the hand (the two places the Bible says the mark will go) are not just the most convenient places, but are also the only viable places for rapid, consistent temperature changes in the skin to recharge the lithium battery. The microchip is approximately seven millimeters in length, .75 millimeters in diameter, about the size of a grain of rice. It is capable of storing pages upon pages of information about you. All your general history, work history, criminal record, health history, and financial data can be stored on this chip.

Brother Sanders believes that this microchip, which he regretfully helped design, is the “mark” spoken about in Revelation 13:16–18. The original Greek word for “mark” is “charagma,” which means a “scratch or etching.” It is also interesting to note that the number 666 is actually a word in the original Greek. The word is “chi xi stigma,” with the last part, “stigma,” also meaning “to stick or prick.” Carl believes this is referring to a hypodermic needle when they poke into the skin to inject the microchip."

Mr. Sanders asked a doctor what would happen if the lithium contained within the RFID microchip leaked into the body. The doctor replied by saying a terrible sore would appear in that location. This is what the book of Revelation says:

"And the first (angel) went, and poured out his vial on the earth; and there fell a noisome and grievous sore on the men which had the mark of the beast, and on them which worshipped his image" (Revelation 16:2).

You can read more about it here--and to also understand the mystery behind the number 666: https://2ruth.org/rfid-mark-of-the-beast-666-revealed/

The third angel's warning in Revelation 14:9-11 states,

"Then a third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, 'If anyone worships the beast and his image, and receives his mark on his forehead or on his hand, he himself shall also drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out full strength into the cup of His indignation. He shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels and in the presence of the Lamb. And the smoke of their torment ascends forever and ever; and they have no rest day or night, who worship the beast and his image, and whoever receives the mark of his name.'"

"The coming of the lawless one (the Antichrist) is according to the working of Satan, with all power, signs, and lying wonders, and with all unrighteous deception among those who perish, because they did not receive the love of the truth, that they might be saved. And for this reason God will send them strong delusion, that they should believe the lie, that they all may be condemned who did not believe the truth but had pleasure in unrighteousness." (2 Thessalonians 2:9-12)"

Who is Barack Obama, and why is he still around?

So what's in the name? The meaning of someone's name can say a lot about a person. God throughout history has given names to people that have a specific meaning tied to their lives. How about the name Barack Obama? Let us take a look at what may be hiding beneath the surface.

Jesus says in Luke 10:18, "...I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven."

The Hebrew Strongs word (H1299) for "lightning": "bârâq" (baw-rawk)

In Isaiah chapter 14, verse 14, we read about Lucifer (Satan) saying in his heart:

"I will ascend above the heights of the clouds, I will be like the Most High."

In the verses in Isaiah that refer directly to Lucifer, several times it mentions him falling from the heights or the heavens. The Hebrew word for the heights or heavens used here is Hebrew Strongs 1116: "bamah"--Pronounced (bam-maw')

In Hebrew, the letter "Waw" or "Vav" is often transliterated as a "U" or "O," and it is primarily used as a conjunction to join concepts together. So to join in Hebrew poetry the concept of lightning (Baraq) and a high place like heaven or the heights of heaven (Bam-Maw), the letter "U" or "O" would be used. So, Baraq "O" Bam-Maw or Baraq "U" Bam-Maw in Hebrew poetry similar to the style written in Isaiah, would translate literally to "Lightning from the heights." The word "Satan" in Hebrew is a direct translation, therefore "Satan."

So when Jesus told His disciples in Luke 10:18 that He beheld Satan fall like lightning from heaven, if this were to be spoken by a Jewish Rabbi today influenced by the poetry in the book of Isaiah, he would say these words in Hebrew--the words of Jesus in Luke 10:18 as, and I saw Satan as Baraq O Bam-Maw.

The names of both of Obama's daughters are Malia and Natasha. If we were to write those names backward (the devil does things in reverse) we would get "ailam ahsatan". Now if we remove the letters that spell "Alah" (Allah being the false god of Islam), we get "I am Satan". Coincidence? I don't think so.

Obama's campaign logo when he ran in 2008 was a sun over the horizon in the west, with the landscape as the flag of the United States. In Islam, they have their own messiah that they are waiting for called the 12th Imam, or the Mahdi (the Antichrist of the Bible), and one prophecy concerning this man's appearance is the sun rising in the west.

"Then I saw another angel flying in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach to those who dwell on the earth—to every nation, tribe, tongue, and people— saying with a loud voice, 'Fear God and give glory to Him, for the hour of His judgment has come; and worship Him who made heaven and earth, the sea and springs of water.'" (Revelation 14:6-7)

Why have the words of Jesus in His Gospel accounts regarding His death, burial, and resurrection, been translated into over 3,000 languages, and nothing comes close (the Quran about 110 languages)? Because the same Spirit of God (YHVH) who created all people likewise transcends all people; therefore the power of His Word is not limited by people; while all other religions are man-made, therefore they tend to primarily stay within their own culture. The same God who speaks to all people through His creation of the heavens and earth that draws all people around the world likewise has sent His Word to the ends of the earth so that we may come to personally know Him to be saved in spirit and in truth through His Son Jesus Christ.

Jesus stands alone among the other religions that say to rightly weigh the scales of good and evil and to make sure you have done more good than bad in this life. Is this how we conduct ourselves justly in a court of law? Bearing the image of God, is this how we project this image into reality?

Our good works cannot save us. If we step before a judge, being guilty of a crime, the judge will not judge us by the good we have done, but rather by the crimes we have committed. If we as fallen humanity, created in God's image, pose this type of justice, how much more a perfect, righteous, and Holy God?

God has brought down His moral laws through the 10 commandments given to Moses at Mt. Siani. These laws were not given so we may be justified, but rather that we may see the need for a savior. They are the mirror of God's character of what He has written in our hearts, with our conscious bearing witness that we know that it is wrong to steal, lie, dishonor our parents, murder, and so forth.

We can try and follow the moral laws of the 10 commandments, but we will never catch up to them to be justified before a Holy God. That same word of the law given to Moses became flesh about 2,000 years ago in the body of Jesus Christ. He came to be our justification by fulfilling the law, living a sinless perfect life that only God could fulfill.

The gap between us and the law can never be reconciled by our own merit, but the arm of Jesus is stretched out by the grace and mercy of God. And if we are to grab on, through faith in Him, He will pull us up being the one to justify us. As in the court of law, if someone steps in and pays our fine, even though we are guilty, the judge can do what is legal and just and let us go free. That is what Jesus did almost 2,000 years ago on the cross. It was a legal transaction being fulfilled in the spiritual realm by the shedding of His blood with His last word's on the cross crying out, "It is finished!" (John 19:30).

For God takes no pleasure in the death of the wicked (Ezekiel 18:23). This is why in Isaiah chapter 53, where it speaks of the coming Messiah and His soul being a sacrifice for our sins, why it says it pleased God to crush His only begotten Son.

This is because the wrath that we deserve was justified by being poured out upon His Son. If that wrath was poured out on us, we would all perish to hell forever. God created a way of escape by pouring it out on His Son whose soul could not be left in Hades but was raised and seated at the right hand of God in power.

So now when we put on the Lord Jesus Christ (Romans 13:14), where God no longer sees the person who deserves His wrath, but rather the glorious image of His perfect Son dwelling in us, justifying us as if we received the wrath we deserve, making a way of escape from the curse of death; now being conformed into the image of the heavenly man walking in a new nature, and no longer in the image of the fallen man Adam.

Now what we must do is repent and put our trust and faith in the savior, confessing and forsaking our sins, and to receive His Holy Spirit that we may be born again (for Jesus says we must be born again to see and enter the Kingdom of God in John chapter 3). This is not just head knowledge of believing in Jesus, but rather receiving His words, taking them to heart, so that we may truly be transformed into the image of God. Where we no longer live to practice sin, but rather turn from our sins and practice righteousness through faith in Him in obedience to His Word by reading the Bible.

Our works cannot save us, but they can condemn us; it is not that we earn our way into everlasting life, but that we obey our Lord Jesus Christ:

Jesus says,

“Not everyone who says to Me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ shall enter the kingdom of heaven, but he who does the will of My Father in heaven. Many will say to Me in that day, ‘Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in Your name, cast out demons in Your name, and done many wonders in Your name?’ And then I will declare to them, ‘I never knew you; depart from Me, you who practice lawlessness!’ (Matthew 7:21-23)

"And having been perfected, He became the author of eternal salvation to all who obey Him." (Hebrews 5:9)

"Now I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away. Also there was no more sea. Then I, John, saw the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband. And I heard a loud voice from heaven saying, 'Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them, and they shall be His people. God Himself will be with them and be their God. And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes; there shall be no more death, nor sorrow, nor crying. There shall be no more pain, for the former things have passed away.'

Then He who sat on the throne said, 'Behold, I make all things new.' And He said to me, 'Write, for these words are true and faithful.'

And He said to me, 'It is done! I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End. I will give of the fountain of the water of life freely to him who thirsts. He who overcomes shall inherit all things, and I will be his God and he shall be My son. But the cowardly, unbelieving, abominable, murderers, sexually immoral, sorcerers, idolaters, and all liars shall have their part in the lake which burns with fire and brimstone, which is the second death.'" (Revelation 21:1-8)]]></wp:comment_content>

			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[rak_priamoi_kischki_hwpa]]></wp:comment_author>

			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[84.17.55.5]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2023-02-17 17:01:17]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2023-02-17 12:01:17]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Когда речь идет о раке, это может быть невероятно страшным и тяжелым испытанием. Но если вы столкнулись с раком прямой кишки в Германии, надежда есть. Благодаря достижениям в области медицинских технологий и опыту немецких врачей, лечение рака прямой кишки за последние годы прошло долгий путь <a href="https://doc-muenchen.de/lechenie/onkologiya/lechenie-raka-priamoi-kischki/" rel="nofollow ugc">https://doc-muenchen.de/lechenie/onkologiya/lechenie-raka-priamoi-kischki/</a>. В Германии рак прямой кишки лечат сочетанием хирургического вмешательства, химиотерапии и лучевой терапии. Хирургия часто используется для удаления опухолей или частей прямой кишки, пораженных болезнью. Химиотерапия помогает уменьшить опухоли до операции или после операции, когда это необходимо. Лучевая терапия также используется для уничтожения любых оставшихся после операции раковых клеток и помогает снизить риск рецидива. 
Процент успешного лечения рака прямой кишки в Германии очень высок благодаря тому, что эти методы лечения доступны в самых современных учреждениях по всей стране. Пациенты имеют доступ к уходу мирового класса со стороны опытных специалистов, которые понимают, как лучше лечить их состояние и обеспечить наилучший возможный результат для их здоровья. 
Мы очень благодарны немецким врачам за все, что они сделали для больных раком прямой кишки?—?они помогли стольким людям снова встать на ноги и жить более долгой и здоровой жизнью, чем когда-либо прежде!]]></wp:comment_content>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Machine Learning vs Artificial Intelligence: Which is better?]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/machine-learning-vs-artificial-intelligence/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 29 Jun 2022 18:51:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=946</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Machine learning and artificial intelligence are two of the most important technological developments of the past few decades, both garnering significant investments from tech giants like Google, Microsoft, and Apple as well as increasing interest from academic institutions. But what exactly do these terms mean? How are they used? And how do they differ from one another? In this article, we’ll answer all of those questions and more, so keep reading to learn more about machine learning vs artificial intelligence!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning are buzzwords you’ve probably heard used interchangeably – but there’s a lot of confusion about what these terms mean, how they differ, and when it’s appropriate to use one over the other. In this article, we break down the difference between AI and ML so you can be sure to use them correctly and effectively in your next project.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The Differences Between AI and ML<br>ML is a subset of AI and solves tasks that require human intelligence; however, artificial intelligence itself has been around since humans have. AI works to solve tasks that require human intelligence. Examples of artificial intelligence include computer vision—when we use software to identify objects in images or video—and natural language processing, which analyzes written text. Machine learning also falls under the umbrella of artificial intelligence, as it performs tasks that are difficult for humans but relatively easy for computers. Machine learning is capable of modeling and predicting patterns based on past data. Machine learning can also handle complicated systems with many inputs, like neural networks. On the other hand, artificial intelligence is often paired with machine learning for complex problems like stock market predictions. It's best to think of these two terms as siblings rather than twins because they do overlap quite a bit.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Why use ML over AI in business?<br>When it comes to technology, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) are two terms that are often used interchangeably. However, in practice, AI and ML are two very different beasts. Although there is an overlap between these technologies, they both have specific uses that set them apart from one another. Here you will learn how to use Machine Learning over AI in business to create a superior solution. A lot of people confuse Machine Learning with Artificial Intelligence, but the two technologies actually serve quite different purposes. In this blog post we’ll compare the two in detail and explain why Machine Learning may be more suitable for your needs than AI.<br>Machine learning is not only a field of study within computer science but also a way of designing programs by following certain steps that aim to produce human-like reasoning or behaviour without explicit programming. Whereas artificial intelligence is the theory and development of computer systems able to perform tasks which normally require human intelligence. With machine learning, computers can learn new skills as they are exposed to data whereas artificial intelligence relies on programmers who must painstakingly hand code every single rule their system must follow.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Basic understanding of how they are used<br>Although Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence are both essential for data scientists, it’s important to understand that they are fundamentally different in a lot of ways. In general, ML algorithms help data scientists generate insights from massive datasets in minutes while AI tools provide with platforms where developers can easily create predictive models. That being said, there are still some advantages and disadvantages when comparing these two technologies. So here we go with a guide on Machine Learning vs Artificial Intelligence…<br>With that in mind, let’s take a look at how Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence differ. Before we start talking about advantages and disadvantages of these two topics, it’s important to note that both ML and AI have their specific fields of application. This means that not every application can be developed using Machine Learning algorithms, nor does every problem benefit from machine learning algorithms.<br>Machine learning - Third Paragraph: Now, let’s go ahead and talk about what Machine Learning actually does. Machine Learning usually refers to an algorithm which doesn't need any human input but instead analyzes the data on its own and learns from the analysis. Machine Learning consists of three main components: collecting the data, parsing it and building algorithms based on it. The key point about Machine Learning is that this process isn't done by a person but by a machine that performs all the steps by itself.<br>Artificial intelligence - Third paragraph:<br>Machine learning vs artificial intelligence - Second paragraph</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Practical Examples<br>Machine learning, as its name suggests, uses computers to learn from data. Examples of machine learning algorithms include support vector machines (SVMs), feedforward neural networks, and AdaBoost. Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence (AI). AI techniques are used for planning and search in addition to playing games; applying machine learning; using genetic algorithms; and solving problems that require sensing, action, or perception. Artificial intelligence requires significant processing power to solve complex tasks quickly. In comparison, machine learning can be done on low-powered devices such as mobile phones. However, machine learning can be time-consuming because it has to process vast amounts of data before it can make any decisions. In contrast, artificial intelligence learns without being fed examples.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The Future of AI and ML<br>Machine learning and artificial intelligence will have a profound impact on our world in 2023. Machine learning, artificial intelligence, and deep learning algorithms—and combinations of all three—are being used to improve facial recognition technology; more accurately predict traffic patterns; and optimize delivery routes for local businesses, among other applications. The future of machine learning looks brighter than ever! How far do you think it’ll go over the next few years? Be sure to share your thoughts in the comments below!<br>With machine learning poised to change so many facets of our lives in so many ways, there’s no doubt that we can expect big things from machine learning by 2023. It seems only fitting that we take a look at some examples of machine learning today to get an idea of what kinds of advancements are already happening now—and what might happen over the next decade or two. What does ML look like today? What developments should we expect for tomorrow? Machine learning may be evolving at breakneck speeds, but the question remains: who will lead this movement? AI has made huge strides into machine learning as well. Is this just a competition to see who gets there first or is it possible for both AI and ML to exist harmoniously? We'll need to wait until 2023 before we know for sure.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[What is Cloning in Cyber Security]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/cloning-in-cyber-security/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 03 Aug 2022 06:18:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=957</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Cloning in Cyber Security:</strong> Cloning refers to an unauthorized duplication of an entity or object, often undertaken as an act of fraud or malice. It may refer to the copying of data, media, computer hardware, or other physical objects such as credit cards. Cloning may also refer to the copying of electronic data, such as bank account numbers or social security numbers or the identity information contained on government-issued identification documents. In cybersecurity, cloning refers to creating and using an unauthorized copy of someone else’s computer system in order to capture their data for fraud or espionage purposes, usually done by malware infection.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In cyber security, cloning is the process of taking a legitimate document and replacing its normal links with malicious ones. This can be done to phish for sensitive information or to spread malware.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Account Hijacking</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In the context of cyber security, cloning refers to the illegal practice of copying electronic data, such as bank account numbers. This data can then be used to commit fraud or other crimes. Cloning can also refer to the creation of duplicate accounts, which can be used to spread spam or malware. account hijacking. Electronic data may be copied by intercepting a wireless signal between two devices. A clone phone can also be created with a cheap device and an old SIM card for the target phone provider. It is not uncommon for individuals to unknowingly have more than one device on their account that are being used for unauthorized purposes. A carrier may detect this by noting an unusual number of messages from different people on one phone.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Cookie Manipulation</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In cybersecurity, cloning refers to creating and using unauthorized copy of someone else’s computer system. This can be done by copying all the files on a system, including the operating system, and then using that copy to create a new, identical system. Cloning can also be used to create an exact replica of a website or web application. Cookie manipulation is one way that attackers can clone a website.<br>The attacker first copies all cookies from your website, which are stored on a user’s computer. This includes authentication information that allows them to log into other websites using your login details. By using cookie manipulation, attackers can create a clone of your website and trick users into logging into their system instead of yours. The hacker then has access to your sensitive information without even needing to hack it - they simply stole it by having users login to their website instead of yours.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Password Reuse</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cloning in cyber security refers to the unauthorized copying of a website or server. This can be done by copying the entire website code and files, or by using a tool to create an identical copy of the site. Attackers can clone a website for many reasons, including to steal information or to distribute malware. One way that cloning can be used to steal information is through cookie manipulation. By cloning a website, an attacker can create a new site that looks identical to the original.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Weak Password Strength</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A weak password is a short, common, or easily guessed password. It's a subset of all possible passwords, and it's easily cracked by attackers. That's why weak password strength is such a big problem in cyber security. Using a weak password means that your account could be stolen or compromised at any time. And once someone has access to your email, you're not only putting yourself at risk but everyone who emails you. There are two types of attacks related to password reuse: phishing and credential harvesting. <a href="https://www.cybertalk.org/2022/01/14/what-is-clone-phishing-and-why-it-matters/" target="_blank" aria-label="Phishing  (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">Phishing </a>is an attempt to trick someone into revealing their personal information (like a username or password) while they're using an online service by sending them a fake website link under the guise of being legitimate with the intent to steal the victim's identity and other personal information.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Phishing Attacks</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>One of the most common cyber security threats is phishing. Phishing attacks can come in many forms, but typically involve hackers sending emails or creating websites that look identical to a legitimate site. Once the user enters their login credentials, the hacker can then access their account. cookie manipulation and weak password strength are two of the main ways that phishers are able to clone websites and trick users into entering their information.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Another way that hackers use cloning is through session hijacking. Session hijacking allows a hacker to access another person’s session when they log into an online account, even after they have closed their browser or turned off their computer. Weak password strength and cookie manipulation enable them to create a clone of your device that looks exactly like yours, so you can no longer tell if it’s real or not. When someone opens an email login page on their own device and logs in with a weak password, it’s possible for hackers to take over their device immediately. This forces you to stop what you are doing and begin changing your passwords and securing all of your accounts as soon as possible.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Read also: <a href="https://techodu.com/email-security/" class="ek-link">Email Sec</a><a href="https://techodu.com/email-security/" target="_blank" aria-label="urity (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">urity</a></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Automated Attacks</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Cloning in cyber security refers to the automated creation of identical or nearly identical copies of digital data or objects. This can be done for a variety of reasons, including to make it more difficult for defenders to track down the source of an attack, or to increase the chances that an attack will be successful. Cloning can also be used to create multiple copies of a file or program so that if one is lost or corrupted, others can be used as replacements.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Exploits</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A cross-site scripting (XSS) exploit is a type of attack that allows the attacker to inject malicious code into a web page. This code will then be executed by the victim's browser, allowing the attacker to steal sensitive information or take control of the victim's account. XSS exploits are often used in phishing attacks, where the attacker tricks the victim into clicking on a malicious link that contains the XSS code.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Denial of Service (DoS) Attacks</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A Denial of Service (DoS) attack is an attack meant to take down a website or online service by flooding it with so much traffic that it can no longer function. One type of DoS attack is called a distributed denial of service (DDoS) attack, which is when the attacker uses multiple computers to generate the flood of traffic. In some cases, attackers will clone a website or online service and use the clone to carry out the DoS attack. This is called a reflection attack.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Botnets</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A botnet is a collection of internet-connected devices, which may include personal computers, that are infected and controlled by a common type of malware. This malware allows attackers to take control of the devices and use them for malicious purposes, such as launching denial-of-service attacks or stealing sensitive information. Botnets can be very large, with some estimates suggesting that there are millions of infected devices around the world.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) Attacks</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A DDoS attack is a type of cyber attack that attempts to make a system or network unavailable by flooding it with Internet traffic from multiple sources. These attacks can be very difficult to defend against because they can come from anywhere in the world. DDoS attacks are often used to target high-profile websites or businesses, but they can also be used to target individuals. If you are the victim of a DDoS attack, you may experience slowdowns or complete loss of access to your website or online service.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[en_US]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Can You Work From Home With A Cyber Security Degree?]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/work-from-home-with-a-cyber-security-degree/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 Sep 2022 18:09:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=965</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Most security jobs require employees to work at an office, so you may be wondering if you can work from home with a cyber security degree. The short answer is yes – if you’re qualified and diligent, working from home can be one of the perks of having a cyber security degree and working in this industry. This article will tell you more about how to pursue <a aria-label="cyber security jobs that let you work from home (opens in a new tab)" href="https://apkodu.com/do-cyber-security-engineers-work-from-home/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link"><strong>cyber security jobs that let you work from home</strong></a>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you’re interested in working from home with your cyber security degree, it’s important to consider all of your options and figure out what sort of company will offer you the most flexibility in terms of where you can work from. For example, if you live close to the office, they may allow you to work from home occasionally, which can reduce your commute and give you the flexibility to take care of your family while still earning an income.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Do I Have To Leave My House For A Job In Cybersecurity?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You do not have to leave your house for a job in cybersecurity, because many cybersecurity jobs can be done from the comfort of your own home. However, before you start looking at specific job listings, you should consider if your location is currently supported by employers looking for employees. If there are no cyber security jobs near where you live, it will be difficult to complete assignments in-person when required. Cybersecurity jobs can require frequent travel and physical work like conducting onsite assessments or installing certain software programs in order to guarantee a business' safety from intruders. The cybersecurity jobs guide covers cybersecurity job description, cyber security salaries, cyber security government jobs, and more.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Should I Attend An In-Person Program Or Online School For Cybersecurity Certification?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>One of the big factors in determining if a cybersecurity certification program is right for you, is whether or not you want to be able to work from home with your cyber security degree. For many individuals, the idea of working from home may sound too good to be true and would be their preferred choice for getting started in this industry. The big question is: can you really work from home with a cyber security degree? The answer to that question is yes, but not all online or offline programs will offer such an opportunity. Some schools do have on-campus work-study opportunities that allow students who are at least 20 years old to bring their education directly into the workforce before graduating.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong><a href="https://techodu.com/cloning-in-cyber-security/" target="_blank" aria-label="Read also: What is Cloning in Cyber Security? (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">Read also: What is Cloning in Cyber Security?</a></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Depending on your age, if you attend an in-person school, you may be able to work from home with a cyber security degree. Students must adhere to some basic eligibility requirements and get approval from their instructors before beginning their program. This can give them valuable experience working with local businesses in their area and potentially allow them to build key relationships that could eventually lead to employment after graduation. Working as a student or teaching assistant at an in-person cybersecurity school is another way individuals can gain valuable experience before entering a high-demand field like cyber security.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Although most schools offer both online and offline programs, working from home with a cyber security degree is usually reserved for those who are attending an online school or are part of an online program.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Will An Entry Level Job Be Too Easy For Me To Handle Without Any Experience Or Training?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is a question many people ask themselves when they first consider working from home with a cyber security degree. But before you think about how to secure and defend networks, you need to develop your skillset by taking online classes, watching training videos and studying up on tips for your new career path. There are plenty of free resources available to people who have the self-discipline and motivation to do their own research, which makes starting out much easier than it used to be.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you do decide to work from home with a cyber security degree, make sure you have reliable internet access and proper working conditions. There are several types of jobs in cyber security that don’t require on-site time at all, so if your schedule is too restrictive, you can choose something that fits better with your life. Also, remember that just because it’s a job you can do in your pajamas doesn’t mean it won’t be demanding—it will be! It takes hard work and dedication to learn everything there is to know about how to secure and defend networks. That said, if you enjoy learning new things and making money online then working from home could be a great fit for you.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>How Much Do Salaries Really Vary By Location And Company Size?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Salaries are different for each company, but the location can have a huge impact on how much you will make. Generally, more metropolitan areas in the US pay more than rural areas of the country. The type of cyber security degree doesn't seem to affect salaries as much because not all cyber security jobs require a degree and in many cases those without degrees still demand higher salaries than workers with only high school diplomas or an associate's degree. What does effect salary is experience and expertise. When a person has both of these qualities they are able to command better pay that someone with less experience and understanding in their field.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Working for a larger company will provide more opportunities to get bonuses and raises, but a smaller cyber security degree is likely to pay better overall. Smaller companies are also a better choice if you're interested in work-from-home jobs because they may provide more leeway than larger companies that have specific guidelines on working remotely. If you want work flexibility, it's worth applying for positions with large companies even if their job descriptions specifically say they are seeking people with previous experience. Whether or not your background meets their needs, take the opportunity to explain why you'd be a good candidate for their cyber security degree. Point out any areas where your experience and expertise exceed what's required in their posting and tell them why working from home would be convenient for them as well as beneficial to you.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[what is human firewall in cyber security?]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/human-firewall-in-cyber-security/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 15 Sep 2022 18:49:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=969</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Human firewall in cyber security: A firewall is a network security system that monitors and controls the incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules and examines the content of each message to ensure the message contents conform to security policies. A firewall can be either software or hardware and acts as one layer in the hierarchical defense model known as the multilayered defense concept or principle (see, e.g., computer security). </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":1} -->
<h1><strong>What Is A Human Firewall (HF)?</strong></h1>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A Human Firewall can be your employees, those people who work for you and have the potential to be cyber threats themselves. We all know that malicious ransomware, created by cyber criminals to encrypt information and data on computers, has been a huge threat. While it does affect individual users, the most at-risk targets are corporations with data that criminals hope to steal. Ransomware victims who don't pay up and restore their computers' data are left without any of their files and no backup copies (human firewall in cyber security). In addition to prevention, defense against ransomware starts with proper monitoring of your network activity and computer systems. A Human Firewall can help mitigate damage caused by these attacks as well by making your employees aware and able protect themselves and your business against this type of cyber attack.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Read also: <a href="https://techodu.com/work-from-home-with-a-cyber-security-degree/" target="_blank" aria-label="Can You Work From Home With A Cyber Security Degree? (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">Can You Work From Home With A Cyber Security Degree?</a></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> In order to build a strong Human Firewall, you must train your employees. Educating them on how phishing attacks work and how to recognize them before they fall victim to these emails and attachments that are usually disguised as official notifications from a trusted source. It's important for everyone within your organization to be aware of cybersecurity threats so that if someone does fall prey to an attack, there will be additional eyes watching out for any signs of suspicious activity. By making employees an active part of your Human Firewall, they will feel empowered and learn that they are part of your company's success; not just cogs in its machinery. This will also motivate them to continue learning about cybersecurity threats and how they can protect themselves against them as well as help protect their employer.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>How To Build A Strong Human Firewall</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The human firewall is a security team composed of well-trained and highly engaged individuals who know their organization and their users inside and out. Human firewall members have a deep understanding of their organization's internal workings and know what makes each person tick--they are an extension of the company to customers, partners, and suppliers. In short, they are highly protective of your network and fight hard to keep it safe from intruders.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><a></a><strong>Why do organizations need Human Firewalls?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is because while many organizations rely on regular firewalls and software-based security, human firewall is the best first line defense. For example, a company with a large number of high-risk employees or very sensitive data is going to want to make sure that the people with access are trustworthy. Human firewall does this by looking at the employee’s background, education, training, and most importantly their track record. In doing so, it is able to understand what kind of risk they pose which in turn allows it to determine how much attention they need when approving new hires. By implementing human firewall as an additional layer of protection, companies can significantly reduce their risks and set themselves up for success.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> Unfortunately, most companies do not have human firewalls. This is because they believe it to be expensive and ineffective or that it just isn’t necessary. However, they fail to realize that without a human firewall they are opening themselves up to significant risks. For example, one of the first lines of defense for any organization should be its employees. If a potential employee has any sort of reputation as being untrustworthy or unethical (as determined by their track record), they should not be hired at all.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><a></a><strong>How To Use HF For Your Business</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The term human firewall refers to employees and their activities. In short, a human firewall builds protections into the business by adding additional levels of defense. This helps protect against phishing emails, social engineering, ransomware attacks and other hacking incidents. One way to protect an organization is to set up a sandbox or playground where any suspicious emails or files can be analyzed and data can be preserved while legal standards are being followed. Even when incidents happen at an organization it's important that your employees know how to respond effectively so you don't experience even more of a negative impact on your brand.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> Human firewall in cyber security: This month, Governor’s Cyber Security Awareness Month (GCSAM), is dedicated to educating employees about cybersecurity. GCSAM will raise awareness and encourage organizations and individuals to use effective cybersecurity practices. It's also a time when you can see how an employee would act as your human firewall by watching their behavior. A simple tip like not opening unsolicited emails or clicking on unknown links can help to ensure that your business doesn't experience an incident due to ineffective human firewall implementation.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><a></a><strong>Are You An HF Candidate Or Not?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Every time there is a major event in cybersecurity, an industry term or acronym will likely emerge. One such acronym that has popped up is the human firewall. The human firewall concept reflects the importance of educating people and developing skillsets to help protect their personal data and reduce the potential risk to large-scale attacks on organizations. Human firewall trainings are growing in popularity as one strategy for helping to mitigate risks and save money.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The recent proliferation of various types of malware ( ransomware being just one) underscores the need for cybersecurity awareness training with a focus on using caution when sending out information through emails, social media posts, files attachments or other avenues.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><a></a><strong>Benefits Of HF In Cyber Security</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A company's human firewall ensures that all employees within the business have strong awareness of cybersecurity threat landscape. All employees should understand what cybersecurity threats are and how to mitigate them. Human firewall programs typically include extensive employee training, well-defined responsibilities, effective policy management, and sanctions for those who violate the company's policies.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><a></a><strong>Why Is A Human Firewall Important For Cyber Security</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Human firewall in cyber security: In order to understand the importance of a human firewall, we need to first talk about cybersecurity awareness. People always seem to have a skewed perception of cybersecurity. We put all our trust into things like firewalls and antivirus software to protect us from things like ransomware or malware infection.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>What Can You Do To Protect Yourself From Data Thefts and Leaks</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The most basic step to protect yourself from the consequences of data theft is to create complex passwords and use different ones for each account. If you are using a company account, change your password often and make sure it's never something too obvious (human firewall in cyber security).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><a></a><strong>The Risks associated with Cyber Security</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>From data breaches to ransomware, cyber threats are a real risk for every company. Cybersecurity includes implementing measures to ensure that your information is safe from theft and being used for criminal purposes. One of the most important ways you can do this is by training your employees on cybersecurity best practices. As the employees will be exposed more often to threats, they'll become more vigilant and knowledgeable about what constitutes as a threat. This becomes a human firewall when they recognize dangerous actions and report them to the appropriate channels.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There are different types of firewalls based on their application or use case, as follows (see also list of firewall products)</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Sophos Firewall, </li><li><a aria-label="Check Point Next Generation Firewalls (NGFWs) (opens in a new tab)" href="https://www.checkpoint.com/quantum/next-generation-firewall/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">Check Point Next Generation Firewalls (NGFWs)</a>, </li><li>FortiGate, </li><li>WatchGuard Network Security, </li><li>SonicWall.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->]]></content:encoded>

		<title><![CDATA[How to Watch Pakistan vs England T20 Match in 2022]]></title>
		<link>https://techodu.com/watch-pakistan-vs-england-t20-match/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 30 Sep 2022 12:58:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://techodu.com/?p=974</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Watch Pakistan vs England T20 Match in 2022: </strong>If you’re planning on watching the Pakistan vs England T20 Match in 2022, there are many ways to do it in this post we are going to explain to you how you will watch it: attend the match live at the ground, watch it online through subscription, or watch it on TV through your local cable provider. In order to make the most out of your experience, however, you will want to consider these factors before making your decision.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Where Can You Watch?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":976,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://techodu.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/watch-pakistan-vs-england-t20-match-techodu-1024x536.jpg" alt="Watch Pakistan vs England T20 Match" class="wp-image-976"/><figcaption>Watch Pakistan vs England T20 Match </figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Pakistani cricket fans will be able to watch their team play and catch all the action on a number of different channels. The match will air live on Geo Super, which is geo's sports channel, as well as geo's website in English, Arabic and Urdu languages; PTV Sports, which is Pakistani state-run television station; Ten Cricket, which is available for purchase through cable or satellite providers; and also B4U Sports. These channels will also have audio feeds available in English and Hindi languages. You can find more information about any of these channels by going online or by checking their websites for updates on schedules and programming information.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Access the Live Stream from Anywhere</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>pak vs eng t20 live streaming<br>In order to watch the live stream of this match, you need to have access to a Pakistani ISP or be visiting from within Pakistan's territory at this time. You can also watch it on PTV Sports or any other channel that is showing it in your country.<br>If you don’t have a Pakistani IP address and want access to live stream cricket, you can easily bypass all geoblocks by using a VPN. These tools reroute your internet traffic through a different location, and you can usually change your virtual location freely if desired.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>How to watch on iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple TV</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Watching on iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Apple TV: <a href="https://cricwick.net/" target="_blank" aria-label="Cricwick  (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link"><strong>Cricwick </strong></a>is available only on the App Store for iPhone and iPad. Cricwick: Watch Live Cricket. To watch on your Mac, go to the App Store &gt; Updates tab. If you already have the app installed and it's not showing up as an update, search for it from the Apps tab. Click Get or Install from the bottom of the page.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Read also: <a href="https://techodu.com/work-from-home-with-a-cyber-security-degree/" target="_blank" aria-label="Can You Work From Home With A Cyber Security Degree? (opens in a new tab)" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="ek-link">Can You Work From Home With A Cyber Security Degree?</a></strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Once you've downloaded and opened Cricwick, click Watch Live Cricket on the bottom left of your screen. Next, click Start Watching on any match you want to watch. If you're watching a match that is still underway, use Live to watch it live or Replays for on-demand highlights and replays of recent matches at your convenience—the choice is yours! Finally, select where you want to view your content: if you're using an iPhone or iPad, you can watch it in portrait mode or full-screen landscape mode. You can also cast live matches from your phone or tablet directly onto your TV by clicking AirPlay Mirroring from within Cricwick's settings menu.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>How to watch on Android phones and tablets</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Pak vs Eng T20 games are usually broadcasted on different channels such as Geo TV and Star Sports, but you can also watch the game on your Android phone or tablet (<strong>Watch Pakistan vs England T20 Match in 2022</strong>). All you have to do is download and install a VPN, connect to a server outside of Pakistan and then watch live streaming on your device.<br>If you’re outside of Pakistan, you can also watch live streaming on your Android phone or tablet, but it will require a VPN. This is because Geo TV and Star Sports usually broadcast matches for a fee and not everyone can afford it. A VPN works by encrypting all of your data and routing it through another server before delivering it to your Android phone or tablet; which means that your local ISP will be unable to determine what you’re viewing online.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Can I Listen to Commentary?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Watching a cricket game without commentary would be like watching a football game without play-by-play. If you want to listen to commentary, you'll need a streaming service that offers it, such as Sky Sports Cricket or Willow TV(<strong>Watch Pakistan vs England T20 Match in 2022</strong>). You can also watch on TV if your cable or satellite provider offers it, but that would require your eyes and ears for two screens at once!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>To watch online, you'll need a broadband internet connection with a speed of at least 5 megabits per second or higher. Most people don't have such fast connections at home, but if you're connected to Wi-Fi, it's easy to get even more speed using a Wi-Fi booster—just make sure it can deliver on your chosen streaming service's minimum speed requirements. Once you're sure that your connection meets those needs, go ahead and choose what you want from Sky Sports Cricket or Willow TV; both services offer multiple passes so you can keep watching even after your first pass expires.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>How Will Streaming Work?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Pakistani Cricket fans will be able to watch shadab and babar live at home with their friends as they set off a thrilling innings of cricket as Pakistan take on England. The entire game will be streamed live and so won't just have a one-sided commentary! Every ball, run, shot and the wicket will be witnessed by Pakistani Cricket Fans who tune in live on Facebook Live or YouTube Videos while watching content from partner broadcasters around the world including Star Sports &amp; Ten Sports (<strong>Watch Pakistan vs England T20 Match in 2022</strong>). The broadcast can also be viewed on mobile devices via our free App which will show all matches with no ads making for an ad-free viewing experience.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><strong>Can I get Highlights?</strong></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Naseem Shah is a Pakistani cricket player who currently plays for Islamabad United and the national team. He is a right-handed batsman and occasional off spin bowler. As of 27th September 2018, he has played 12 Tests, 96 One Day Internationals, and 17 Twenty20 Internationals for his country, scoring 3231 runs with six centuries at an average of 31.93 with a top score of 146 not out.<br>Pakistan won by two wickets (DLS method) against England at the Oval on Sunday night. Shadab Khan picked up three for 22 in four overs and Hasan Ali took two for 15 as Pakistan restricted England to 190 all out from their 20 overs.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In reply, Fakhar Zaman top-scored with 43 runs off 39 balls as Pakistan reached their victory target with two wickets and six balls remaining. Shadab and Babar Azam took two wickets each for Pakistan, who won their fourth consecutive match at The Oval in London. This was also Khan's 100th ODI appearance for his country and it came in his hometown of London after a gap of four years due to injuries.</p>

<h3><strong><em>Best Laptops For Cyber Security</em></strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The number one concern for both consumers and corporations today is cyber security. The likelihood of a cyberattack rises as digitalization does,which is why getting the finest laptop for cyber security is crucial if you want to keep your data as secure as possible. Hackers won't be able to steal your information as a result. The best laptop for cyber security experts safeguards private data with top-notch security features like multi-factor authentication.</p>
